original: la lar ni mtha' yang dang pos zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /🔽'dir ni dang po ni tshangs ris kyi lha dag yin la /
analyzed: la lar ni mtha' yang dang pos zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / 'dir ni dang po ni tshangs ris kyi lha dag yin la /
translated: In some realms, the first and last are similar.🔽In some realms, the first and last are similar.

original: mtha' ni tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dag dang / tshangs pa chen po dag ste /🔽bde ba skye ba dang pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro //🔽la lar dang po yang mthas go ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /🔽'dir mtha' ni 'od gsal ba rnams te /
analyzed: mtha' ni tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dag dang / tshangs pa chen po dag ste / bde ba skye ba dang pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro // la lar dang po yang mthas go ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / 'dir mtha' ni 'od gsal ba rnams te /
translated: In some realms, the first and last are similar.🔽In some realms, the first and last are similar.🔽In some realms, the first and last are similar.

original: de smos pas de'i dang po'i tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de smos pas de'i dang po'i tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: In some realms, the first and last are similar.

original: bde ba skyes pa gnyis par 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba skyes pa gnyis par 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two are included in the second.

original: 'dir ni 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di dper brjod pa yin pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di dper brjod pa yin pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, the phrase “for example” is an example.

original: gcig dpe nyid du brjod na de'i rigs can gzhan yang yod na 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra de yang 'di na med do //
analyzed: gcig dpe nyid du brjod na de'i rigs can gzhan yang yod na 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra de yang 'di na med do //
translated: If one were to say that it is an example, then it would not be the case that the phrase “for example” would not exist in this context.

original: 'dir 'di lta ste 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba rnams yin no zhes ma gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir 'di lta ste 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba rnams yin no zhes ma gsungs te /
translated: Here, it does not say “for example, those who go to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.”

original: de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, the phrase “for example”

original: tshangs ris kyi lha dag lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha dag lta bu ste /
translated: “like the gods of the class of Brahmapurohita”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “for example”

original: 'od gsal gyi lha rnams lta bu zhes bya ba 'di ni nye bar sbyar du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi lha rnams lta bu zhes bya ba 'di ni nye bar sbyar du mi rung ngo //
translated: “like the gods of the class of Abhasvara” is not appropriate.

original: gal te 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra de dper brjod pa yin na ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gal te 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra de dper brjod pa yin na ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: If the phrase “for example” is an example,🔽“for example, humans and some gods”

original: mi rnams dang / lha kha cig go zhes bya ba 'dir thob par mi 'gyur ro //🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: mi rnams dang / lha kha cig go zhes bya ba 'dir thob par mi 'gyur ro // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: would not be obtained.🔽Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di mi rnams dang / lha kha cig dper gyur pa dag dang dpe las 'byung ba'i don 'ga' yang sbrel bar mi byed de /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di mi rnams dang / lha kha cig dper gyur pa dag dang dpe las 'byung ba'i don 'ga' yang sbrel bar mi byed de /
translated: The phrase “for example” does not connect the human beings and some gods who serve as examples with the meaning of the example.

original: lus tha dad cing 'du shes tha dad pa nyid ma lus pa dag bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus tha dad cing 'du shes tha dad pa nyid ma lus pa dag bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the phrase “for example” does not indicate that the human beings and some gods are examples.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni nye bar bstan pa'i don zhes bya ba la /🔽lus tha dad cing 'du shes tha dad pa de dag /'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis nye bar bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang mtha' smos pas de la sogs pa go'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni nye bar bstan pa'i don zhes bya ba la / lus tha dad cing 'du shes tha dad pa de dag /'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis nye bar bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang mtha' smos pas de la sogs pa go'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning of the phrase “for example.”🔽The phrase “for example” indicates that the human beings and some gods are examples.

original: dper na tshangs ris kyi lha lta bu ste zhes bya ba dang / 'od gsal gyi lha rnams lta bu ste zhes bya ba'i mdo'i 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di yang nye bar bstan pa'i don kho na yin no //
analyzed: dper na tshangs ris kyi lha lta bu ste zhes bya ba dang / 'od gsal gyi lha rnams lta bu ste zhes bya ba'i mdo'i 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di yang nye bar bstan pa'i don kho na yin no //
translated: In the same way, the phrase “for example” in the sutra passage “Just as the gods of Brahmakayika” and “Just as the gods of Abhasvara” also has the meaning of an example.

original: ha cang thal bas chog go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ha cang thal bas chog go zhes bya ba la /
translated: Enough of this extensive discussion!

original: sgra gcig don du ma dang ldan pa nyid kyis @179b gdon mi za bar 'dir nye bar bstan ba'i don yin pa'i phyir dpe'i don du mi 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa'i thal ba mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: sgra gcig don du ma dang ldan pa nyid kyis @179b gdon mi za bar 'dir nye bar bstan ba'i don yin pa'i phyir dpe'i don du mi 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa'i thal ba mthong ba yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the word “only” does not have the meaning of an example because it definitely has the meaning of indicating something else here.

original: srog bshad zin to //🔽srog dang mtshan nyid rnams dang ni //🔽zhes de'i mjug thogs su mtshan nyid rnams bstan pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: srog bshad zin to // srog dang mtshan nyid rnams dang ni // zhes de'i mjug thogs su mtshan nyid rnams bstan pa de'i phyir /
translated: Life has been explained.🔽The characteristics of the conditioned have been taught immediately after life.

original: mtshan nyid rnams dag ni skye ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams dag ni skye ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, the characteristics of the conditioned are birth, and so on.

original: 'dus byas su mngon no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus byas su mngon no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The conditioned is clearly manifest.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught as follows:

original: 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi ngo bo gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag go //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi ngo bo gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag go //
translated: Because they illuminate the nature of the conditioned, they are the characteristics of the conditioned.

original: bzlog pa ni zhes bya ba ni gang la med pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni zhes bya ba ni gang la med pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the unconditioned.

original: de la skye bas na chos de skyed par byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la skye bas na chos de skyed par byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to that, birth produces that dharma.

original: 'dis yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po rnams skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po rnams skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because things that are held by this endure.

original: gnas pas ni gnas par byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas pas ni gnas par byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: By means of duration, it causes endurance.

original: skyes la ma 'gags pa 'bras bu 'phen pa la gegs med par gnas par byed pa la nye bar gyur pa'i rgyu ni gnas pa yin pas gnas par byed do zhes bya ba'o //🔽rga bas ni rgas par byed do zhes bya bas ni stobs chung bar byed de /
analyzed: skyes la ma 'gags pa 'bras bu 'phen pa la gegs med par gnas par byed pa la nye bar gyur pa'i rgyu ni gnas pa yin pas gnas par byed do zhes bya ba'o // rga bas ni rgas par byed do zhes bya bas ni stobs chung bar byed de /
translated: The cause that is proximate to the endurance of that which has arisen and not yet ceased, which is the absence of obstruction to the projection of the effect, is duration, and thus it causes endurance.🔽By means of senescence, it causes aging.

original: 'jig pa la mngon du phyogs par gnas par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig pa la mngon du phyogs par gnas par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It causes endurance in the direction of destruction, which means it causes weakness.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni 'jig par byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni 'jig par byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: By means of desinence, it causes destruction.

original: 'du byed 'gog pa la lhan cig skyes pa'i rgyu khyad par du 'phags pa ni mi rtag pa nyid do //🔽mdo las gsum po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du byed 'gog pa la lhan cig skyes pa'i rgyu khyad par du 'phags pa ni mi rtag pa nyid do // mdo las gsum po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cause that is proximate to the cessation of formations is senescence, which is superior to the coemergent cause.🔽In the sutra, these three are said to be the characteristics of conditioned factors.

original: mdo las ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum gsungs so //
translated: In the sutra, these three are said to be the characteristics of conditioned factors.

original: gal te 'du byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi yin na ni der bzhi pa yang brjod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'du byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi yin na ni der bzhi pa yang brjod par 'gyur na /
translated: If there were four characteristics of the conditioned, a fourth would have been mentioned.

original: gsungs pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang ma yin la /
translated: But it was not mentioned.

original: mdo ni tshad ma yang yin te /
analyzed: mdo ni tshad ma yang yin te /
translated: And the sutra is authoritative.

original: de'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni gsum kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni gsum kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, there are only three characteristics of the conditioned.

original: bzhi pa ma bstan pa mi srid do snyam ste 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: bzhi pa ma bstan pa mi srid do snyam ste 'dri ba ni /
translated: The questioner thinks that it is impossible that a fourth was not mentioned, so he asks:

original: der gang zhig ma gsungs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: der gang zhig ma gsungs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “What was not mentioned there?”

original: gnas pa ni gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyi khyad par nyid du nye bar blangs pas 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du nye bar blangs so snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyi khyad par nyid du nye bar blangs pas 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du nye bar blangs so snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: He thinks that since duration is included as a specific transformation, it is included as a characteristic of the conditioned.

original: gnas pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba ni gnas pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba'o snyam du bsams nas /🔽'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: gnas pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba ni gnas pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba'o snyam du bsams nas / 'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Thinking that duration and transformation are duration and transformation,🔽he says, “In that case, duration and transformation would not be characteristics of the conditioned.”

original: 'di ni rga ba'i rnam grangs yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: 'di ni rga ba'i rnam grangs yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: This is an alternate term for aging.

original: ji ltar dngos po 'byung bas skye ba'i rnam grangs 'byung ba yin pa dang / dngos po 'jigs bas mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'jig pa yin pa de bzhin du dngos po gnas skabs gzhan du bsgrub pa'i @180a * //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po 'byung bas skye ba'i rnam grangs 'byung ba yin pa dang / dngos po 'jigs bas mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'jig pa yin pa de bzhin du dngos po gnas skabs gzhan du bsgrub pa'i @180a * //
translated: Just as emergence is a synonym for arising because it is the origin of things and destruction is impermanence because it is the disintegration of things, so too endurance is a synonym for abiding because it is the establishment of things in a different state.🔽

original: phyir gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni rga ba'i rnam grangs yin no //🔽mdo las ni yid byung ba'i phyir chos gang dag bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /

translated: Just as origination is a synonym for the arising of a thing, and impermanence is a synonym for the destruction of a thing, so too aging is a synonym for the transformation of a thing into another state.

original: mdo las bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin gyi /
analyzed: mdo las bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin gyi /
translated: The sutra states that the characteristics of conditioned states are origination,

original: mtshan nyid pa ma yin la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid pa ma yin la /
translated: cessation, and change due to decay, but it does not mention duration.🔽The sutra teaches these three characteristics with the intention of arousing disgust for conditioned states, because origination is the beginning of conditioned states, cessation is the end of conditioned states, and change due to decay is the decay of conditioned states while they are enduring.

original: ma 'ongs par gyur nas da ltar bar 'gyur ba dang / da ltar bar gyur nas 'das par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs par gyur nas da ltar bar 'gyur ba dang / da ltar bar gyur nas 'das par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
