original: skye bas ni 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: skye bas ni 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Birth, etc.

original: skye ba la sogs pa rnams la dus spo bar bya ba la nus pa yod do zhes bya bar ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa rnams la dus spo bar bya ba la nus pa yod do zhes bya bar ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How do you know that birth, etc. have the power to transfer to another time?

original: gal te de dag med na ji ltar 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa 'dus byas su rtogs /
analyzed: gal te de dag med na ji ltar 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa 'dus byas su rtogs /
translated: If they did not exist, how could the past and future be known to be conditioned?

original: 'dus ma byas kyang rang gi mtshan nyid la gnas pa yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /🔽de'i phyir gnas pas 'dus byas su mi rtogs te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang rang gi mtshan nyid la gnas pa yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la / de'i phyir gnas pas 'dus byas su mi rtogs te /
translated: Because unconditioned states also endure in their own characteristics.

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //🔽gnas pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi phyogs la brten pa'i phyir gdul ba rnams 'dus ma byas la yang 'dus byas ltar ram /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro // gnas pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi phyogs la brten pa'i phyir gdul ba rnams 'dus ma byas la yang 'dus byas ltar ram /
translated: Therefore, endurance does not make something conditioned because it is mistaken.

original: 'dus byas la yang 'dus ma byas ltar rtogs par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'dus byas la yang 'dus ma byas ltar rtogs par 'gyur na ni /
translated: Endurance is based on the side of conditioned and unconditioned states, and it is not suitable for disciples to think that unconditioned states are conditioned or that conditioned states are unconditioned.

original: mi rung bas the tshom mi za bar bya ba'i phyir de ma smos la /
analyzed: mi rung bas the tshom mi za bar bya ba'i phyir de ma smos la /
translated: Therefore, it is not mentioned in order to eliminate doubt.

original: gang dag 'dus byas mi 'khrul ba de dag ni mdo las 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: gang dag 'dus byas mi 'khrul ba de dag ni mdo las 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du gsungs so //
translated: Those that are not confused about the conditioned are said in the sutra to be the characteristics of the conditioned.

original: gnas pa dang rga ba bsdus te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gnas pa dang rga ba bsdus te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Stating “abiding and aging are included” and so on,

original: 'dir dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'dir dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: what is the purpose here?

original: de'i phyir / 'di dag ni nang na chags pa'i gzhi yin pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //🔽'di dag gi nang na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di dag ni nang na chags pa'i gzhi yin pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so // 'di dag gi nang na ste /
translated: Therefore it is said, “Because these are the bases of attachment within,” and so on.🔽These are within.

original: 'du byed kyi nang 'di na ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi nang 'di na ste /
translated: Within these formations,

original: gnas pa ni chags pa'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: gnas pa ni chags pa'i gzhi ste /
translated: abiding is the basis of attachment.

original: chags pa'i gnas yin pas gnas pa de la ma chags par bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas pa dpal dang 'dra ba 'di rna nag ma dang lhan cig tu ste /
analyzed: chags pa'i gnas yin pas gnas pa de la ma chags par bya ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas pa dpal dang 'dra ba 'di rna nag ma dang lhan cig tu ste /
translated: Because it is the abode of attachment, in order to be unattached to that abiding, the Bhagavān taught this abiding, which is like glory, together with Kṛṣṇa,

original: bkra shis ma dang lhan cig tu bstan to //
analyzed: bkra shis ma dang lhan cig tu bstan to //
translated: together with Śrī.

original: gang gi phyir bkra shis dang bkra shis ma ma yin pa bzhin du 'di yang mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir 'di la chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bkra shis dang bkra shis ma ma yin pa bzhin du 'di yang mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir 'di la chags par mi bya'o //
translated: Because like Śrī and aśrī, it is also connected with impermanence, one should not be attached to it.

original: de lta ma yin na ni gzhan du 'gyur ba tsam zhig gsungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni gzhan du 'gyur ba tsam zhig gsungs par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, it would be said that they are merely different from each other,

original: 'dir gnas pa'i tshig gis dgongs pa cung zad kyang mi rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir gnas pa'i tshig gis dgongs pa cung zad kyang mi rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the word “abide” would not be found to have any implication here.

original: de ltar bstan na 'dus byas kyi gnas pa @180b gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du mngon te /
analyzed: de ltar bstan na 'dus byas kyi gnas pa @180b gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du mngon te /
translated: If it is taught in this way, it is evident that the abiding of conditioned phenomena is their transformation,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi gnas pa la ni de med do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi gnas pa la ni de med do //
translated: because there is no such thing as the abiding of unconditioned phenomena.

original: skye ba la sogs pa de dag kyang rtsa ba'i chos ltar 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa de dag kyang rtsa ba'i chos ltar 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since arising, etc., are conditioned phenomena like the primary phenomenon, it follows that they also have other arising, etc.

original: de dag kyang skye ba'i skye ba la sogs zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /🔽kha cig nges par gzung bar bya ba'i don du de dag la de dag kho na yod kyi /
analyzed: de dag kyang skye ba'i skye ba la sogs zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / kha cig nges par gzung bar bya ba'i don du de dag la de dag kho na yod kyi /
translated: Some say: The arising of arising, etc.,🔽Some say: The word “also” is stated in order to ascertain that they exist only in those,

original: de dag la gzhan ni ma yin no zhes kyang gi sgra 'don par byed do //
analyzed: de dag la gzhan ni ma yin no zhes kyang gi sgra 'don par byed do //
translated: but not in others.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang las mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams gsungs she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang las mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams gsungs she na /
translated: From what scripture does the Lord teach the characteristics of conformity?

original: skye ba la sogs pa rnams 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dang / skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyang skye ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa rnams 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dang / skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyang skye ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because arising, etc. are conditioned, and because the arising of arising, etc. are of the nature of arising, etc.

original: 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon zhes bya ba la sogs par mtshan nyid kyi mdo de nyid las gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon zhes bya ba la sogs par mtshan nyid kyi mdo de nyid las gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t it stated in the sutra on the characteristics themselves that “conditioned arising is evident”?

original: ji ltar 'dir mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ma bsdus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ma bsdus par 'gyur te /
translated: How could the homogeneous characteristics not be included here?

original: thams cad la yang zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la yang zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says “in all cases.”

original: 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon la /
analyzed: 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon la /
translated: “Arising” is evident in conditioned arising.

original: yang gi sgras ni skye ba'i skye bar mngon te /
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni skye ba'i skye bar mngon te /
translated: The word “also” indicates that the arising of arising is evident.

original: gzhan gnyis la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan gnyis la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The other two are similar.

original: de lta ma yin na gsum ka la yang yang gi sgra gsungs pa la dgos pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gsum ka la yang yang gi sgra gsungs pa la dgos pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no point in using the word “also” three times.

original: re re la yang mtshan nyid bzhir 'gyur ba ma yin nam ;
analyzed: re re la yang mtshan nyid bzhir 'gyur ba ma yin nam ;
translated: Wouldn’t there be four characteristics for each?

original: mtshan nyid bzhi'i tshogs ni mtshan nyid bzhi'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bzhi'i tshogs ni mtshan nyid bzhi'o //
translated: The collection of four characteristics is four characteristics.

original: de dag la yang skye ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag la yang skye ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it would follow that they would also arise, etc.

original: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i chos bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i chos bzhin no //
translated: Because they are conditioned, they are like the primary phenomena.

original: yang na rtsa ba'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams la yang skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa dag khas blang bar mi bya'o zhe na ;
analyzed: yang na rtsa ba'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams la yang skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa dag khas blang bar mi bya'o zhe na ;
translated: Or, you should not accept that the primary arising, etc. also have arising of arising, etc.

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: That is not so.

original: de chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Because it is said, “It engages eight and one,” and so on.

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gnas pa dang byed pa yin pas 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gnas pa dang byed pa yin pas 'dri ba ni /
translated: The term engages refers to abiding and action.

original: 'jug pa zhes pa 'di ci zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes pa 'di ci zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore the question is, What is this called engaging?

original: phyi ma phyi ma bshad pa yin par bsams nas smras pa ni /
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma bshad pa yin par bsams nas smras pa ni /
translated: Thinking that the latter is an explanation of the former, he says,

original: byed pa ste skyes bu'i rtsal lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byed pa ste skyes bu'i rtsal lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Action is the power of a person.

original: de la skye ba chos brgyad la 'jug pa ni sor mo'i rtse mo dang / ral gri'i so la reg pa dang gcod pa ltar rang la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir bdag nyid ma gtogs pa chos gzhan brgyad ma 'ongs pa'i dus spo ba la brjod do //
analyzed: de la skye ba chos brgyad la 'jug pa ni sor mo'i rtse mo dang / ral gri'i so la reg pa dang gcod pa ltar rang la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir bdag nyid ma gtogs pa chos gzhan brgyad ma 'ongs pa'i dus spo ba la brjod do //
translated: With the exception of the self, the remaining seven dharmas that are drawn out by birth into the present are caused to endure.🔽Because they would not endure if they lacked the characteristics of birth.

original: gnas pa'i 'jug pa ni skye bas da ltar ba nyid du drangs pa'i @181a * //
analyzed: gnas pa'i 'jug pa ni skye bas da ltar ba nyid du drangs pa'i @181a * //
translated: The engagement of aging is like the drawing out of a sword from a scabbard.

original: tshe bdag nyid ma gtogs pa lhag ma gnas par byed pa ste /
analyzed: tshe bdag nyid ma gtogs pa lhag ma gnas par byed pa ste /
translated: With the exception of the self, the remaining seven dharmas that are drawn out by birth into the present are caused to endure.

original: skye ba'i mtshan nyid med par ni de dag gnas par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i mtshan nyid med par ni de dag gnas par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they would not endure if they lacked the characteristics of birth.🔽The engagement of aging is like the diminishing of the sharpness of a drawn sword.

original: rga ba'i 'jug pa ni gnas par gyur pa'i tshe bdag nyid ma gtogs pa'i nus pa 'joms par byed ba ste /
analyzed: rga ba'i 'jug pa ni gnas par gyur pa'i tshe bdag nyid ma gtogs pa'i nus pa 'joms par byed ba ste /
translated: With the exception of the self, the remaining seven dharmas that are drawn out by birth into the present and caused to endure are destroyed.

original: de lta ma yin na de dag bya ba byed pa'i nus pa ma bcom pa'i phyir 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de dag bya ba byed pa'i nus pa ma bcom pa'i phyir 'gag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because if that were not so, they would not cease, since their capacity to perform functions would not be destroyed.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'jug pa ni nus pa nyams pa'i tshe bdag nyid ma gtogs pa 'das pa'i dus su spo ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi 'jug pa ni nus pa nyams pa'i tshe bdag nyid ma gtogs pa 'das pa'i dus su spo ba'o //
translated: The activity of impermanence is to cause the passing away of the entity itself at the time of the exhaustion of its power.🔽The arising of arising and so on

original: skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa ni chos gcig la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa ni chos gcig la zhes bya ba la /
translated: arise in one entity.

original: skye ba'i skye ba ni skye ba kho na la 'jug gi / gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye ba ni skye ba kho na la 'jug gi / gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: The arising of arising operates in just arising and not in others.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid kho na la 'jug pa'i bar yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid kho na la 'jug pa'i bar yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true of the impermanence of impermanence operating in just impermanence.

original: skye ba la sogs pa rnams dang / skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams nus pa tha dad pas chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug pa nyid de /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa rnams dang / skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams nus pa tha dad pas chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug pa nyid de /
translated: Since arising and so on and the arising of arising and so on are different in power, they operate in just eight and one entities.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa yul mang ba dang / nyung ba can nyid yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa yul mang ba dang / nyung ba can nyid yin pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like the mental consciousness and eye consciousness that have many and few objects.

original: yang na khyim bya mo la la las ni phru gu mang du 'brang bar byed la /🔽la la las ni phru gu nyung bar byed pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yang na khyim bya mo la la las ni phru gu mang du 'brang bar byed la /🔽la la las ni phru gu nyung bar byed pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Or it is like a hen that produces many or few chicks from different eggs.

original: 'jig rten dang lung las grags pa'i phyir dper brjod pa nyid nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang lung las grags pa'i phyir dper brjod pa nyid nye bar bkod do //
translated: The example is cited in order to show that it is well known in the world and in the scriptures.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams dngos po pa ma yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams dngos po pa ma yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since the characteristics of the conditioned do not exist,

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra bar bskyod pa zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra bar bskyod pa zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: it is said that they are like space.

original: rnam par 'byed pa dang 'dra 'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa dang 'dra 'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: It is thought that they are like an analysis.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'am /
translated: Just as space cannot be analyzed,

original: mi rung ba de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa'i chos yod pa ma yin pa 'di dag kyang rnam par dbye bar mi nus shing mi rung ba yin no //
analyzed: mi rung ba de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa'i chos yod pa ma yin pa 'di dag kyang rnam par dbye bar mi nus shing mi rung ba yin no //
translated: or is not suitable to be analyzed, in the same way, these non-existent phenomena such as arising cannot be analyzed, or are not suitable to be analyzed.

original: ji ltar rnam par 'byed pa ltar zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par 'byed pa ltar zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for “just as an analysis,”

original: ji ltar rnam par 'byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par 'byed ce na /
translated: how is it analyzed?

original: skye bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa chos gzhan brgyad skyed par byed la /
analyzed: skye bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa chos gzhan brgyad skyed par byed la /
translated: Arising gives rise to eight phenomena, excluding itself.

original: skye ba'i skye bas ni de kho na skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i skye bas ni de kho na skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: The arising of arising gives rise to just that.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the others.

original: ci de dag rnam pa gzhan du rnam par phye ba las rdzas su yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci de dag rnam pa gzhan du rnam par phye ba las rdzas su yod dam zhe na /
translated: Are they substantially existent because they are distinguished in another way?

original: smras pa / ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin no //
translated: No, they are not.

original: 'o na tshig 'di la nus pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na tshig 'di la nus pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the force of this statement?

original: nus pa 'di yod de /
analyzed: nus pa 'di yod de /
translated: It has this force:

original: gzhan gyi bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos pos rdzas su yod pa dag tu rnam par phye na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos pos rdzas su yod pa dag tu rnam par phye na /
translated: If they are distinguished as substantially existent by the fact of being the basis of other activities and agents,

original: bya ba dang byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba tsam gyi @181b sgo nas de dag rdzas su yod par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba tsam gyi @181b sgo nas de dag rdzas su yod par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: then they are not substantially existent merely by the distinction of being the basis of activities and agents.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /🔽mngon sum mam /🔽rjes su dpag gam /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / mngon sum mam / rjes su dpag gam /
translated: What then?🔽They are by direct perception,🔽by inference,

original: yid ches ba'i lung las yin no //
analyzed: yid ches ba'i lung las yin no //
translated: or by trustworthy scripture.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma med pa'i phyir te 'chad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma med pa'i phyir te 'chad do //
translated: Therefore, because there is no valid cognition, it is explained.

original: tshig tsam la dad par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir rgyu dris pa ni /
analyzed: tshig tsam la dad par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir rgyu dris pa ni /
translated: Since one should not have faith in mere words, the reason is asked:

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why?

original: tshad ma med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Because there is no valid cognition.

original: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: The phrase “like form, etc.” is an example of a dissimilar case.

original: de la re zhig gzugs yod pa nyid la ni tshad ma mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: de la re zhig gzugs yod pa nyid la ni tshad ma mngon sum yin no //
translated: In this regard, the existence of form is established by direct perception.

original: mig yod pa nyid la ni mig gi rnam par shes pa rjes su dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: mig yod pa nyid la ni mig gi rnam par shes pa rjes su dgag pa yin no //
translated: The existence of the eye is established by the eye consciousness.

original: gzugs dang ba zhes bya ba ni lung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs dang ba zhes bya ba ni lung ngo //
translated: The phrase “the clarity of form” is scriptural authority.

original: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same method of interpretation should be applied to sound, etc.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dag ni ming la sogs pas gzung bar bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dag ni ming la sogs pas gzung bar bya ba ma yin la /
translated: Birth, etc., are not apprehended by means of name, etc.

original: de dag yod pa nyid la nus pa dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag yod pa nyid la nus pa dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there an inference that is capable of establishing their existence,

original: rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no logical mark.

original: rdzas su yod pa nyid la lung yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa nyid la lung yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is there a scriptural authority that establishes their substantial existence.

original: ci gang las btags par yod pa nyid du 'gyur ba de dag btags par yod pa nyid la tshad ma yod dam zhe na yod de /
analyzed: ci gang las btags par yod pa nyid du 'gyur ba de dag btags par yod pa nyid la tshad ma yod dam zhe na yod de /
translated: Are there any means of valid knowledge that establish the nominal existence of those things that exist nominally?

original: chos gang dag rdzas su yod pa nyid la tshad ma dmigs shing /
analyzed: chos gang dag rdzas su yod pa nyid la tshad ma dmigs shing /
translated: One should ascertain that those things that are observed by valid knowledge to exist substantially and

original: yod do zhes bya bar yang kun du tha snyad 'dogs pa de dag ni btags par yod pa yin te /
analyzed: yod do zhes bya bar yang kun du tha snyad 'dogs pa de dag ni btags par yod pa yin te /
translated: are also designated as existent are imputedly existent,

original: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: like a vase and so on.

original: 'o na gang mdo las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /🔽skye ba la sogs pa rnams rdzas su yod pa nyid la lung ni /
analyzed: 'o na gang mdo las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / skye ba la sogs pa rnams rdzas su yod pa nyid la lung ni /
translated: If you say that the sūtra says that they exist,🔽then the sūtra says that conditioned states arise,

original: mdo las 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no zhe na /🔽lung 'di yod mod kyi /
analyzed: mdo las 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no zhe na / lung 'di yod mod kyi /
translated: and so on, in order to indicate that arising and so on exist substantially.

original: 'dus byas kyi skye ba la sogs pas pa dag rdzas su yod do zhes bya ba 'di 'di'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi skye ba la sogs pas pa dag rdzas su yod do zhes bya ba 'di 'di'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: This sūtra exists, but its meaning is not that the arising and so on of conditioned states exist substantially.

original: tshig shes pa ni lha rnams dga' ba yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tshig shes pa ni lha rnams dga' ba yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Those who know the words are the delight of the gods.

original: tshig shes pa ni gang dag rig byed kyi tshig tshad mar byed pa de dag yin te /
analyzed: tshig shes pa ni gang dag rig byed kyi tshig tshad mar byed pa de dag yin te /
translated: Those who know the words are those who take the words of the Vedas as valid knowledge.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni don gyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung ni don gyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the speech of the Buddha is distinguished by its meaning.

original: gang dag lung dang / rtogs pa dang ldan pa grol ba'i bdag nyid can de dag ji ltar na tshig shes pa yin /
analyzed: gang dag lung dang / rtogs pa dang ldan pa grol ba'i bdag nyid can de dag ji ltar na tshig shes pa yin /
translated: How can those who are liberated in their very nature, and who possess the scriptures and understanding, be ignorant of the letter?🔽The Lord has said that one should rely on the meaning, not on the letter.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis don la rton par gsungs so zhes bya ba ni don la rton par bya'i tshig 'bru la ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis don la rton par gsungs so zhes bya ba ni don la rton par bya'i tshig 'bru la ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: The Lord has said that one should rely on the meaning, not on the letter.

original: 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa @182a * //
analyzed: 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin pa @182a * //
translated: What is the meaning of the statement that the conditioned is perceived as arising, etc.?

original: 'di'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: ma rig pas mdongs pa'i byis pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma rig pas mdongs pa'i byis pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The foolish, obscured by nescience,

original: byis pa dang 'dra ba ni byis pa rnams te /
analyzed: byis pa dang 'dra ba ni byis pa rnams te /
translated: The foolish are like the foolish,

original: bya ba dang nga bya ba ma yin pa mi shes pa'i phyir na mu stegs can rnams so //
analyzed: bya ba dang nga bya ba ma yin pa mi shes pa'i phyir na mu stegs can rnams so //
translated: because they do not know what should and should not be done.

original: 'du byed gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyun skye ba gcig gam gnas skabs kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'du byed gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyun skye ba gcig gam gnas skabs kyi khyad par ro //
translated: The stream of formations, such as form, feeling, etc., is the arising of a single life or a particular state.

original: mi shes pa'i gnyid kyis blo'i mig zum pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi rgyun bye brag nges par dka' ba gcig nyid du lhag par zhen cing /
analyzed: mi shes pa'i gnyid kyis blo'i mig zum pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi rgyun bye brag nges par dka' ba gcig nyid du lhag par zhen cing /
translated: Those whose eyes of intelligence are closed by the sleep of nescience cling to the continuity of the aggregates as a single, definite entity.

original: bdag gi snyam du sems kyi /
analyzed: bdag gi snyam du sems kyi /
translated: They think, “This is mine.”

original: ma rig pas blo'i mig nyams par byas pa'i phyir rgyu yin no snyam du mi rtogs so ;
analyzed: ma rig pas blo'i mig nyams par byas pa'i phyir rgyu yin no snyam du mi rtogs so ;
translated: They do not understand that the aggregates are the cause of the self, because the eyes of their intelligence are impaired by nescience.

original: / de'i phyir de la rtag pa dang gcig nyid du 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bdag dang bdag gir mos pa yin la /
analyzed: / de'i phyir de la rtag pa dang gcig nyid du 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bdag dang bdag gir mos pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the belief in “I” and “mine” precedes the grasping of “self” and “mine.”

original: de las de la srid pa skye zhing /
analyzed: de las de la srid pa skye zhing /
translated: From that, craving arises for the self and “mine.”

original: de dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pas mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: de dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pas mngon par zhen te /
translated: One clings to them, desiring not to be separated from them.

original: chags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of “attachment.”

original: de zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gir mos ba ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gir mos ba ste /
translated: “That” refers to the belief in “I” and “mine.”

original: bzlog par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyis ni 'dus byas nyid 'chad pa yin te /
analyzed: bzlog par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid kyis ni 'dus byas nyid 'chad pa yin te /
translated: “In order to reverse” means in order to abandon.

original: 'dus byas nyid bstan pas bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid bstan pas bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The teaching of the conditioned itself causes the grasping of “I” and “mine” to be reversed.

original: 'dus byas nyid de yang skye ba la sogs pa bstan pa med par shes par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid de yang skye ba la sogs pa bstan pa med par shes par mi nus pa'o //
translated: Moreover, that conditioned itself cannot be known without the teaching of arising, etc.

original: de'i phyir / gsum po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par bshad do //🔽yang ji ltar mtshan nyid 'di dag rgyun kho na la bshad kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gsum po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par bshad do // yang ji ltar mtshan nyid 'di dag rgyun kho na la bshad kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is explained in detail: “These three . . .”

original: skad cig la ma yin par shes she na /
analyzed: skad cig la ma yin par shes she na /
translated: Moreover, how is it known that these characteristics are explained only in relation to a continuum, and not in relation to a moment?

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: skad cig ma la ni skye ba la sogs pa mi mngon no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skad cig ma la ni skye ba la sogs pa mi mngon no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said: “Arising, etc. are not evident in a moment.”

original: skad cig ma nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid nges par ma zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because momentariness is not ascertained.

original: bsdus par yang min te /
analyzed: bsdus par yang min te /
translated: Nor is it in a collection,

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are mutually exclusive.

original: skad cig ma la mi mngon pa dag ni de'i mtshan nyid yin par 'os pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma la mi mngon pa dag ni de'i mtshan nyid yin par 'os pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not appropriate that what is not evident in a moment is its characteristic.

original: 'dis mtshon par byed pas na mtshan nyid yin na ;
analyzed: 'dis mtshon par byed pas na mtshan nyid yin na ;
translated: If it is a characteristic because it is that which causes the representation of a moment,

original: rang nyid ma shes pas ni gzhan mtshon par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid ma shes pas ni gzhan mtshon par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: One who does not understand himself cannot indicate another.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo de las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo de las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, the sutra states

original: gang gi phyir rgyun la skye ba la sogs pa dag mngon gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyun la skye ba la sogs pa dag mngon gyi /
translated: because arising, etc. are manifest in a continuum,🔽but not in a moment.

original: skad cig ma la ma yin pa de'i phyir mdo las /
analyzed: skad cig ma la ma yin pa de'i phyir mdo las /
translated: Therefore, the sutra states:

original: 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung @182b ngo ;
analyzed: 'dus byas skye bar yang mngon zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung @182b ngo ;
translated: “Arising of conditioned states is manifest.”🔽If arising were manifest in a moment, then the sutra would state:

original: / gal te mdor skad cig la mngon par bzhed par 'gyur na ni de'i phyir skye pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: / gal te mdor skad cig la mngon par bzhed par 'gyur na ni de'i phyir skye pa yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin /
translated: “Arising is a characteristic of conditioned states,

original: 'jig pa dang / gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yang mtshan nyid yin zhes de skad gsungs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang / gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yang mtshan nyid yin zhes de skad gsungs par 'gyur na /
translated: cessation and duration-change are also characteristics.”

original: gsungs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it does not state that,

original: skad cig la mi mngon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig la mi mngon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not manifest in a moment.

original: yang 'dus byas gnyis pa zhes smos pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang 'dus byas gnyis pa zhes smos pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Again, the second characteristic of conditioned states is

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no zhes 'dus byas smos pa gnyis pa ni 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar shes par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no zhes 'dus byas smos pa gnyis pa ni 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar shes par byas pa yin te /
translated: The second expression “conditioned” is for the purpose of understanding that these are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the characteristics of conditioned phenomena are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: de lta ma yin na gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig gsungs bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig gsungs bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Otherwise, the text would simply say “these three are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.”

original: 'di dag ni chu dang chu skyar lta bur 'dus byas kyi yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no snyam du dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni chu dang chu skyar lta bur 'dus byas kyi yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dag yin no snyam du dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And one might think that these are the characteristics of the existence of conditioned phenomena, like the water and the heron.

original: 'di ni chos mi mthun pa'i sgo nas dpe yin no //🔽ji ltar chu skyar chu yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni chos mi mthun pa'i sgo nas dpe yin no // ji ltar chu skyar chu yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: This is an example of a dissimilar type.🔽Just as a heron is a characteristic of the existence of water, but not of water itself,

original: chu nyid kyi ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di dag kyang 'dug byas kyi yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: chu nyid kyi ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di dag kyang 'dug byas kyi yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: so these are characteristics of the existence of conditioned phenomena, but not of conditioned phenomena themselves.

original: 'dus byas nyid kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur la /
translated: It should be understood that they are characteristics of conditioned phenomena, not of conditioned phenomena themselves.

original: yang na bu mo'i mtshan nyid ni dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na bu mo'i mtshan nyid ni dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyi yin gyi /
translated: Or, the characteristics of a girl are her virtue and nonvirtue,🔽not her being a girl.

original: bu mo nyid kyi ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: bu mo nyid kyi ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, it should be understood that the characteristics of virtue and nonvirtue are characteristics of conditioned phenomena,

original: 'dus byas nyid kyi ni ma yin no snyam du shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid kyi ni ma yin no snyam du shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: not of conditioned phenomena themselves.

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba smos pa gnyis pas ni 'di dag 'dus byas nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba smos pa gnyis pas ni 'di dag 'dus byas nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: The second mention of “conditioned” indicates that these are characteristics of conditioned phenomena themselves,

original: yod pa nyid kyi ma yin zhing /
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyi ma yin zhing /
translated: not of existence,

original: dge ba dang mi dge pa nyid kyi ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge pa nyid kyi ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par byas pa yin no //
translated: nor of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: 'dus byas nyid ni rgyu dang rkyen dag gis 'dus nas byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid ni rgyu dang rkyen dag gis 'dus nas byas pa nyid do //
translated: Conditioned phenomena are produced through the combination of causes and conditions.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa rnams skad cig ma ltar rgyun la yang rnam par gzhag pa dang / mngon par mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa rnams skad cig ma ltar rgyun la yang rnam par gzhag pa dang / mngon par mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: Birth, etc., are not established as momentary, nor as a continuum, because they do not exist.

original: skye ba la sogs pa med do zhes de skad du sus smras /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa med do zhes de skad du sus smras /
translated: Who says that birth, etc., do not exist?

original: ji ltar rnam par 'byed pa de ltar med do zhes smras kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par 'byed pa de ltar med do zhes smras kyi /
translated: We say that they do not exist as they are discriminated,

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis med par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not that they do not exist in any way at all.

original: de ltar na gal te rgyun gyi skye ba ni gang yin /🔽@183a * // 'jig pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te rgyun gyi skye ba ni gang yin / @183a * // 'jig pa ni gang yin /
translated: Thus, if you ask, “What is the birth of a continuum?

original: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: What is its destruction? What is its duration? What is its transformation? ”🔽we reply:

original: de'i phyir de la rgyun gyi dngos po ni skye ba yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la rgyun gyi dngos po ni skye ba yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: The birth of a continuum is the origination of a cause.🔽The destruction of a continuum is the cessation of a cause.🔽The duration of a continuum is the presence of a cause.🔽The transformation of a continuum is the alteration of a cause.

original: yang rgyun zhes bya ba ni gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang rgyun zhes bya ba ni gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is a continuum?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dus tha mi dang cing /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dus tha mi dang cing /
translated: It is a series of causes and effects that are not interrupted in terms of time,

original: yul rnam par ma chad pa rnams gcig nyid du brjod cing 'dzin pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yul rnam par ma chad pa rnams gcig nyid du brjod cing 'dzin pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: and are not interrupted in terms of place, and are described and apprehended as a unity.

original: dper na nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag gi mi dang / myu gu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag gi 'bru bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag gi mi dang / myu gu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dag gi 'bru bzhin no //
translated: For example, a human being in the states of kalala, etc. , and a grain in the states of sprout, etc.

original: de ni btags pa'i nye bar len pa dag las gzhan pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ni btags pa'i nye bar len pa dag las gzhan pa ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not different from the appropriated aggregates,

original: gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it non-different from them,

original: rdzas su yod pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would then follow, absurdly, that it would be substantially existent.

original: med pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not nonexistent,

original: bden pa gnyis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two truths are accepted.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa yod pa nyid du ni 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa yod pa nyid du ni 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The conventional and ultimate truths are accepted as existent.

original: rgyun gyi dang po ni skye ba yang yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyun gyi dang po ni skye ba yang yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first of a continuum is also birth.

original: dang po ni skad cig ma thog ma ste /
analyzed: dang po ni skad cig ma thog ma ste /
translated: The first is the first moment,

original: de nas rgyun 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas rgyun 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the continuum proceeds from that.

original: gang du skyes pa'o snyam du mngon par 'gyur ba de ni dang po ste /
analyzed: gang du skyes pa'o snyam du mngon par 'gyur ba de ni dang po ste /
translated: That is the first,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as it is said:

original: skye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is birth?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi dang po skye ba de ni skye ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyi dang po skye ba de ni skye ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Cessation is the passing away of that which is produced.

original: ldog pa ni 'jig pa yin no zhes bya ba la /🔽rgyun gyi zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: ldog pa ni 'jig pa yin no zhes bya ba la / rgyun gyi zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The passing away of that which is produced is cessation.🔽The passing away of a continuum is the disintegration of a continuum.

original: skad cig ma snga ma zhig pa dang / skad cig ma phyi ma nying mtshams mi sbyor ba ni ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma zhig pa dang / skad cig ma phyi ma nying mtshams mi sbyor ba ni ldog pa yin te /
translated: The passing away of a moment is the non-continuation of a moment.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'chi ba gang zhen /
analyzed: 'chi ba gang zhen /
translated: What is death?

original: sems can gyi ris de nas 'chi 'pho zhing 'pho ba nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi ris de nas 'chi 'pho zhing 'pho ba nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is the passing away and transference of sentient beings from that class of sentient beings.

original: rgyun de nyid rjes su 'jug pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyun de nyid rjes su 'jug pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The continuation of that continuum is the persistence of that which is produced.

original: de rjes su 'jug pa yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de rjes su 'jug pa yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the continuation of that?

original: rgyun rjes su 'jug pa ni skad cig ma snga ma zhig pa'i tshe skad cig ma phyi ma phyi mas bdag nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun rjes su 'jug pa ni skad cig ma snga ma zhig pa'i tshe skad cig ma phyi ma phyi mas bdag nyid thob pa'o //
translated: The continuation of a continuum is the attainment of a later moment by the passing away of an earlier moment.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i snga phyi ste /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i snga phyi ste /
translated: The persistence of that is the duration of that which is produced.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag mi 'dra ba nyid kyi ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag mi 'dra ba nyid kyi ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is the transformation of the continuum that is the difference between cause and effect.

original: rgyun gyi zhes bya ba ni thams cad la sbyar te /🔽skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun gyi zhes bya ba ni thams cad la sbyar te / skabs su bab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “continuum” is applied to all of these.🔽It is the most relevant here.

original: yang na snga ma las phyi ma'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: yang na snga ma las phyi ma'i bye brag ste /
translated: Or, the difference between the later and earlier moments is the difference between cause and effect.

original: rgyu'i skad cig las 'bras bu'i bye brag ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu'i skad cig las 'bras bu'i bye brag ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, “The difference between the later and earlier moments is the difference between cause and effect.”

original: de lta yin pas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rgyun nyid @183b rjes su 'jug pa ni gnas pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: de lta yin pas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rgyun nyid @183b rjes su 'jug pa ni gnas pa yin pa'am /
translated: Since this is the case, the continuum itself is endurance.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dag rgyun gyi mtshan nyid du bshad kyi skad cig ma'i ma yin pas so //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dag rgyun gyi mtshan nyid du bshad kyi skad cig ma'i ma yin pas so //
translated: Or, arising and so on are explained as the characteristics of the continuum, not of a momentary phenomenon.

original: rigs kyi bu dga' ba'i tshor ba ni rig bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dga' ba'i tshor ba ni rig bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Son of noble family, when you experience a feeling of joy, you are aware of it.

original: rig bzhin pa'i skad cig ma ni dus phyi nas gnas mi srid de /
analyzed: rig bzhin pa'i skad cig ma ni dus phyi nas gnas mi srid de /
translated: It is not possible for a moment of awareness to endure in a later time,

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is momentary.

original: tsher ba'i rdzas gcig ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i dus dag tu sems gcig gis rig pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: tsher ba'i rdzas gcig ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i dus dag tu sems gcig gis rig pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The substance of feeling is not cognized by the same mind at the time of its origination, continuance, and cessation.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa khas ma blangs pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo rig pa yang yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa khas ma blangs pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo rig pa yang yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not cognized by itself, because we do not accept that it acts upon itself.

original: mngon sum du byas par gyur pa la rig par khas len na yang dga' bo la gzhan dag pas ci zhig gsungs par 'gyur /
analyzed: mngon sum du byas par gyur pa la rig par khas len na yang dga' bo la gzhan dag pas ci zhig gsungs par 'gyur /
translated: If you accept that it is cognized when it is manifest, then what is the point of saying that it is cognized by another, as in the case of Nanda?

original: de'i phyir rgyun kho na'i dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyun kho na'i dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Therefore, the Lord, referring only to the continuum, said:

original: rigs kyi bu dga' bo'i tshor ba ni rig bzhin du skye'o zhes par gsungs kyi /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dga' bo'i tshor ba ni rig bzhin du skye'o zhes par gsungs kyi /
translated: “Son of good family, Nanda’s feeling arises while being cognized.”

original: skad cig la ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: skad cig la ni ma yin no ;
translated: He did not say that it is cognized in each moment.

original: / bshad ma thag pa'i don nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / bshad ma thag pa'i don nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Two verses to restate the point just made:

original: rgyun gyi dang po skye ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyun gyi dang po skye ba yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The first of a continuum is origination.

original: thams cad don go bar zad do //
analyzed: thams cad don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning is self-evident.

original: chad pa 'jig pa zhes bya ba 'dir snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chad pa 'jig pa zhes bya ba 'dir snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Annihilation” and “destruction” are as above.

original: gnas pa de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas pa de zhes bya ba la /
translated: “The endurance of that” means

original: rgyun de nyid gnas pa yin na ni /
analyzed: rgyun de nyid gnas pa yin na ni /
translated: if the endurance is of that very continuum,

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni rgyun da nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni rgyun da nyid kyi'o //
translated: “that very” refers to the continuum itself.

original: snga phyi'i bye brag ces bya ba la snga ma ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: snga phyi'i bye brag ces bya ba la snga ma ni rgyu'o //
translated: “The difference between prior and subsequent” means that the prior is the cause and

original: phyi ma ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: phyi ma ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: the subsequent is the effect.

original: rgyu las 'bras bu'i rigs mi mthun pa skye ba zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽sngon med las byung skye ba ste //
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu'i rigs mi mthun pa skye ba zhes bya ba'i don to // sngon med las byung skye ba ste //
translated: The meaning is that an effect arises from a cause that is dissimilar to it.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Arising is the occurrence of what did not previously exist.”🔽The meaning is

original: don ni de nyid du zad do //
analyzed: don ni de nyid du zad do //
translated: the same as before.

original: rnam grangs gzhan gyis bshad pa ste //🔽sngon med las byung skye ba ste //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan gyis bshad pa ste // sngon med las byung skye ba ste //
translated: This is an explanation by way of another enumeration.

original: zhes bya ba ni ma byung ba las byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma byung ba las byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Arising is the occurrence of what did not previously exist” means the occurrence of what did not exist before.

original: rgyun gnas zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyun gnas zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “The endurance of a continuum” is as before.

original: de chad 'jig pa yin zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad pa'o //🔽skad cig ma yi chos la ni //
analyzed: de chad 'jig pa yin zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad pa'o // skad cig ma yi chos la ni //
translated: “Its annihilation is its destruction” means the destruction of the continuum.

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: “In momentary phenomena” is explained in detail.

original: skad cig ma'i chos ni gnas pa med par 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i chos ni gnas pa med par 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: A momentary phenomenon is destroyed without abiding.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i gnas pa khas len pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i gnas pa khas len pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, its abiding is accepted.

original: chos de yang gnas pa med du zin yang 'jig par 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: chos de yang gnas pa med du zin yang 'jig par 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: Even though that phenomenon does not abide, it is still destroyed.

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is momentary.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i gnas ba rtogs pa don med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i gnas ba rtogs pa don med do //
translated: Therefore, it is pointless to understand its abiding.

original: de lta bas na gnas pa ni rgyun kho na yin no zhes @184a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnas pa ni rgyun kho na yin no zhes @184a * //
translated: Thus, abiding is only a continuum.

original: bya ba ni gang gi phyir skad cig ma'i chos la gnas pa yongs su rtogs pa don med par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: bya ba ni gang gi phyir skad cig ma'i chos la gnas pa yongs su rtogs pa don med par 'gyur bas so //
translated: This is because it is pointless to understand abiding in a momentary phenomenon.🔽Having explained it in this way,

original: de ltar bshad nas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rgyun kho nas gnas pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de ltar bshad nas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rgyun kho nas gnas pa yin pas so //
translated: because abiding is only a continuum,

original: chos mngon pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: in the Abhidharma it is said:

original: skyes pa smos pa ni ma skyes pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa smos pa ni ma skyes pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “arisen” is mentioned in order to exclude the unarisen.

original: skad cig ma gcig mi 'jig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig mi 'jig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: One moment does not disintegrate.

original: gal te gnas pa med na skad cig ma gcig po de yang med par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te gnas pa med na skad cig ma gcig po de yang med par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If duration does not exist, then that single moment would not exist.

original: bsam pa 'di 'gyur ba zhig na /🔽yod pa nyid ni rgyu dang rkyen sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir na ma yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa 'di 'gyur ba zhig na / yod pa nyid ni rgyu dang rkyen sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir na ma yin te /
translated: If that is your thought, then that is not so.

original: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because existence is preceded by causes and conditions, it is said, “When this exists, that comes to be.”

original: skyes pa skad cig ma la ni 'jig pa med de /
analyzed: skyes pa skad cig ma la ni 'jig pa med de /
translated: That which is produced does not disintegrate in a moment,

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would not be momentary.

original: de'i phyir 'du byed skyes pa rnams la mi 'jig pas rgyun chags par 'brel pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed skyes pa rnams la mi 'jig pas rgyun chags par 'brel pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is said with reference to the continuity of produced formations that do not disintegrate,

original: skad cig ma ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: skad cig ma ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: but not with reference to a moment.

original: gang yang ye shes la 'jug pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /🔽der ni gcig la zhes 'byung pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang ye shes la 'jug pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /🔽der ni gcig la zhes 'byung pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, it is said in the Compendium of Knowledge:🔽“What is duration?

original: sems kyi skad cig kho na bzhed do snyam du sems pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir nye bar bkod de /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig kho na bzhed do snyam du sems pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir nye bar bkod de /
translated: To dispel the idea that the Buddha accepts only a moment of mind, he presents this example.

original: der yang ris mthun pa'i sems la rigs kyi sems kyi skad cig ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //🔽ris mthun pa'i sems ni dang por nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma nas /
analyzed: der yang ris mthun pa'i sems la rigs kyi sems kyi skad cig ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o // ris mthun pa'i sems ni dang por nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma nas /
translated: And here, he means a moment of mind of the same type.🔽A mind of the same type is a single life, from the first moment of conception

original: 'chi ba'i mthar thug pa skye ba gcig gi bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i mthar thug pa skye ba gcig gi bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: up to the final moment of death.

original: 'dir gang las she na /
analyzed: 'dir gang las she na /
translated: Here, from what?

original: gang gi phyir 'jig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig pa gang zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “What is destruction?”

original: rnam par 'jig pa'o zhes lan brjod par bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa'o zhes lan brjod par bya ba la /
translated: the answer is “disruption.”

original: 'chi ba'o zhes smras pa des na /
analyzed: 'chi ba'o zhes smras pa des na /
translated: But if you say “death,”

original: ris mthun pa'i sems la dgongs pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: ris mthun pa'i sems la dgongs pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: it is understood that you mean a mind of the same type.

original: gang gi phyir skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is momentary,

original: skad cig ma gcig gnas pa dang / de gzhan du 'gyur ba'i rga ba yin par ma grub pa de'i phyir der ris mthun pa'i sems la rung gi / sems kyi skad cig la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gnas pa dang / de gzhan du 'gyur ba'i rga ba yin par ma grub pa de'i phyir der ris mthun pa'i sems la rung gi / sems kyi skad cig la ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not established that a single moment endures and then ages and changes into something else, therefore it is suitable to apply this to a mind that is a continuum of moments, but not to a moment of mind.

original: skad cig re re la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: skad cig re re la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Each moment, etc.

original: gnas skabs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni dus tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa rnams la yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni dus tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa rnams la yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it says, “The difference in states is in regard to different or nondifferent times.”

original: skye ba la @184b sogs pa dag ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la @184b sogs pa dag ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin no //
translated: Birth, etc. are the difference in states.

original: skye ba ni sngar med pa las 'byung zhing bdag nyid du red pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni sngar med pa las 'byung zhing bdag nyid du red pa'o //
translated: Birth is the arising of what did not previously exist and the establishment of its own nature.

original: skye ba ni skye ba po las rdzas gzhan yin par 'os pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba ni skye ba po las rdzas gzhan yin par 'os pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not suitable that birth is a substance that is different from the one who is born,

original: dngos po ma skyes pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ma skyes pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the thing would not be born.🔽If you say that it is birth itself because it is the cause of birth,

original: de'i skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir skye ba nyid du rtag go zhe na /
analyzed: de'i skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir skye ba nyid du rtag go zhe na /
translated: then it would follow that birth would be permanent.

original: rkyen thams cad skye ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rkyen thams cad skye ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: All conditions would be born,

original: de'i skye ba'i rgyu nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i skye ba'i rgyu nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference in their being the cause of birth.

original: de'i phyir / skad cig re re la ma byung ba las byung ba ni skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir / skad cig re re la ma byung ba las byung ba ni skye ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, birth is the arising of what did not exist in the moment,

original: rdzas gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas gzhan ma yin no //
translated: but it is not a different substance.

original: bdag nyid rnyed pa'i bdag nyid log pa ni 'jig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag nyid rnyed pa'i bdag nyid log pa ni 'jig pa yin gyi /
translated: Destruction is the cessation of the very nature that was acquired,

original: don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: but it is not a different object,

original: de ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would not cease.

original: de'i phyir byung nas med pa ni 'jig pa yin gyi rdzas gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir byung nas med pa ni 'jig pa yin gyi rdzas gzhan ni med do //
translated: Therefore, destruction is the non-existence of what was born, but it is not a different substance.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rjes su 'brel pa pa ni gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rjes su 'brel pa pa ni gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: Endurance is the connection between cause and effect,

original: skyes pa mi 'jig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa mi 'jig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not the non-destruction of what was born,

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would not be momentary.

original: 'di ltar smra ba po dag da rung du yang mar me de nyid 'jug go zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar smra ba po dag da rung du yang mar me de nyid 'jug go zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: In this way, the speakers say that the very same lamp is extinguished.

original: de'i phyir / snga ma snga ma dang skad cig ma phyi ma rjes su 'brel pa ni gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir / snga ma snga ma dang skad cig ma phyi ma rjes su 'brel pa ni gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the connection of the prior and subsequent moments is endurance.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa ni med do //
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa ni med do //
translated: There is no other entity.

original: rgyu'i skad cig ma las 'bras bu'i skad cig ma bye brag tu gyur pa ni gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu'i skad cig ma las 'bras bu'i skad cig ma bye brag tu gyur pa ni gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: The subsequent moment of effect that is different from the prior moment of cause is endurance transformed.

original: skad cig ma gcig la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la ni ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the case for a single moment.

original: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni gnas pa de skad cig ma snga ma dang mi 'dra ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni gnas pa de skad cig ma snga ma dang mi 'dra ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: Endurance transformed is the prior moment of endurance being different from the subsequent moment of endurance.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a different object.

original: 'du byed kyi rgyun la bdag tu mos pa rnams kyi bdag tu mos pa bzlog bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rgyun la bdag tu mos pa rnams kyi bdag tu mos pa bzlog bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to reverse the conception of a self that is imputed to the continuum of formations,

original: rgyun dang skad cig ma du ma'i tha dad pas tha dad pa rnams la bzlog par bya ba ma yin par bzhed nas /
analyzed: rgyun dang skad cig ma du ma'i tha dad pas tha dad pa rnams la bzlog par bya ba ma yin par bzhed nas /
translated: the Lord said, “It is not reversed through the difference of many moments and continua.”

original: lus skye bar yang mngon zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo 'di brtsams pa de lta na yang gang gi tshe 'dra bar yang skyes so //
analyzed: lus skye bar yang mngon zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo 'di brtsams pa de lta na yang gang gi tshe 'dra bar yang skyes so //
translated: The Sautrantikas, who maintain that the body is born anew, have composed this treatise.

original: de'i tshe mi 'dra ba nyid med pas gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe mi 'dra ba nyid med pas gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med do snyam du bsams pa'o //

original: de dag 'dra bar yang dmigs mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag 'dra bar yang dmigs mod kyi /

original: de'i phyir / @185a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir / @185a * //
translated: Therefore,

analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa 'phangs pa dang / ma 'phangs ba dang / stobs chen po dang / stobs chung dus 'phangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

analyzed: 'phangs pa dang / ma 'phangs pa ni 'phangs pa dang / ma 'phangs pa dag go //

analyzed: 'di ni 'phangs pa'i dbye ba rnam pa gnyis yin no //

translated: That which is thrown and that which is not thrown, that which is thrown with great force and that which is thrown with little force are that which is thrown and not thrown, that which is thrown with great force and that which is thrown with little force.

analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa de ni 'phangs pa dang / ma 'phangs pa dang / stobs chen po dang / stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa ste /

analyzed: dngos po gcig dang 'dra bar byas pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lcags dang / rdo la sogs pa dag bsdu'o //

analyzed: bul ba dang / myur ba dang / ches myur bar ltung ba'i dus kyi bye brag las zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: stobs chen pos 'phangs pa ni ches myur bar ltung ngo //

analyzed: ma 'phangs pa ltung ba na nam mkha' la skad cig ma rnams yul tha mi dad pa'i skad cig ma gzhan dag gi rgyur 'gyur la /

analyzed: ha cang nyung ba yang ma yin pa rnams rang gi yul dang / yul gzhan du skad cig ma gzhan skye ba'i rgyu yin no //
