original: rdo rje la sogs pa de dag la ji skad bshad pa'i yongs su 'gyur ba med par bul ba dang / myur ba dang / ches myur ba'i dus kyi bye brag mi rung ba de'i phyir 'du byed thams cad la skye ba bzhin du gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa de dag la ji skad bshad pa'i yongs su 'gyur ba med par bul ba dang / myur ba dang / ches myur ba'i dus kyi bye brag mi rung ba de'i phyir 'du byed thams cad la skye ba bzhin du gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid mi 'gal lo //
translated: Since it is not possible to distinguish slow, fast, and very fast times for those such as the vajra without the previously explained transformation, therefore, like arising, transformation is not contradictory for all conditioned phenomena.

original: gal te 'du byed kyi khyad par ra ma /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed kyi khyad par ra ma /
translated: If you say that the difference in conditioned phenomena is due to the difference in the heaviness of the vajra,

original: lci ba nyid las bul ba dang / myur ba dang / ches myur bar ltung ba'i dus kyi bye brag tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: lci ba nyid las bul ba dang / myur ba dang / ches myur bar ltung ba'i dus kyi bye brag tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then the difference in the time of falling would be due to the difference in slow, fast, and very fast falling.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical,

original: 'du byed bkag zin pa'i phyir dang / lci ba nyid la khyad par med pa'i phyir ltung ba'i dus kyi bye brag mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'du byed bkag zin pa'i phyir dang / lci ba nyid la khyad par med pa'i phyir ltung ba'i dus kyi bye brag mi 'thad do //
translated: because since conditioned phenomena have already been refuted, and because there is no difference in heaviness, the difference in the time of falling is untenable.

original: gal te rdo rje la sogs pa dag la yang snga ma las skad cig ma phyi ma mi 'dra bar skye na ;
analyzed: gal te rdo rje la sogs pa dag la yang snga ma las skad cig ma phyi ma mi 'dra bar skye na ;
translated: If in the case of the vajra, etc., the subsequent moment is different from the previous moment,

original: khyad par de ci'i phyir mi 'dzin ce na /
analyzed: khyad par de ci'i phyir mi 'dzin ce na /
translated: why do you not apprehend that difference?

original: de'i phyir / 'du byed rnams ni bye brag gi khyad par mtshar cig med pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //🔽'du byed gang dag khyad par te bye brag rags pa med cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'du byed rnams ni bye brag gi khyad par mtshar cig med pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so // 'du byed gang dag khyad par te bye brag rags pa med cing /
translated: Therefore, he says, “because formations are not differentiated by specific characteristics.🔽Those formations that are not differentiated by gross specific characteristics

original: phra ba yod pa de dag ni khyad par med pa khon ra 'dzin gyi khyad par du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phra ba yod pa de dag ni khyad par med pa khon ra 'dzin gyi khyad par du ni ma yin te /
translated: are apprehended as undifferentiated, not as differentiated,

original: phra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are subtle.

original: de'i phyir / de dag 'dra ba zhig tu snang ste mtsho ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de dag 'dra ba zhig tu snang ste mtsho ma bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, they appear to be similar, like the ocean.

original: 'o na ni sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma tha ma zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'o na ni sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma tha ma zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: But the last moment of sound and the last moment of a flame, etc.

original: skad cig ma phyi ma snga ma las bye brag tu gyur pa gnas pa bzhin du 'gyur ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: skad cig ma phyi ma snga ma las bye brag tu gyur pa gnas pa bzhin du 'gyur ba nyid yin na /
translated: If the subsequent moment is differentiated from the prior moment, it would be impermanent,

original: rgyun 'chad pa'i dus dang ; yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na /
analyzed: rgyun 'chad pa'i dus dang ; yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na /
translated: but at the time of the interruption of the continuum and at the time of complete nirvana,

original: gang gi bye brag snga ma'i gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma dang / skye mched drug gi skad cig ma las skad cig ma gzhan mtshams sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi bye brag snga ma'i gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma dang / skye mched drug gi skad cig ma las skad cig ma gzhan mtshams sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: The specific transformation of endurance is posited in terms of the momentariness of sound and a flame, and the momentariness of the six sense bases.

original: de ltar na sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma tha ma dag dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe skye mched drug gi skad cig ma la gnas ba gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma tha ma dag dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe skye mched drug gi skad cig ma la gnas ba gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: The final moment of sound and a flame and the final moment of the six sense bases at the time of nirvana do not link with another moment because they do not endure.

original: mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa 'du byed thams cad la ma khyab pa can du 'gyur ro //🔽'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba @186a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa 'du byed thams cad la ma khyab pa can du 'gyur ro // 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba @186a * //
translated: Therefore the presentation of the characteristics would not apply to all conditioned states.

original: la ; 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi mdo las gnas pa kho na mtshan nyid du ma brjod de /
analyzed: la ; 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi mdo las gnas pa kho na mtshan nyid du ma brjod de /
translated: The sutra on the characteristics of conditioned states does not state that endurance alone is a characteristic.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What does it state?

original: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang yin te /
translated: It states that endurance and transformation are characteristics.

original: gnas pa skad cig ma phyi ma rjes su 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa skad cig ma phyi ma rjes su 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang yin no //
translated: and it is also the transformation into another state, which is characterized by the connection with the subsequent moment of duration.

original: de'i phyir skad cig gang la gnas pa 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can yin pa de la ni gnas pa de yod dang gdon mi za bar gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba mi 'dra ba nyid kyang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig gang la gnas pa 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can yin pa de la ni gnas pa de yod dang gdon mi za bar gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba mi 'dra ba nyid kyang yod mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, in any moment in which duration exists, which is characterized by the result, there is no doubt that there is also another kind of duration, which is the transformation of duration.

original: gang la gnas pa med pa de la gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang med de /
analyzed: gang la gnas pa med pa de la gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang med de /
translated: But in any moment in which duration does not exist, there is no transformation of duration.

original: dper na sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma tha ma dag dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe'i skye mched drug gi skad cig ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma tha ma dag dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe'i skye mched drug gi skad cig ma bzhin no //
translated: For example, the last moment of sound and the last moment of the flame of a lamp, and the last moment of the six sense spheres at the time of parinirvāṇa.

original: de ltar na gang la gnas pa med pa de'i mtshan nyid ni skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyis kho na yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur bas rnam par gzhag pa nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar na gang la gnas pa med pa de'i mtshan nyid ni skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyis kho na yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur bas rnam par gzhag pa nyams pa med do //
translated: Thus, it is shown that the defining characteristics of that in which duration does not exist are only origination and cessation. Therefore, the established doctrine is not undermined.

original: gal te gnas bzhin pa la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med na ni mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ma khyab pa can du 'gyur ba zhig go //
analyzed: gal te gnas bzhin pa la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med na ni mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ma khyab pa can du 'gyur ba zhig go //
translated: If that which is enduring did not have transformation, then the presentation of the characteristics would not be universal.

original: sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma tha ma rnams kyang gnas pa zhes bya ba rgyun gyi khongs su 'du ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma tha ma rnams kyang gnas pa zhes bya ba rgyun gyi khongs su 'du ba'i phyir la /
translated: The last moment of sound and the last moment of a flame are included in the continuum called enduring.

original: de la gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba'i yod pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gsum char yang srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir yang mdor na bcom ldan 'das kyis ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de la gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba'i yod pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gsum char yang srid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir yang mdor na bcom ldan 'das kyis ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the three characteristics are possible because of the existence of transformation in that which is enduring, he says, “In brief, the Bhagavat said that all conditioned phenomena have three characteristics.”

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul bzhin du mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul bzhin du mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: The presentation of the characteristics should be stated in accordance with the method that has been explained.

original: da ni ji ltar na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i chos de nyid kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i chos de nyid kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the characteristics of the basis of the characteristics, he says, “That very dharma which is the basis of the characteristics is said to have three characteristics.”

original: chos kho na ma byung ba las byung ba dang / byung nas yang mi 'byung ba dang / rgyu las 'bras bu rigs mi 'dra ba skye ba zhes bya ba gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i chos gang yin pa de ni rang gi bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes khas blangs par 'gyur na de ni 'thad pa yang ma
analyzed: chos kho na ma byung ba las byung ba dang / byung nas yang mi 'byung ba dang / rgyu las 'bras bu rigs mi 'dra ba skye ba zhes bya ba gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin na mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i chos gang yin pa de ni rang gi bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes khas blangs par 'gyur na de ni 'thad pa yang ma
translated: If it were to arise from just the phenomenon itself, and having arisen, it would not arise again, and if a cause gave rise to an effect of a different type, then it would be a transformation of the phenomenon itself, and it would be asserted that the phenomenon that is the basis of its characteristics is the characteristic of its own nature.🔽But that is not tenable,

original: yin te / gzhan gyis gzhan mtshon par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yin te / gzhan gyis gzhan mtshon par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: because one thing would be characterized by another.

original: me dang du ba bzhin no //🔽de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i chos gang yin pa de nyid de'i mtshan nyid du mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: me dang du ba bzhin no // de'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i chos gang yin pa de nyid de'i mtshan nyid du mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: Like fire and smoke.🔽Therefore, it is not tenable that the phenomenon that is the basis of the characteristics of things is their characteristic.

original: re zhig ji ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: re zhig ji ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: How is it that the basis of characteristics is not the characteristic?

original: skyes bu chen po dang ba lang ni tshogs pa'i bdag nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po dang ba lang ni tshogs pa'i bdag nyid yin zhing /
translated: The great man and the cow are the nature of a collection.

original: skyes bu chen po'i @186b mtshan nyid rnams dang / lkog shal la sogs pa dag ni tshogs pa can gyi rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i @186b mtshan nyid rnams dang / lkog shal la sogs pa dag ni tshogs pa can gyi rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The characteristics of a great man and the dewlap, etc. are the nature of an aggregate.

original: bye brag pa rnams kyi ltar tshogs pa can rnams tshogs pa las gzhan nyid kyang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bye brag pa rnams kyi ltar tshogs pa can rnams tshogs pa las gzhan nyid kyang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: The Vaiśeṣikas say that the aggregate is not different from the collection.

original: 'on kyang gzhan nyid med kyang skyes bu chen po'i skyes bu chen po nyid dang / ba lang gi ba lang nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan nyid med kyang skyes bu chen po'i skyes bu chen po nyid dang / ba lang gi ba lang nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: However, even though it is not different, it is the characteristic of the great man’s greatness and the cow’s cowness.

original: skyes bu chen po ni mtshan nyid tsam zhig kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po ni mtshan nyid tsam zhig kyang ma yin no //
translated: The great man is not just the characteristic.

original: gal te skyes bu tshogs pa tsam zhig yin na ni ma byung ba las byung zhing /
analyzed: gal te skyes bu tshogs pa tsam zhig yin na ni ma byung ba las byung zhing /
translated: If the great man were just the collection, he would arise from what did not exist before.

original: byung nas kyang med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: byung nas kyang med par 'gyur la /
translated: And having arisen, he would become nonexistent.

original: chos kyang skye ba 'am 'gags pa na 'khor dang bcas pa skye ba 'am 'gags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyang skye ba 'am 'gags pa na 'khor dang bcas pa skye ba 'am 'gags par 'gyur te /
translated: And when a phenomenon arises or ceases, it would arise or cease together with its collection.

original: dper na sems dang sems las byung ba dang / 'byung ba dag dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa lhan cig skye zhing 'gag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sems dang sems las byung ba dang / 'byung ba dag dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa lhan cig skye zhing 'gag pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the mind and mental factors, the primary elements and the derivative form arise and cease simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams skyes bu chen po'o zhes bya ba dag dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan zhes bya ba dag tu 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dus byas kyi chos kyang 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams skyes bu chen po'o zhes bya ba dag dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan zhes bya ba dag tu 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dus byas kyi chos kyang 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, just as the marks of a great person are called both “great person” and “marks of a great person,” so too conditioned phenomena are both conditioned and the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis ni chos de mtshon par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis ni chos de mtshon par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the characteristics of arising and so on are the distinctive states that characterize those phenomena.

original: sa'i khams la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sra ba nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: sa'i khams la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sra ba nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The characteristics of the primary elements such as solidity are called the characteristics of the primary elements.

original: dpe 'di ni gnyis la grags pa yin te /
analyzed: dpe 'di ni gnyis la grags pa yin te /
translated: This example is well known to both parties.

original: sa'i khams ni sra ba'i mtshan nyid can no zhes brjod la /
analyzed: sa'i khams ni sra ba'i mtshan nyid can no zhes brjod la /
translated: The primary element earth is said to have the characteristic of solidity.

original: sra ba sa'i khams las gzhan pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //🔽sa'i khams de nyid sra bas mtshon pa na sra ba zhes bya ba yin pa de bzhin du 'dus byas de nyid ma byung ba las byung zhing /
analyzed: sra ba sa'i khams las gzhan pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o // sa'i khams de nyid sra bas mtshon pa na sra ba zhes bya ba yin pa de bzhin du 'dus byas de nyid ma byung ba las byung zhing /
translated: The same should be applied to the other elements.🔽When that earth element is characterized by solidity, it is called “solidity.”

original: byung nas kyang med pas mtshon pa na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: byung nas kyang med pas mtshon pa na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: In the same way, when that conditioned phenomenon is characterized by arising from what was non-existent and by ceasing after having arisen, it is called “the characteristic of a conditioned phenomenon.”

original: mtshon par bya bas na mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshon par bya bas na mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is a characteristic because it characterizes.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar gyen du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar gyen du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, it is like the upward movement of smoke.

original: gyen du 'gro ba ni bar chad med par yul gong mar skye ba'o //
analyzed: gyen du 'gro ba ni bar chad med par yul gong mar skye ba'o //
translated: Upward movement is the uninterrupted arising of smoke in a higher place.

original: de ni de las kyang mi gzhan pa ltar zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni de las kyang mi gzhan pa ltar zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not different from that.

original: gyen du 'gro ba de'o //
analyzed: gyen du 'gro ba de'o //
translated: That is the upward movement.

original: de las kyang zhes bya ba ni du ba las so //
analyzed: de las kyang zhes bya ba ni du ba las so //
translated: From that is from the smoke.

original: chos mngon pa pa skad cig mar smra ba'i ltar na ni du ba'i gyen du 'gro ba gzhan yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa skad cig mar smra ba'i ltar na ni du ba'i gyen du 'gro ba gzhan yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: According to the Abhidharma masters who advocate momentary cessation, the upward movement of smoke does not exist as something different.

original: de nyid gyen la yul gzhan dag tu skye ba na gyen @187a * //
analyzed: de nyid gyen la yul gzhan dag tu skye ba na gyen @187a * //
translated: When it is born in another place above, it is born in a place above.🔽

original: du 'gro ba zhes bya ba 'thob cing /
analyzed: du 'gro ba zhes bya ba 'thob cing /
translated: When it arises in another place above, it is said to move upward.

original: de las gyen du 'gro ba tha dad pa ltar mngon pa de bzhin du skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang de las tha dad pa lta bur mngon no //
analyzed: de las gyen du 'gro ba tha dad pa ltar mngon pa de bzhin du skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang de las tha dad pa lta bur mngon no //
translated: Just as it appears to move upward, so too arising, enduring, and disintegrating appear to be different from the conditioned.

original: 'dir yang tshul de nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang tshul de nyid yin te /
translated: Here, the same method applies,

original: me dang du ba'i tshul ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me dang du ba'i tshul ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the method of fire and smoke.

original: 'di ltar skye ba la sogs pa dag kyang 'dus byas las gzhan ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba la sogs pa dag kyang 'dus byas las gzhan ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Although arising, etc., are not different from the conditioned,

original: 'on kyang 'dus byas nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dus byas nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar mi 'gal lo //
translated: it is not contradictory to say that they are the characteristics of the conditioned.

original: 'dus byas gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni ji srid du de dag snga na med pa la sogs pa dag tu mi shes pa de srid du 'dus byas nyid du ma nges te /
analyzed: 'dus byas gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni ji srid du de dag snga na med pa la sogs pa dag tu mi shes pa de srid du 'dus byas nyid du ma nges te /
translated: As long as conditioned phenomena such as form are not known to be impermanent, etc., they are not ascertained to be conditioned.

original: 'di ltar sgra'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs kyang rtag par smra ba rnams kyis sgra 'dus ma byas su rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs kyang rtag par smra ba rnams kyis sgra 'dus ma byas su rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, although the nature of sound is perceived, the proponents of eternal sound perceive sound as unconditioned.

original: ji srid du snga na med pa dang / phyis med pa mi shes pa na ste /
analyzed: ji srid du snga na med pa dang / phyis med pa mi shes pa na ste /
translated: As long as one does not know the absence of sound prior to its occurrence and the absence of sound after its cessation,

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: what?

original: rang gi ngo bo zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The nature of sound, as the context indicates.

original: phyis med pa ni zhig nas med pa'o //
analyzed: phyis med pa ni zhig nas med pa'o //
translated: The absence of sound after its cessation is its destruction.

original: rgyun gyi bye brag ni gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: rgyun gyi bye brag ni gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: The difference in the continuum is its transformation.

original: de ltar na 'dir mtshan nyid gsum dag bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir mtshan nyid gsum dag bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the three characteristics are explained here.

original: 'dir gzugs la sogs pa ni chos can no //🔽rgyu dang rkyen la rag las te /
analyzed: 'dir gzugs la sogs pa ni chos can no // rgyu dang rkyen la rag las te /
translated: Here, form, etc., is the subject.

original: bdag nyid thob pa nyid ni 'dus byas nyid do /
analyzed: bdag nyid thob pa nyid ni 'dus byas nyid do /
translated: The fact that it comes into being in dependence on causes and conditions is its conditionedness.

original: snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa dang / gzhan du gyur pa nyid dag ni mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa dang / gzhan du gyur pa nyid dag ni mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The absence of sound prior to its occurrence, the absence of sound after its cessation, and the difference in the continuum are the characteristics,

original: gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the differences in the states.

original: 'dir bstan bcos mkhan pos slob dpon nyid kyi shing rta'i gcig pa nyid kyi phyogs gyi  tshig khyad du bsad nas mtshan nyid rnams brjod du med pa nyid khas blangs te /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos mkhan pos slob dpon nyid kyi shing rta'i gcig pa nyid kyi phyogs gyi  tshig khyad du bsad nas mtshan nyid rnams brjod du med pa nyid khas blangs te /
translated: Here, the treatise author, having disregarded the master’s own words that the characteristics are inexpressible, accepts that they are inexpressible.

original: btags par yod pa mtha' dag gi mtshan nyid 'di yin te /
analyzed: btags par yod pa mtha' dag gi mtshan nyid 'di yin te /
translated: The characteristics of all that is imputed are as follows.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: 'di nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med pa nyid do //
translated: inexpressible as either the same or different.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that reason,

original: de lta bas na de nyid kyis de mtshon pa yang ma yin la zhes bya ba smos so //🔽de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de lta bas na de nyid kyis de mtshon pa yang ma yin la zhes bya ba smos so // de nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas nyid kyis so //
translated: he says, “Therefore it is not indicated by that itself.”🔽“ That itself” refers to the conditioned itself.

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas nyid kyis yin par mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas nyid kyis yin par mtshon pa'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the conditioned itself.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what?

original: snga na med pa la sogs pas de 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed de /
analyzed: snga na med pa la sogs pas de 'dus byas nyid du mtshon par byed de /
translated: It is indicated by the conditioned itself through prior nonexistence and so on.

original: de dag gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de dag gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because those are not the intrinsic nature of form,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na yang de dag rdzas su yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //🔽de dag las skye ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs @187b pa la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na yang de dag rdzas su yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro // de dag las skye ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs @187b pa la /
translated: If they were the intrinsic reality of form, etc., it would follow that they would be substantially existent.🔽“They are not different from form, etc.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag las rdzas gzhan nyid du yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag las rdzas gzhan nyid du yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not different from form, etc., as a different substance.

original: skye ba la sogs pa rnams btags par yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa rnams btags par yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because arising, etc., are imputedly existent.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: rgyun gyi dbang po'ang skye ba yin //
analyzed: rgyun gyi dbang po'ang skye ba yin //
translated: The life-force of a continuum is arising.

original: zhes rgyas par bshad do //
analyzed: zhes rgyas par bshad do //
translated: This is explained extensively.

original: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lung ngam rigs pa dang 'gal snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lung ngam rigs pa dang 'gal snyam du bsams so //
translated: “What would be the consequence?” He thinks that it would contradict scripture or reasoning.

original: de dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Because they occur simultaneously” means

original: skye ba la sogs pa dag chos dang lhan cig 'byung ba nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir bya ba yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dag chos dang lhan cig 'byung ba nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir bya ba yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because arising, etc., are accepted as co-occurring with the phenomenon, it would follow that they would exist as actions.

original: de'i phyir / chos gcig tu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir / chos gcig tu zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, “one phenomenon” means

original: chos dang por skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: chos dang por skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: one phenomenon would arise first,

original: de nas gnas pa dang / de nas rga ba dang / de nas 'jig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nas gnas pa dang / de nas rga ba dang / de nas 'jig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Then it endures, then it ages, then it is destroyed.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na dus gcig tu skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na dus gcig tu skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, arising, enduring, and disintegrating would occur at the same time.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: But this is not so,

original: bya ba'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the time of their activity is different.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dus gcig tu skye ba la sogs par 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dus gcig tu skye ba la sogs par 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Arising, enduring, and disintegrating are simultaneous because they are coexistent causes.

original: 'on kyang de dag gi bya ba'i dus tha dad de /🔽gang gi phyir skye ba ma 'ongs pa chos ma 'ongs pa la bya ba byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gi bya ba'i dus tha dad de / gang gi phyir skye ba ma 'ongs pa chos ma 'ongs pa la bya ba byed do //
translated: But their activity occurs at different times.🔽Arising causes the future dharma to be generated.

original: 'di ltar ma skyes pa bskyed do zhes bya ba ni de nyid la rgyu smras pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma skyes pa bskyed do zhes bya ba ni de nyid la rgyu smras pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is said that the future dharma is generated by the future arising.

original: gang gi phyir skye ba'i bya ba ni skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba'i bya ba ni skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The activity of arising is the generation of that which is to be generated.

original: skyes zin pa la yang skyed par ni mi nus te /
analyzed: skyes zin pa la yang skyed par ni mi nus te /
translated: But it is not possible to generate that which has already arisen.

original: de'i phyir skye ba ma 'ongs pa kho nas chos ma 'ongs pa skyed par byed do zhes bya bar mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba ma 'ongs pa kho nas chos ma 'ongs pa skyed par byed do zhes bya bar mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in maintaining that the future dharma is generated by future arising.

original: da ltar gyi gnas skabs su ni bya ba gzhan zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi gnas skabs su ni bya ba gzhan zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: But in the present, it would be another action.🔽The present action of enduring, etc.

original: skyes zin pa'i chos la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: skyes zin pa'i chos la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: is in regard to a presently arisen factor.

original: chos skyes pa ni gnas pa dang ; rga ba dang / gzhig par nus kyi ma skyes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos skyes pa ni gnas pa dang ; rga ba dang / gzhig par nus kyi ma skyes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The factor that has arisen can endure, age, and perish, but not the non-arisen factor.

original: de'i phyir / skyes zin pa'i chos la gnas pa la sogs pa da ltar ba bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir / skyes zin pa'i chos la gnas pa la sogs pa da ltar ba bya ba byed do //
translated: Consequently, the present action of enduring, etc.🔽is in regard to a presently arisen factor.

original: de'i phyir / gang gi tshe skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang gi tshe skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: That is why the present action of enduring, etc.🔽is in regard to a presently arisen factor.

original: re zhig 'dir ci zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la ma 'ongs pa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: re zhig 'dir ci zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la ma 'ongs pa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: The future does not exist as a real entity.

original: de med na ji ltar skye ba ma 'ongs pa yod pa ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba skyed par 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de med na ji ltar skye ba ma 'ongs pa yod pa ma yin pas bskyed par bya ba skyed par 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: If it does not exist, how can the future factor that is not arisen be produced?

original: ma 'ongs pa de rdzas su yod du chug na yang skye ba bya ba med na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa de rdzas su yod du chug na yang skye ba bya ba med na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Even if the future factor existed as a real entity, it would not have the action of arising.

original: bya ba ma thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa @188a * //🔽yin par 'dod la /
analyzed: bya ba ma thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa @188a * // yin par 'dod la /
translated: That which does not obtain its activity is the future.

original: bya ba byed bzhin pa ni da ltar ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba byed bzhin pa ni da ltar ba'o //
translated: That which is in the process of performing its activity is the present.🔽That which has disintegrated from performing its activity is the past.

original: bya ba zhig pa 'das pa yin no zhes de ltar dus rnam par gnas pa yin dang / skye ba bya ba byed na ji ltar ma 'ongs par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bya ba zhig pa 'das pa yin no zhes de ltar dus rnam par gnas pa yin dang / skye ba bya ba byed na ji ltar ma 'ongs par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If arising performs its activity, how could it be established as future?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus ni skyes bu'i byed pa med pa'i phyir mi 'grub pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus ni skyes bu'i byed pa med pa'i phyir mi 'grub pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The future time is not established because it is devoid of the activity of a person.

original: gal te rdzas su yod pa'i bya ba byed bzhin pa ma 'ongs pa yin na ni ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te rdzas su yod pa'i bya ba byed bzhin pa ma 'ongs pa yin na ni ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: If that which is in the process of performing the activity of an entity that exists as a substance is future, then the definition of the future should be stated.

original: byung ba yang bya ba zhig pa yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: byung ba yang bya ba zhig pa yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If that which has arisen is that which is in the process of disintegrating,

original: bya ba zhig pa ni 'das pa yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: bya ba zhig pa ni 'das pa yin par 'dod na /
translated: then if that which is in the process of disintegrating is asserted to be the past,

original: gal te da ltar ba'i gnas skabs su skye ba bya ba zhig pa yin na yang 'das pa yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te da ltar ba'i gnas skabs su skye ba bya ba zhig pa yin na yang 'das pa yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: if arising is that which is in the process of disintegrating in the present, then it would be the past.

original: da ltar ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It would not be the present.

original: gnas pa la sogs pa yang cig car bya ba la 'jug pa yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa yang cig car bya ba la 'jug pa yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If endurance and so on were to engage in action simultaneously,

original: skyes zin pa'i chos la da ltar ba gnas pa la sogs pa rnams bya ba byed par khas blangs pas de dag cig car bya ba la 'jug par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes zin pa'i chos la da ltar ba gnas pa la sogs pa rnams bya ba byed par khas blangs pas de dag cig car bya ba la 'jug par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then since you have accepted that the present state of endurance and so on of a phenomenon that has already arisen performs action, you have accepted that they engage in action simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma gcig kho na la chos thams cad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma gcig kho na la chos thams cad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore all phenomena would be reduced to a single moment.

original: 'di gang gi che zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /🔽gnas pa dang rga ba dang 'jig pa'i bya ba dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di gang gi che zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / gnas pa dang rga ba dang 'jig pa'i bya ba dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: What is this?

original: chos la gnas pa yang yin la 'jig pa yang yin no zhes bya bar ni rnam par gzhag par mi rigs so //
analyzed: chos la gnas pa yang yin la 'jig pa yang yin no zhes bya bar ni rnam par gzhag par mi rigs so //
translated: The actions of endurance, aging, and destruction are mutually exclusive because it is illogical to posit that a phenomenon is enduring and also disintegrating.

original: 'di ci dus der zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'di ci dus der zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: What is this?

original: gnas pa la sogs pa rnams phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir da ltar ba la yang bya ba med do snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa rnams phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir da ltar ba la yang bya ba med do snyam du bsams so //
translated: Since endurance and so on are mutually exclusive, they do not perform action even in the present.

original: gang skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Also, arising and so on” means that

original: ji ltar skyes pa mi skyed pa de bzhin du mi gnas pa mi rga la /
analyzed: ji ltar skyes pa mi skyed pa de bzhin du mi gnas pa mi rga la /
translated: just as what has arisen does not arise, so also what has endured does not age,

original: ma rgas pas mi 'jig pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: ma rgas pas mi 'jig pa de'i phyir /
translated: and what has not aged does not disintegrate.

original: gnas pa la sogs pa rnams kyang bya ba rim gyis byed do zhes zer ba de'i ltar na skad cig ma nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa rnams kyang bya ba rim gyis byed do zhes zer ba de'i ltar na skad cig ma nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since enduring and so on perform their functions sequentially,🔽momentariness is undermined.

original: skad cig ma zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad pas chung ba yin na 'dir ni gnas pa dang / rga ba'i dus dag tu mi 'jig pa'i phyir skad cig ma gsum du gnas pas skad cig ma nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro //🔽'on te 'di skad du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: skad cig ma zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad pas chung ba yin na 'dir ni gnas pa dang / rga ba'i dus dag tu mi 'jig pa'i phyir skad cig ma gsum du gnas pas skad cig ma nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro // 'on te 'di skad du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If momentariness is the shortest duration of time, then since it endures for three moments, momentariness is undermined.

original: skad cig ma ni dus ji tsam gyis skye ba dang / @188b gnas ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba dang / 'jig pa rnams rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i dus de la brjod kyi /
analyzed: skad cig ma ni dus ji tsam gyis skye ba dang / @188b gnas ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba dang / 'jig pa rnams rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i dus de la brjod kyi /
translated: But if you say that momentariness is the time it takes for arising, enduring, changing, and disintegrating to be completed,🔽then momentariness is undermined.

original: skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But they do not disintegrate immediately upon arising.🔽If that is so, then it is said in the Abhidharma

original: de ltar na yang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na yang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: that the arising of the aggregates🔽is the arising of the four characteristics.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni rim gyis bya ba byed par mi rung ste /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni rim gyis bya ba byed par mi rung ste /
translated: The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.

original: sngon dang phyis khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //🔽der yang sngar gnas pas bya ba byed kyi /🔽rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod /
analyzed: sngon dang phyis khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen khyad par med pa'i phyir ro // der yang sngar gnas pas bya ba byed kyi / rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod /
translated: The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.

original: gnas pa sto bas dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu smras pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa sto bas dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu smras pa ste /
translated: The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.🔽The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.

original: de ni stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gi bya ba la gegs byas nas rang gi bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de ni stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gi bya ba la gegs byas nas rang gi bya ba byed do //
translated: The arising of the aggregates is the arising of the four characteristics.

original: phyis ci'i phyir stobs dang mi ldan pa nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyis ci'i phyir stobs dang mi ldan pa nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
translated: The arising of the aggregates is the arising

original: gang las 'di chos dang lhan cig tu mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'joms par 'gyur ba gnas pa phyis stobs chung ba'i rgyu ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las 'di chos dang lhan cig tu mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'joms par 'gyur ba gnas pa phyis stobs chung ba'i rgyu ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And there is no cause of duration that is later and weaker than that.

original: de'i phyir gnas pa la sogs ba rnams kyi bya ba ni skyes ma thag tu lhan cig tu yod par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa la sogs ba rnams kyi bya ba ni skyes ma thag tu lhan cig tu yod par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Therefore, the activity of duration, etc., would either occur simultaneously with the arising of the entity,

original: gal te stobs dang ldan pa'i bya ba sngar 'dod na mi rtag pa nyid kyi bya ba kho na yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te stobs dang ldan pa'i bya ba sngar 'dod na mi rtag pa nyid kyi bya ba kho na yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: or if you maintain that the powerful activity occurs first, then only the activity of impermanence would occur.

original: bya ba byas pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: bya ba byas pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: As for the phrase “because the activity has been performed,”

original: 'dis ni stobs dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi rgyu smras pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni stobs dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi rgyu smras pa ste /
translated: this states the reason why it is not powerful.

original: bya ba ma byas pa'i gnas pa ni rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag pas stobs dang ldan pa'i yin gyi /
analyzed: bya ba ma byas pa'i gnas pa ni rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag pas stobs dang ldan pa'i yin gyi /
translated: The duration that has not yet performed its activity is powerful in relation to aging and impermanence,

original: bya ba byas pas ni yang bya ba byed par mi nus te /
analyzed: bya ba byas pas ni yang bya ba byed par mi nus te /
translated: but once the activity has been performed, it cannot perform the activity again,

original: skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: skye ba bzhin no //
translated: just like arising.

original: de'i phyir phyis chos dang lhan cig tu mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyis chos dang lhan cig tu mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, later, the entity would not be destroyed by impermanence together with the entity.

original: skye bas ni mi nus par rigs te zhes bya ba 'dis ni dpe don dang chos mi mthun par ston par byed do //
analyzed: skye bas ni mi nus par rigs te zhes bya ba 'dis ni dpe don dang chos mi mthun par ston par byed do //
translated: This is what is being said: “It is not possible for that which has been produced to be produced again.”

original: skye bas ni da ltar ba nyid du khyer te /
analyzed: skye bas ni da ltar ba nyid du khyer te /
translated: Production carries it into the present.

original: 'ongs nas yang bkur bar mi nus so //
analyzed: 'ongs nas yang bkur bar mi nus so //
translated: Having come into existence, it cannot be carried there again.

original: de'i phyir 'dir bya ba byas zin pa yang bya ba byed pa la nus pa med pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir bya ba byas zin pa yang bya ba byed pa la nus pa med pa'i rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that that which has already performed its function does not have the ability to perform its function again.

original: gnas pa bya ba byas pa zin pa nyid yang bya ba mi bya ba la ni rgyu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa bya ba byas pa zin pa nyid yang bya ba mi bya ba la ni rgyu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no cause for that which has already performed its function to not perform its function again,

original: gang gi phyir gnas pas ni gnas par bya ba yang gnas par bya bar yang nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnas pas ni gnas par bya ba yang gnas par bya bar yang nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which endures has the ability to endure again.

original: yang na 'di la gegs byed pa yang gang zhig yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na 'di la gegs byed pa yang gang zhig yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, what would prevent it from enduring again?

original: gal te bya ba byas zin pa yang bya ba byed pa gegs byed pa 'ga' @189a * //🔽zhig yod na ni bya ba mi byed par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te bya ba byas zin pa yang bya ba byed pa gegs byed pa 'ga' @189a * // zhig yod na ni bya ba mi byed par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If that which has already performed its function were to perform its function again,🔽it would not perform its function again.

original: gegs byed pa ni yod pa yang ma yin no /
analyzed: gegs byed pa ni yod pa yang ma yin no /
translated: But there is no cause for it not to perform its function again.

original: gegs byed pa yod de /
analyzed: gegs byed pa yod de /
translated: There is a cause for it not to perform its function again.

original: rga ba dang mi rtag pa de dag kho na yin no //
analyzed: rga ba dang mi rtag pa de dag kho na yin no //
translated: Aging and impermanence are just those.

original: 'di ltar stobs chung ba'i gegs byed pa ni stobs che ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar stobs chung ba'i gegs byed pa ni stobs che ba yin no //
translated: For it is the stronger that obstructs the weaker.

original: gal te gnas pa bas stobs dang ldan pa zhig yin na ni sngon kho nas gnas pa rang gi bya ba mi byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gnas pa bas stobs dang ldan pa zhig yin na ni sngon kho nas gnas pa rang gi bya ba mi byed par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were stronger than endurance, then endurance would not perform its function from the outset,

original: de dag gis gegs byas pa'i phyir ro //🔽gnas pa sngon stobs dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag gis gegs byas pa'i phyir ro // gnas pa sngon stobs dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: because it would be obstructed by them.🔽It is difficult to believe that endurance is strong at first

original: phyis stobs dang mi ldan no zhes bya ba 'di yang dad par byed pa dka' ba zhig go //🔽de ltar na rga ba dang mi rtag pa dag kyang sngar stobs dang mi ldan la /
analyzed: phyis stobs dang mi ldan no zhes bya ba 'di yang dad par byed pa dka' ba zhig go // de ltar na rga ba dang mi rtag pa dag kyang sngar stobs dang mi ldan la /
translated: and later it is not strong.🔽Thus, it is not possible to understand that aging and impermanence are not strong at first

original: phyis stobs dang ldan no zhes bya bar rtogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: phyis stobs dang ldan no zhes bya bar rtogs par mi nus so //
translated: and later they become strong.

original: gnas pa'i bya ba log na yang //🔽zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gnas pa'i bya ba log na yang // zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: When the function of endurance ceases,🔽then aging and impermanence do not exist.🔽When the function of endurance ceases, then aging and impermanence do not exist.

original: gnas pa ni mi gnas pa dang 'gal ba'i sgo nas yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa ni mi gnas pa dang 'gal ba'i sgo nas yin no //
translated: Endurance is the opposite of nonendurance.

original: gnas pa'i bya ba zhig na yang rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag kyang mi gnas la /
analyzed: gnas pa'i bya ba zhig na yang rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag kyang mi gnas la /
translated: If the action of enduring existed, then aging and impermanence would not endure.

original: rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gang gi yin pa'i chos de yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gang gi yin pa'i chos de yang mi gnas so //
translated: And the phenomenon that is the basis of aging and impermanence would not endure.

original: de dag ni gnas pas bya ba yongs su bzung bas gnas pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de dag ni gnas pas bya ba yongs su bzung bas gnas pa yin zhing /
translated: They endure because they are appropriated by the action of enduring.

original: de zhig pas de dag nges par mi gnas pa yin pas ji ltar bdag nyid mi gnas pa'i rga ba mi rtag pa dag gis bya ba byed nus par 'dod /
analyzed: de zhig pas de dag nges par mi gnas pa yin pas ji ltar bdag nyid mi gnas pa'i rga ba mi rtag pa dag gis bya ba byed nus par 'dod /
translated: Since they are definitely not enduring when they are disintegrating, how could aging and impermanence that do not endure themselves be able to perform their functions?

original: chos mi gnas pa ni 'gag pa nyid yin na de 'gags na ni de gang zhig la bya ba byed par nus par 'dod /
analyzed: chos mi gnas pa ni 'gag pa nyid yin na de 'gags na ni de gang zhig la bya ba byed par nus par 'dod /
translated: If a phenomenon does not endure, it is ceasing. If it has ceased, how could it be possible to assert that it performs a function?

original: yang na rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag gis ci zhig bya ba cung zad kyang med do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag gis ci zhig bya ba cung zad kyang med do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Or else, the thought is that aging and impermanence do not perform any function at all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / gnas pa yongs su bzung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de'i phyir / gnas pa yongs su bzung ba'i phyir //
translated: Why is that?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is appropriated by enduring.

original: gnas pa yongs su bzung ba'i phyir chos skyes pa tsam de ma zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa yongs su bzung ba'i phyir chos skyes pa tsam de ma zhig pa yin no //
translated: That dharma which has arisen is not destroyed as long as it is maintained by its duration.

original: de gnas pa des yal bar btang na ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gnas pa des yal bar btang na ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is abandoned by its duration,

original: gnas par ma byas pa ni nges par rang gi ngang kho nas mi gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas par ma byas pa ni nges par rang gi ngang kho nas mi gnas pa yin no //
translated: it does not endure because it is not maintained by duration, and it definitely does not endure by itself.

original: de nyid 'di'i 'jig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'di'i 'jig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That itself is its destruction, which is the non-endurance.

original: re zhig chos skyes pa gcig la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: re zhig chos skyes pa gcig la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: With regard to the statement, “First, with regard to one dharma that has arisen,”

original: skyes pa la mi 'jig pa med do zhes bya ba khas ma blangs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes pa la mi 'jig pa med do zhes bya ba khas ma blangs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: it should be said that it is not accepted that what has arisen is not destroyed.

original: gcig la rga ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gcig la rga ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the statement, “Aging is not possible for one that has arisen,” and so on,

original: rga ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa dang mthun pa skyes pa'i gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur @189b zhing rnam par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rga ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa dang mthun pa skyes pa'i gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur @189b zhing rnam par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: aging is a transformation and change in the state of what has arisen that is compatible with destruction.

original: de nyid las de'i rnam pa gzhan du ni rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid las de'i rnam pa gzhan du ni rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible for it to be otherwise than that.

original: gal te 'di de kho na yin na ji ltar gzhan du 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'di de kho na yin na ji ltar gzhan du 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: If it is just that, how can it be otherwise?

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na ji ltar de kho na ltar yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na ji ltar de kho na ltar yin te /
translated: If it were to become something else, how could it be just that?

original: de kho na bzhin dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal lo //
translated: It is contradictory to say that it is just that and it becomes something else.

original: de bzhin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If it were just that,

original: rnam pa de lta bu dang / de lta bu'i rang bzhin las ma nyams zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu dang / de lta bu'i rang bzhin las ma nyams zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then it would not deteriorate from that state, that is, from that nature.

original: de lta na ni 'o na rga ba mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na rga ba mi 'grub po //
translated: But if that were so, then aging would not be established.

original: gzhan yang 'gyur na de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gyur na de bzhin nyid de /
translated: Moreover, if it were to become something else, then that reality

original: lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin gnyis bzhin no //
analyzed: lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin gnyis bzhin no //
translated: would be like Devadatta and Yajñadatta.

original: de lta bas na dngos po skad cig ma gcig la rga ba zhes bya ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po skad cig ma gcig la rga ba zhes bya ba mi 'thad de /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to call a single momentary thing “aging.”

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rgyun kho na la 'thad do //
analyzed: rgyun kho na la 'thad do //
translated: It is tenable only in a continuum.

original: gang yang sde pa gzhan dag na re zhes bya pa rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gang yang sde pa gzhan dag na re zhes bya pa rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
translated: The other schools say that a thing is destroyed by the cause of destruction,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig pa'i phyir la /
translated: because impermanence causes it to disintegrate.

original: gnas pa ni rgyu gzhan la mi ltos par gnas par byed pa de'i phyir gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid kyi bya ba dus tha dad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnas pa ni rgyu gzhan la mi ltos par gnas par byed pa de'i phyir gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid kyi bya ba dus tha dad do zhes zer ro //
translated: and endurance is the cause that makes them remain without relying on another cause. Therefore, the activity of endurance and impermanence are at different times.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu de nyid kyis 'jig na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu de nyid kyis 'jig na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If they are destroyed by the cause of destruction itself,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu yod na 'jig pa'i phyir dad de med na mi 'jig pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu yod na 'jig pa'i phyir dad de med na mi 'jig pa'i phyir la /
translated: then they would be destroyed if the cause of destruction exists, but not if it does not exist.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni de yod pa ma yin pas mi rtag pa nyid don med par brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni de yod pa ma yin pas mi rtag pa nyid don med par brtags pa yin te /
translated: But impermanence does not exist, so it is pointless to impute impermanence.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu ltar de la 'jig par bya ba la nus pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu ltar de la 'jig par bya ba la nus pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we do not see that it has the power to destroy them, like the cause of destruction.

original: de bzhin du lha dang 'khru ba dag la yang brjod par bya'o //🔽sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skad cig ma nyid du khas blangs pas de dag gi mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du lha dang 'khru ba dag la yang brjod par bya'o // sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skad cig ma nyid du khas blangs pas de dag gi mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: The same argument applies to the bathing of the gods.🔽Since it is accepted that minds and mental factors are momentary,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi mi rtag pa nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi mi rtag pa nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir na /
translated: the impermanence of minds and mental factors does not rely on a cause of destruction.

original: rang nyid 'jig pa'i phyir 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid 'jig pa'i phyir 'jig pa yin no //
translated: It is destruction because it causes the destruction of itself.

original: de lta ma yin na de dag skad cig ma nyid yin pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de dag skad cig ma nyid yin pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, their momentariness would be contradicted.

original: de'i phyir gnas pa dang mi rtag pa dag dus tha mi dad par bya ba byed par thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa dang mi rtag pa dag dus tha mi dad par bya ba byed par thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Therefore, it follows that endurance and impermanence would perform their functions at the same time,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dus gcig tu gnas pa dang / 'jig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dus gcig tu gnas pa dang / 'jig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would follow that mind and mental functions would endure and be destroyed at the same time.

original: de lta bas na rgyun la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyun la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the expression “these characteristics of the conditioned” and so on is applied to the stream.

original: de lta na mdo sde 'di zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta na mdo sde 'di zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this way, the following passage from the sutra is well cited:🔽“These three are the characteristics of the conditioned.”

original: gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid de zhes rgyas bar gang gsungs @190a * //🔽pa legs par drangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid de zhes rgyas bar gang gsungs @190a * //🔽pa legs par drangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The expression “and so on” refers to the following passage:🔽“What are the three?

original: skye ba la sogs pa rnams rgyun la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid 'di dag rgyun la bshad pa de ltar na legs par drangs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa rnams rgyun la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid 'di dag rgyun la bshad pa de ltar na legs par drangs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Since there is no contradiction in positing arising, etc., with regard to a continuum, it is better to explain that these characteristics of conditioned states pertain to a continuum.

original: skad cig gi dbang du byas nas bshad na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig gi dbang du byas nas bshad na ni ma yin te /
translated: But they do not pertain to a moment,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would contradict the way they are explained.🔽Moreover, if future arising generates future arising, then since all future states would possess arising, the question is:

original: gzhan yang gal te ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni thams cad skye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba skyed par byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni thams cad skye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba skyed par byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir 'dri ba'o //
translated: Why doesn’t everything arise from everything?

original: rgyu dang rkyen dag med par ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dag med par ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The response to this is:

original: rgyu dang rkyen la mi ltos par skye ba bskyed par bya ba'i skyed par byed par mi 'dod la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la mi ltos par skye ba bskyed par bya ba'i skyed par byed par mi 'dod la /
translated: “Arising does not generate itself, but it generates that which is to be generated.”

original: ma 'ongs pa thams cad la yang rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa cig car yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa thams cad la yang rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa cig car yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: But since all future states do not simultaneously possess a complete assemblage of causes and conditions,

original: gang yang rung ba zhig med par yang 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig med par yang 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: But if any one of them is absent, the effect does not arise.

original: ma 'ongs pa thams cad cig car skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa thams cad cig car skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, not all future things arise simultaneously.

original: skye ba ni gdon mi za bar rang gi sde dang rigs mthun pa'i rgyur sngar skyes pa dang / phyi rol gyi rkyen gyi tshogs la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba ni gdon mi za bar rang gi sde dang rigs mthun pa'i rgyur sngar skyes pa dang / phyi rol gyi rkyen gyi tshogs la ltos pa yin te /
translated: The arising of a thing definitely depends on a cause that is homogeneous with it and that has arisen previously, and on the assembly of external conditions.

original: dper na myu gu'i skye ba sa bon dang / zhing la sogs pa rnams la ltos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na myu gu'i skye ba sa bon dang / zhing la sogs pa rnams la ltos pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the arising of a sprout depends on a seed, a field, etc.

original: 'o na ni tshogs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'o na ni tshogs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: But if that is so, then the following objection applies:

original: bskyed par bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa yod na ni 'byung la /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa yod na ni 'byung la /
translated: The effect that is to be produced arises when there is an assembly of causes and conditions.

original: med na mi 'byung bas rgyu dang rkyen kho na'i mthu yin par nges par gzung gi / skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung bas rgyu dang rkyen kho na'i mthu yin par nges par gzung gi / skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Since it does not arise when there is no assembly, it is definitely ascertained that the power of the causes and conditions is the reason for its arising, not arising itself.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is the problem?

original: mthu yin par blta bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: mthu yin par blta bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i skabs yin te /
translated: The problem is that the power of the causes and conditions should not be regarded as the reason for its arising.

original: de yod kyang 'bras bu skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod kyang 'bras bu skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even when the causes and conditions are present, the effect does not arise.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin phra mo dag yod bzhin du yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin phra mo dag yod bzhin du yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Even though the nature of the dharma is subtle” means:

original: dper na sems las byung ba reg pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sems las byung ba reg pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the mental factors of contact, etc.

original: chos kyi rang bzhi na zhes bya ba ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhi na zhes bya ba ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: “The nature of the dharma” means the essence of the dharma.

original: yongs su gcad par dka' ba'i phyir na phra mo dag ste /
analyzed: yongs su gcad par dka' ba'i phyir na phra mo dag ste /
translated: They are “subtle” because they are difficult to discern.

original: chos ni mi snang yang bya ba'i sgo nas nges na /
analyzed: chos ni mi snang yang bya ba'i sgo nas nges na /
translated: If the dharma is not manifest but is ascertained through its activity,

original: skye ba'i bya ba nyid ma nges so //
analyzed: skye ba'i bya ba nyid ma nges so //
translated: then the activity of arising is not ascertained.

original: reg pa'i bya ba ni tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po gang yin pa de thams cad ni reg pa la brten nas zhes bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: reg pa'i bya ba ni tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po gang yin pa de thams cad ni reg pa la brten nas zhes bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One himself has said that all that is the aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of conception, and the aggregate of formations that is the activity of contact.

original: de ni bya ba gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni bya ba gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach another activity,

original: skye ba zhig med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: skye ba zhig med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: he said, “If there were no arising, etc.”

original: ci'i @190b phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i @190b phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar gzugs la gzugs so zhes snyam pa'i shes pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid la ltos pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la gzugs so zhes snyam pa'i shes pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid la ltos pa yin na /
translated: Thus, if the consciousness that thinks “form” in regard to form depends on its own characteristic,

original: skyes zhes bya ba'i shes pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid la ltos pa yin par mi 'os te /
analyzed: skyes zhes bya ba'i shes pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid la ltos pa yin par mi 'os te /
translated: then the consciousness that thinks “arisen” should not depend on its own characteristic,

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dag la yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa gzugs skyes so //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dag la yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro // de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa gzugs skyes so //
translated: because it would occur in regard to feelings, etc., as well.

original: tshor ba skyes so zhes bya ba la sogs par gang gi rgyu can gyi shes pa de dag 'byung ba'i skye ba ni don gzhan du gyur pa nyid yin pas skye ba la sogs pa rnams yod do zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba skyes so zhes bya ba la sogs par gang gi rgyu can gyi shes pa de dag 'byung ba'i skye ba ni don gzhan du gyur pa nyid yin pas skye ba la sogs pa rnams yod do zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the arising that is the cause of the consciousnesses that occur in such statements as “form has arisen,” “feeling has arisen,” etc., is a different object, and thus one should understand that arising, etc., exist.

original: drug pa'i tshig tu yang mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: drug pa'i tshig tu yang mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The statement “The sixth case would not occur” means the following.

original: gzugs kyi skye ba zhes bya ba drug pa 'di ni 'brel ba'i rgyu can yin la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye ba zhes bya ba drug pa 'di ni 'brel ba'i rgyu can yin la /
translated: The sixth case in “the arising of form” is based on a relation.

original: 'brel pa yang lha sbyin gyi zhang po zhes bya ba ltar gzhan dang gzhan du yin gyi /
analyzed: 'brel pa yang lha sbyin gyi zhang po zhes bya ba ltar gzhan dang gzhan du yin gyi /
translated: And a relation is like the statement “Devadatta’s uncle,” which is based on a difference between two things.

original: de nyid dang / de nyid ma yin pas /
analyzed: de nyid dang / de nyid ma yin pas /
translated: and it is not thatness.

original: gzugs kyi gzugs zhes drug pas bstan par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs kyi skye ba zhes bya bar yang mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gzugs kyi gzugs zhes drug pas bstan par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs kyi skye ba zhes bya bar yang mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: Thus, just as the statement “the form of form” is not to be expressed by the sixth case, so also the statement “the arising of form” is not to be expressed by the sixth case.

original: / de'i phyir drug pas bstan pa 'di ni 'brel pa'i rgyu can yin no zhes bya bar rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: / de'i phyir drug pas bstan pa 'di ni 'brel pa'i rgyu can yin no zhes bya bar rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the sixth case is understood to be based on a relation.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid kyi bar du zhes bya ba la /🔽gnas pa la sogs pa dag med na gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid kyi bar du zhes bya ba la / gnas pa la sogs pa dag med na gnas so //
translated: Similarly, up to and including impermanence.

original: rgas so // zhig go zhes bya ba dang / gzugs kyi gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'i bar gyi drug pa'i tshig tu yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgas so // zhig go zhes bya ba dang / gzugs kyi gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'i bar gyi drug pa'i tshig tu yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If enduring, etc., did not exist, then the statements “endures,” “ages,” and “is destroyed,” and the statements “the enduring of form,” up to and including “the impermanence of form,” would not be expressed by the sixth case.

original: 'o na ni des na zhes bya ba la /🔽gal te skyes so //🔽gnas so zhes bya ba'i shes pa rab tu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na ni des na zhes bya ba la / gal te skyes so // gnas so zhes bya ba'i shes pa rab tu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: But if that is so, then.🔽If you assert that arising, etc., are different objects in order to establish the cognition “it has arisen,”

original: skye ba la sogs pa don gzhan du gyur pa dag 'dod na /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa don gzhan du gyur pa dag 'dod na /
translated: “it endures,”

original: 'o na ni des na bdag med pa'i blo dang / gzugs kyi bdag med pa nyid ces drug pa'i tshig 'grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na ni des na bdag med pa'i blo dang / gzugs kyi bdag med pa nyid ces drug pa'i tshig 'grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: But then, in order to establish the statement, “The cognition of selflessness and the selflessness of form,”

original: bdag med pa nyid cig kyang 'dod par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid cig kyang 'dod par bya ste /
translated: you must accept that there is a single selflessness.

original: bdag med pa'i blo yang skye ba la sogs pa'i blo ltar gzugs dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i blo yang skye ba la sogs pa'i blo ltar gzugs dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu can ni ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of selflessness is not caused by the nature of form, feeling, etc., as is the cognition of arising, etc.,

original: thams cad mtshungs par 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: thams cad mtshungs par 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because all are produced in the same way.

original: / de bzhin du bstan du yod pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du bstan du yod pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same argument applies to the discussion of the obstruction of form.

original: mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa zhes ba ni bye brag pas yongs su brtags pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa zhes ba ni bye brag pas yongs su brtags pa'o //
translated: The phrase “imagined by the heterodox” refers to the imagination of the Vaiśeṣikas.

original: yod pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “existence, etc.”

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rdzas nyid dang / @191a * //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rdzas nyid dang / @191a * //
translated: The word “etc.” includes substantial existence,

original: gzugs nyid dang / bum pa nyid la sogs pa dag sprel lo //
analyzed: gzugs nyid dang / bum pa nyid la sogs pa dag sprel lo //

translated: One must accept small size and large size in order to establish the cognition of small form and large form.

analyzed: gzhan nyid ma yin pa nyid dag kyang khas blang bar bya dgos so //
