analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa sngon du 'gro ba mgrin pa dang / rkan dang mchu dang / so dang / lce phrang pa las yi ge aa la sogs pa'i ngo bor gyur pa'i sgra la ngag ces bya ba la /
translated: Speech is the sound that becomes the nature of the letter a and so on, arising from the throat, palate, lips, teeth, and tongue, preceded by the desire to speak.

original: ngag las tha dad par ming gi tshigs la sogs pa dag rang gi ngo bo 'am 'bras bu'i sgo nas 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ngag las tha dad par ming gi tshigs la sogs pa dag rang gi ngo bo 'am 'bras bu'i sgo nas 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Name, phrase, and syllable are not apprehended as separate from speech, either by their intrinsic nature or by their result.

original: de'i phyir de dag ngag gi rang bzhin kho na yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ngag gi rang bzhin kho na yin la /
translated: Therefore they are the nature of speech.

original: ngag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sgra'i bdag nyid yin pas gzugs kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sgra'i bdag nyid yin pas gzugs kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: And because they are the nature of speech, they are the nature of sound and thus are the nature of form,

original: sgra ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sound is subsumed within the aggregate of form.

original: des na ci'i phyir sems dang ldan pa yin pa rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na ci'i phyir sems dang ldan pa yin pa rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, why are they called “those that possess mind”?

original: de dag rna ba'i dbang pos gzung bar yod bzhin du yang zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rna ba'i dbang pos gzung bar yod bzhin du yang zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Even though they are apprehended by the ear faculty, is what is meant.

original: de dag ni ngag gi rang bzhin ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sgra'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni ngag gi rang bzhin ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sgra'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: They are not of the nature of speech means they are not of the nature of sound.🔽The reason for that is stated:

original: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni ngag gi sgra yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni ngag gi sgra yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The sound of speech is the cause of speech.

original: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “only” is to exclude the exclusion of names, phrases, and letters.

original: sgra ni brgyad nas ming dang tshig gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir don rtogs pa'i rgyu @194a * //
analyzed: sgra ni brgyad nas ming dang tshig gsal bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir don rtogs pa'i rgyu @194a * //
translated: Sound is the cause of understanding the meaning because it manifests names and phrases.

original: yin gyi / ming dang tshig la ltos pa med par dngos su ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yin gyi / ming dang tshig la ltos pa med par dngos su ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not directly the cause of understanding the meaning without relying on names and phrases.

original: de'i phyir gang dag gis don rtogs par byed pa ming dang tshig la sogs pa ngag las tha dad par yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dag gis don rtogs par byed pa ming dang tshig la sogs pa ngag las tha dad par yod do //
translated: Therefore, those that cause the understanding of the meaning, such as names and phrases, exist separately from speech.

original: de'i phyir ngag gis don rjod par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngag gis don rjod par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, speech does not express meaning.

original: 'on ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ci zhe na /
translated: What then does?

original: ngag ni ming gsal bar byed pa'am /🔽ming skyed par byed pa'i phyir ming la 'jug la /
analyzed: ngag ni ming gsal bar byed pa'am / ming skyed par byed pa'i phyir ming la 'jug la /
translated: Speech is called name because it causes the manifestation of name or because it causes the generation of name.

original: ming gis don rjod par byed de /
analyzed: ming gis don rjod par byed de /
translated: Name expresses the object,

original: de go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the object to be understood.

original: 'dis ni ming ni don dag la dngos su 'jug gi / tshig ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni ming ni don dag la dngos su 'jug gi / tshig ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that name directly engages the object, not the word.

original: sgra tsam kho na ni ngag ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra tsam kho na ni ngag ma yin gyi /
translated: Speech is not mere sound,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: but rather what?

original: sgra'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: sgra'i khyad par ro //
translated: It is a particular sound.

original: yang de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is that like?

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: yi ge ka la sogs pa'i bdag nyid sgra gang gis don go bar 'gyur ba'i sgra de dag yin no //
analyzed: yi ge ka la sogs pa'i bdag nyid sgra gang gis don go bar 'gyur ba'i sgra de dag yin no //
translated: Those sounds by which the object is understood, having the nature of the letters ka and so on.

original: ming la sogs pa'i tshogs bkag pas 'dri ba ni sgra gang gis don go bar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa'i tshogs bkag pas 'dri ba ni sgra gang gis don go bar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The question is asked by refuting the collection of name and so on: By what sound is the object understood?

original: gang zhig smra ba po rnams kyis don dag la mtshams gcad pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zhig smra ba po rnams kyis don dag la mtshams gcad pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: That which is the division of speakers with regard to objects.

original: yi ge aa la sogs pa 'di snyed cig gi rim pa 'dis don 'di rjod par byed pa sta /
analyzed: yi ge aa la sogs pa 'di snyed cig gi rim pa 'dis don 'di rjod par byed pa sta /
translated: expresses this meaning.

original: gang zhig de ltar don gang dag la mtshams gcad pa des don rtogs par byed kyi /
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar don gang dag la mtshams gcad pa des don rtogs par byed kyi /
translated: The one who understands the meaning through the exclusion of that which is not that meaning

original: thams cad kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: does not understand the meaning through all the letters.

original: 'dis ni brda la ltos nas sgra don go bar byed kyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni brda la ltos nas sgra don go bar byed kyi /
translated: This shows that the understanding of the meaning of a word depends on convention,

original: thams cad kyis kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: thams cad kyis kyang ma yin la /
translated: not on all the letters,

original: yod pa tsam gyis kyang ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: yod pa tsam gyis kyang ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: and not on the mere presence of the letters.

original: de skad du yang /🔽yul nyid du ni ma gyur pa'i //
analyzed: de skad du yang / yul nyid du ni ma gyur pa'i //
translated: As it is said:

original: sgra yi don ni ston mi byed //🔽de dag ma bzung yid nyid kyis //
analyzed: sgra yi don ni ston mi byed // de dag ma bzung yid nyid kyis //
translated: The word does not express the meaning🔽of that which is not its referent.

original: don rnams gsal bar byed pa min //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: don rnams gsal bar byed pa min // zhes bshad do //
translated: The mind does not grasp the meaning🔽without grasping the word.🔽For example, in the word gaur, etc., the letter ga, the letter u, and the visarga

original: dper na goo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yi geg dang / yi ge aoo dang / tsheg drag gi bdag nyid can gyi sga ni go rims 'dis don dgu dag la mtshams gcad pa de las de dag rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na goo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yi geg dang / yi ge aoo dang / tsheg drag gi bdag nyid can gyi sga ni go rims 'dis don dgu dag la mtshams gcad pa de las de dag rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: mark off nine meanings in this order, and the meaning is understood from that.

original: gang yang ming gis don rjod par byed do snyam du sems pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gang yang ming gis don rjod par byed do snyam du sems pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: “What is the name that expresses the meaning?”

original: ji ltar don go ba can yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar don go ba can yin zhe na /
translated: How does one understand the meaning?

original: don 'di'i ming ni 'di yin no zhes rgyas par byas pa las te /
analyzed: don 'di'i ming ni 'di yin no zhes rgyas par byas pa las te /
translated: “This is the name of this meaning.”

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: don go ba can ma yin pas rtogs na ni brda byang ba med pa yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: don go ba can ma yin pas rtogs na ni brda byang ba med pa yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then even one who has not learned the conventional symbol would understand.

original: 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de ni don go ba can gyi sgra tsam kho nas 'grub la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni don go ba can gyi sgra tsam kho nas 'grub la zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is established by the mere sound that expresses the meaning.

original: don rjod par byed pa de ni ming dang bral zhing don go ba can gyi sgras bsgrub po //🔽'brel pa la byang bas don go ba 'di @194b la yod pa ni sgra don go ba can te /
analyzed: don rjod par byed pa de ni ming dang bral zhing don go ba can gyi sgras bsgrub po // 'brel pa la byang bas don go ba 'di @194b la yod pa ni sgra don go ba can te /
translated: The expression of the meaning is established by the sound that expresses the meaning, without the name.

original: don 'di'i ming ni 'di yin no zhes brdar btags pas 'brel pa la byang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don 'di'i ming ni 'di yin no zhes brdar btags pas 'brel pa la byang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound that expresses the meaning exists in one who is skilled in the conventional symbol, because he is skilled in the conventional symbol through the designation “This is the name of this meaning.”

original: ji ltar na nga ga ming la 'jug pa 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba la /🔽ngag ni sgra'i bdag nyid yin na de gal te rang gi bye brag ming skyed par byed pa 'am /
analyzed: ji ltar na nga ga ming la 'jug pa 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba la / ngag ni sgra'i bdag nyid yin na de gal te rang gi bye brag ming skyed par byed pa 'am /
translated: How is it that this name is applied?

original: gsal bar byed pa zhig yin grang /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa zhig yin grang /
translated: If speech has the nature of sound, then does it generate the name, which is a particular of that sound, or does it manifest the name?

original: de lta yin na 'dir bye brag khas ma blangs pa'i phyir khyu mchog la sogs pa la yod pa'i sgra thams cad kyis kyang ming skyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na 'dir bye brag khas ma blangs pa'i phyir khyu mchog la sogs pa la yod pa'i sgra thams cad kyis kyang ming skyed par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then since no particular is accepted here, all sounds that exist in the best of bulls and so on would generate the name,

original: ngag ni sgra yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyis ming skyed bar byed pa'am gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: ngag ni sgra yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyis ming skyed bar byed pa'am gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro//
translated: because speech is sound and all sounds would generate or manifest the name.

original: 'on te ming bzhin du yi ge'i bdag nyid kyi sgra smra ba po dag gi brdar btags ba khyad par du 'phags pa de kho nas ming skyed par byed do zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te ming bzhin du yi ge'i bdag nyid kyi sgra smra ba po dag gi brdar btags ba khyad par du 'phags pa de kho nas ming skyed par byed do zhes brjod na /
translated: But if you say that the name is generated by that very special sound that has the nature of syllables, like the name, and is designated by the conventions of speakers,

original: de lta na yang 'on te sgra'i khyad par de lta bu zhig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'on te sgra'i khyad par de lta bu zhig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: then in that case, it is as if one were to say, “That particular sound generates the name.”

original: don brjod pa ni don gyi yul can gyi shes pa skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: don brjod pa ni don gyi yul can gyi shes pa skyed pa yin no //
translated: The expression of meaning is the production of consciousness that has meaning as its object.

original: de ni sgra'i khyad par don dag la mtshams gcad pa kho nas byed par 'gyur bas 'dir de la tha dad pa'i ming btags pas ci dgos //
analyzed: de ni sgra'i khyad par don dag la mtshams gcad pa kho nas byed par 'gyur bas 'dir de la tha dad pa'i ming btags pas ci dgos //
translated: Since that is done by the mere delimitation of the meaning by a particular sound, what need is there to impute a separate name to it?

original: 'on te gsal bar byed pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'on te gsal bar byed pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If you say that it clarifies, then this is the extensive explanation.

original: gal te sgra 'byung bas sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa de skye ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te sgra 'byung bas sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa de skye ba ma yin gyi /
translated: If you say that the nonmental factor of speech is not produced by the arising of sound,

original: 'on kyang brjod par bya ba'i phyir des de gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on kyang brjod par bya ba'i phyir des de gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: but rather that it is clarified by that sound in order to be expressed,

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: then this should be addressed.

original: sgra tsam thams cad kyis ming gsal bar byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra tsam thams cad kyis ming gsal bar byed par 'gyur te /
translated: All mere sounds would clarify the name,

original: snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: as before.

original: yang sgra rnams ni tshogs pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang sgra rnams ni tshogs pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Moreover, sounds do not assemble and so on.

original: ngag ni rim gyis yi ge dag la gnas pa'i phyir yi ge rnams kyang skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir yi ge ka la sogs pa'i sgra rnams cig cang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ngag ni rim gyis yi ge dag la gnas pa'i phyir yi ge rnams kyang skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir yi ge ka la sogs pa'i sgra rnams cig cang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Since speech is gradually established in syllables, and since syllables are momentary, the sounds of syllables such as ka do not exist for a long time.

original: cha med pa'i phyir chos gcig cha shas kyis skye ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: cha med pa'i phyir chos gcig cha shas kyis skye ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And since they are partless, a single phenomenon is not produced in parts.

original: skyed par byed pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the statement, “When it produces,”

original: yi ge du ma can gyi ming ni sgra du ma la ltos nas yongs su gcad par bya ba yin pas de skyed par byed pa ni ji ltar ngag gis skyed par byed pa de /🔽ci 'das pa'am /
analyzed: yi ge du ma can gyi ming ni sgra du ma la ltos nas yongs su gcad par bya ba yin pas de skyed par byed pa ni ji ltar ngag gis skyed par byed pa de / ci 'das pa'am /
translated: a name that has many syllables is discerned in dependence on many sounds. Therefore, when it produces that, how does speech produce it?🔽Is it by means of something past or

original: da ltar byung ba zhig gis yin /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba zhig gis yin /
translated: something present?

original: 'di ltar sgra rnams la ni cig car ba nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra rnams la ni cig car ba nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, sounds do not exist as simultaneous,

original: rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir dang / skad cig ma yin pa'i @195a * //
analyzed: rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir dang / skad cig ma yin pa'i @195a * //
translated: because they occur in sequence and because they are momentary.

original: phyir ro // de'i phyir re zhig ji ltar 'das pa la ltos pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par smras so //
analyzed: phyir ro // de'i phyir re zhig ji ltar 'das pa la ltos pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par smras so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “How is it that it produces a name that has many syllables?”

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa len pa'i tshe lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed rnams tshogs pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa len pa'i tshe lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed rnams tshogs pa med mod kyi /
translated: When one takes pratimokṣa vows, the indicative form of body and speech does not exist in the present.

original: 'on kyang 'das pa'i lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig la ltos pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig ma tha ma /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'das pa'i lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig la ltos pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig ma tha ma /
translated: However, the final moment of indicative form that depends on the moment of past indicative form of body and speech🔽generates nonindicative form subsumed by the pratimoksa vows.

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du srog gcod pa spong bar bgyid do zhes bya ba'i sgra gang yin pas so sor thar pas bsdus pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skyed par byed pa de bzhin du 'das pa'i sgra la ltos pa'i ngag gi sgra
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du srog gcod pa spong bar bgyid do zhes bya ba'i sgra gang yin pas so sor thar pas bsdus pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skyed par byed pa de bzhin du 'das pa'i sgra la ltos pa'i ngag gi sgra
translated: Similarly, the final moment of the sound of speech that depends on past sound

original: tha mas ming skyed par byed de /
analyzed: tha mas ming skyed par byed de /
translated: generates the name.

original: de'i phyir gcig cha shas kyis skye bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽de'i phyir don ji snyed dag la mtshams gcad pa'i sgra mtha' dag bye brag med par yid la gzung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig cha shas kyis skye bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro // de'i phyir don ji snyed dag la mtshams gcad pa'i sgra mtha' dag bye brag med par yid la gzung ste /
translated: Therefore it is not the case that one is born in part.

original: phyis rim gyis rjod par byed la /
analyzed: phyis rim gyis rjod par byed la /
translated: Therefore, one should mentally retain all words that delimit the extent of the meaning without distinction and later one should express them in sequence.

original: rtogs pa po yang rim gyis kho nas mnyan nas phyis thams cad bye brag med par yid la byed do //
analyzed: rtogs pa po yang rim gyis kho nas mnyan nas phyis thams cad bye brag med par yid la byed do //
translated: The person who understands also hears them in sequence, but later he considers them all without distinction.

original: de ltar na 'o na ni sgra tha ma kho nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na ni sgra tha ma kho nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If that is so, then the last sound alone, etc.

original: yi ge du ma can du ma can gyi ming la /
analyzed: yi ge du ma can du ma can gyi ming la /
translated: A name is made up of many syllables.

original: gang gi yi ge thams bsdus pa'i sgra thos pa des kyang don de go bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi yi ge thams bsdus pa'i sgra thos pa des kyang don de go bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one hears the last sound that includes all the syllables, one understands the meaning,

original: dper na bha wa r'a ta brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bha wa r'a ta brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: just as when one says bhavārtha.

original: yi ge ta'i dus su ming skyed pa'i phyir yi ge bha dang yi ge wa dang yi ge r'a ma thos par yi ge ta thos pas de go bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ge ta'i dus su ming skyed pa'i phyir yi ge bha dang yi ge wa dang yi ge r'a ma thos par yi ge ta thos pas de go bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the name is produced at the time of the syllable ta, one understands it by hearing the syllable ta without hearing the syllables bha, va, and ra.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgra phyi ma kho nas ming skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra phyi ma kho nas ming skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the last sound produces the name.

original: gal te dmigs pa'i sgra la ltos pa'i sgra thams ming skyed par byed pas nyes pa 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa'i sgra la ltos pa'i sgra thams ming skyed par byed pas nyes pa 'di med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that this fault does not occur because the name is produced by all the sounds that depend on the objective sound,

original: de lta na 'o na rnam par rig byed dpe ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na rnam par rig byed dpe ma yin te /
translated: then the indicative action is not an example.

original: rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig ma tha ma ni rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig sngar skyes pa dmigs shing 'gags pa dag la ltos nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skyed par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig ma tha ma ni rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig sngar skyes pa dmigs shing 'gags pa dag la ltos nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skyed par mi byed kyi /
translated: The final moment of indicative form does not generate nonindicative form in dependence on the prior generation and cessation of earlier moments of indicative form.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de yod pa tsam nyid la ltos nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de yod pa tsam nyid la ltos nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is the mere existence of that which serves as the cause of nonindicative form.

original: de lta ma yin na g-yengs pa dang sems med pa la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na g-yengs pa dang sems med pa la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then nonindicative form would not exist for those with distracted minds or for those without minds.

original: de'i phyir sgra tha ma ni rnam par rig byed kho na ltar ming skyed par byed kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra tha ma ni rnam par rig byed kho na ltar ming skyed par byed kyi /
translated: Therefore, just as the final moment of indicative form generates name, so too does the final moment of sound.

original: sngar gyi sgra dmigs pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar gyi sgra dmigs pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not depend on the prior observation of sound.

original: 'on te 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'on te 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If you think that, etc.

original: de ltar na smras ma thag pa'i skyon @195b med de /
analyzed: de ltar na smras ma thag pa'i skyon @195b med de /
translated: There is no fault in the just explained position.

original: sgra re re la yi ge skye ba'i phyir dang / yi ge dag gis kyang ming skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra re re la yi ge skye ba'i phyir dang / yi ge dag gis kyang ming skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because each sound produces a syllable, and syllables produce a name.

original: 'di la yang skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba ni sgra rnams ming skyed pa la bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba ni sgra rnams ming skyed pa la bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The same error applies here as well, that is, the error that applies to the thesis that sounds produce a name.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: yi ge rnams ni tshogs pa med pa'i phyir dang / sgra ltar rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir dang ; skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir yi ge rnams la yang cig car ba nyid med do //
analyzed: yi ge rnams ni tshogs pa med pa'i phyir dang / sgra ltar rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir dang ; skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir yi ge rnams la yang cig car ba nyid med do //
translated: Syllables do not have simultaneous activity because syllables do not exist as a collection, because they are applied sequentially like sounds, and because they are momentary.

original: der ming yi ge du mas bskyed par bya ba cha med pa gcig la rim gyis cha shas kyis skye bar yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: der ming yi ge du mas bskyed par bya ba cha med pa gcig la rim gyis cha shas kyis skye bar yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is also unreasonable that a single partless name is produced sequentially by many syllables in a name.

original: ci ste 'das pa'i yi ge la ltos pa'i yi ge phyi ma kho nas ming skyed par byed do snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste 'das pa'i yi ge la ltos pa'i yi ge phyi ma kho nas ming skyed par byed do snyam na /
translated: If you think that a name is produced by the last syllable alone, which depends on past syllables,

original: de lta na 'o na ni gang gis yi ge tha ma skyed par byed pa'i sgra thos pa nges kyang /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni gang gis yi ge tha ma skyed par byed pa'i sgra thos pa nges kyang /
translated: then in that case, even though the sound that produces the last syllable is heard,

original: don de go bar 'gyur te yi ge tha ma kho nas ming skyed pa'i phyir dang / ming gis kyang don rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don de go bar 'gyur te yi ge tha ma kho nas ming skyed pa'i phyir dang / ming gis kyang don rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is understood because the final letter alone generates the name, and the name also expresses the meaning.

original: ngag mi gsal bar byed pa yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ngag mi gsal bar byed pa yin na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Even if the letters are not clearly articulated,

original: gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig ce na /
translated: what is that?

original: ming skyed par byed pa nyid la bstan pa de kho na'o //
analyzed: ming skyed par byed pa nyid la bstan pa de kho na'o //
translated: It is just the generation of the name that was explained.

original: yang sgra rnams ni tshogs pa med la /
analyzed: yang sgra rnams ni tshogs pa med la /
translated: The sounds do not exist in an assemblage,🔽and it is not logical for a single phenomenon to be clearly articulated in parts.

original: chos gcig la cha shas kyis gsal ba yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba thams cad rgyas par brjod bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos gcig la cha shas kyis gsal ba yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba thams cad rgyas par brjod bar bya'o //
translated: All of this should be stated in detail.

original: gong du ni ngag las tha dad pa'i yi ge khas blangs nas yi ge ming gis skyed pa nyid yin pa bkag pa yin la /
analyzed: gong du ni ngag las tha dad pa'i yi ge khas blangs nas yi ge ming gis skyed pa nyid yin pa bkag pa yin la /
translated: Previously, having accepted that letters are different from speech, it was refuted that letters generate the name.

original: da ni ngag las tha dad pa'i yi ge yod pa ma yin pa nyid de nyid kyi phyir yi ge yang ngag ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: da ni ngag las tha dad pa'i yi ge yod pa ma yin pa nyid de nyid kyi phyir yi ge yang ngag ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Now, because letters do not exist as different from speech, it is stated in detail that letters are called speech.

original: ngag las tha dad pa'i yi ge ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ngag las tha dad pa'i yi ge ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Letters that are different from speech do not exist.

original: de'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa'i yi ge ji ltar ngag gis skyed pa'am gsal bar byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa'i yi ge ji ltar ngag gis skyed pa'am gsal bar byed /
translated: Therefore, how could a nonexistent letter be produced or manifested by speech?

original: 'di ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: de'i phyir shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “The wise person, etc.”

original: shes rab 'chal ba ni shes rab nyams pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba ni shes rab nyams pa'i phyir la /
translated: The unwise person is not able to ascertain because of the degeneration of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi ldan pa yang g-yeng ba yod pa'i phyir yongs su bcad par mi nus pas shes rab dang ldan pa yid gtad pas kyang zhes gnyis ka brjod do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ldan pa yang g-yeng ba yod pa'i phyir yongs su bcad par mi nus pas shes rab dang ldan pa yid gtad pas kyang zhes gnyis ka brjod do //
translated: The wise person is also not able to ascertain because of distraction. Therefore, both are mentioned: “The wise person, etc.”

original: mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas so //
translated: By means of its characteristic means by means of its own nature.

original: de'i phyir ngag las tha dad pa'i yi ge med pas ngag ni ming ltar yi ge skyed par byed pa yin par yang mi rung la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngag las tha dad pa'i yi ge med pas ngag ni ming ltar yi ge skyed par byed pa yin par yang mi rung la /
translated: Therefore, since there is no letter apart from speech, it is not tenable that speech produces the letter, like a name.

original: gsal bar byed pa yin par yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa yin par yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also not tenable that it manifests the letter.

original: gzhan yang ngag ni sgra tsam yin pa'i phyir sgra tsam thams cad yi ge skyed pa'am @196a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang ngag ni sgra tsam yin pa'i phyir sgra tsam thams cad yi ge skyed pa'am @196a * //
translated: Moreover, since speech is mere sound, all mere sound would produce or manifest the letter.

original: gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes thams cad 'dir yang rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes thams cad 'dir yang rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: and it is clear that all of this should be elaborated here.

original: 'on te ming don dang lhan cig skyed pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'on te ming don dang lhan cig skyed pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: But if the name is produced together with the object, etc.

original: de la ngag gi bya ba med pa'i phyir skyed pa med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de la ngag gi bya ba med pa'i phyir skyed pa med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: , then it is thought that there is no production because there is no activity of speech.

original: de lta na don 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de lta na don 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Thus, the past and future of the object, etc.

original: ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa rnam pa da ltar ba ma yin pa de bzhin du ming yang da ltar ba yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa rnam pa da ltar ba ma yin pa de bzhin du ming yang da ltar ba yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the past and future of arising, enduring, aging, and impermanence, and the arising of arising, etc., are not present, so also the name would not be present.

original: de'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i tha snyad kun du chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i tha snyad kun du chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the conventions of the past and future would be interrupted.

original: 'di ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ming gis ni don brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ming gis ni don brjod par mi nus te /
translated: In this way, the past and future cannot express the object by means of the name.

original: ngag bzhin no //
analyzed: ngag bzhin no //
translated: Like speech.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ngag gis ni ming gsal bar bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ngag gis ni ming gsal bar bya bar mi nus te /
translated: One cannot clarify the name of the past and future by means of speech.🔽

original: go rims bzhin du 'gags zin ba'i phyir dang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du 'gags zin ba'i phyir dang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The past and future cannot clarify names, because they are respectively already ceased and not yet arisen.

original: pha rnams kyis bu dag gis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pha rnams kyis bu dag gis zhes bya ba la /
translated: The father says to his son:

original: gcig gi ming ni skye ba la sogs pa bzhin du gcig kho na lhan cig skye'i /
analyzed: gcig gi ming ni skye ba la sogs pa bzhin du gcig kho na lhan cig skye'i /
translated: Just as one name is generated in dependence on one thing,

original: rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir du ma ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir du ma ni ma yin pas /
translated: not many names, because there is no such convention.

original: 'dir ming gang gis de dang lhan cig skyes par brjod par bya /🔽chos 'dus ma byas rnams kyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir ming gang gis de dang lhan cig skyes par brjod par bya / chos 'dus ma byas rnams kyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: So here, by what name would you say that it is generated together with that?🔽The father says to his son:

original: ming ni mi skye ba'i chos can kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ming ni mi skye ba'i chos can kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: The name would be only a non-arisen phenomenon,

original: 'dus ma byas rnams mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnams mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because unconditioned phenomena are not generated.

original: tshigs bcad ming la brten pa ste //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshigs bcad ming la brten pa ste // zhes bya ba la /
translated: A verse is based on a name.

original: 'dir ldan pa ma yin pa'i ming yod do zhes bya ba'i khungs ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ldan pa ma yin pa'i ming yod do zhes bya ba'i khungs ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the source for the statement that there are non-associated names,

original: de med na tshigs su bcad pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na tshigs su bcad pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it did not exist, it would follow that there would be no verses.

original: rten med par ni brten pa yod par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: rten med par ni brten pa yod par bya bar mi nus so //
translated: It is not possible to have a supported without a support.

original: tshigs su bcad pa ming la brten pa bden mod kyi /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ming la brten pa bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true that a verse is based on names,

original: der ming ldan pa ma yin pa zhal gyis ma bzhes te /
analyzed: der ming ldan pa ma yin pa zhal gyis ma bzhes te /
translated: but it is not admitted that it is endowed with names.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: don rnams la mtshams byas pa'i sgra ni ming yin la /
analyzed: don rnams la mtshams byas pa'i sgra ni ming yin la /
translated: A name is a sound that delimits an object.

original: ming rnams bkod pa'i khyad bar yang tshigs su bcad pa yin pas ming rjod par byed pa ji ltar bkod pa rnams kyis tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba thob pa'i bkod pa de tshigs su bcad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ming rnams bkod pa'i khyad bar yang tshigs su bcad pa yin pas ming rjod par byed pa ji ltar bkod pa rnams kyis tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba thob pa'i bkod pa de tshigs su bcad pa yin gyi /
translated: Since a verse is a particular arrangement of names, it is called a verse because of the arrangement of the names that express it.

original: thams cad ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: That arrangement is a verse, not everything.🔽In order to make this known, he says, “a particular arrangement.

original: bkod pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bkod pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The particular arrangement is mentioned.🔽🔽

original: de dag ji ltar bkod pa'i tshigs @196b su bcad pa'i ming 'thob pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar bkod pa'i tshigs @196b su bcad pa'i ming 'thob pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Since it is just because of that that the arrangement obtains the name of a verse,

original: bkod pa'i khyad par yang rdzas gzhan du mi 'thad do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bkod pa'i khyad par yang rdzas gzhan du mi 'thad do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, “A particular arrangement is not tenable as a substance.🔽”

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: phreng ba bzhin no //
analyzed: phreng ba bzhin no //
translated: Like a garland.

original: ji ltar phreng ni shing ljon pa dang / 'dab chags dang / grog ma la sogs pa rnams phan tshun nye ba na gnas pa las ma gtogs pa'i rdzas gzhan du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: ji ltar phreng ni shing ljon pa dang / 'dab chags dang / grog ma la sogs pa rnams phan tshun nye ba na gnas pa las ma gtogs pa'i rdzas gzhan du mi 'thad do //
translated: A garland is not tenable as a different substance from the flowers,🔽a tree from the branches, a bird from the feathers, an ant from the ants’ eggs, and so on.🔽

original: spungs pa bzhin du de ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spungs pa bzhin du de ma bzung na de'i blo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A garland is not tenable as a different substance from the trees, birds, ants, etc. that are strung together, because it is not apprehended when they are not apprehended, like a heap.

original: de ldan yang dpe mi mtshungs te /
analyzed: de ldan yang dpe mi mtshungs te /
translated: Even though it is apprehended, the example is not similar,

original: shing ljon pa la sogs pa da ltar ba rnams kho na'i bkod pa'i khyad par la phrad du bsnyad pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: shing ljon pa la sogs pa da ltar ba rnams kho na'i bkod pa'i khyad par la phrad du bsnyad pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: because the difference in arrangement of the trees, etc. that exist in the present is called a garland.

original: de'i phyir / sems kyi rim pa lta bu'o zhes smos te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir / sems kyi rim pa lta bu'o zhes smos te ;
translated: Therefore it is said, “It is like the sequence of mind.”🔽Just as the sequence of mind and mental factors that arise in the past and future is not a different substance from mind and mental factors, because it is not apprehended when they are not apprehended, like a heap.

original: / ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba dus snga phyir byung ba rnams la bar med par 'gag pa dang skye ba las ma gtogs pa'i rim pa gzhan yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du sgra snga phyir byung ba rnams la yang bar mtshams med par
analyzed: / ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba dus snga phyir byung ba rnams la bar med par 'gag pa dang skye ba las ma gtogs pa'i rim pa gzhan yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du sgra snga phyir byung ba rnams la yang bar mtshams med par
translated: Just as the sequence of mind and mental factors that arise in the past and future is not a different substance from mind and mental factors, because it is not apprehended when they are not apprehended, like a heap.

original: 'gag pa dang / skye ba las ma gtogs pa'i bkod pa'i khyad par ma dmigs so //
analyzed: 'gag pa dang / skye ba las ma gtogs pa'i bkod pa'i khyad par ma dmigs so //
translated: and the difference in the arrangement of the letters is not perceived apart from the cessation and arising of the letters.

original: de'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs ba'i sgra rnams kyang sems ltar bkod pa'i khyad par gyi rten gyi ngo bor mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs ba'i sgra rnams kyang sems ltar bkod pa'i khyad par gyi rten gyi ngo bor mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, the sounds of the past and future are not contradictory as the basis of the difference in the arrangement of the mind.

original: yi ge tsam zhig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: yi ge tsam zhig ces bya ba la /
translated: As for the mere letters,

original: nyes pa chung ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nyes pa chung ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin gyi /
translated: it is thought that the fault is slight.

original: nges par ma zin pa'i phyir gang las khyad par 'phags pa'i yi ge yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nges par ma zin pa'i phyir gang las khyad par 'phags pa'i yi ge yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that there are letters that are superior to those that are ascertained.

original: de dag tu rtog pa don med pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag tu rtog pa don med pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is meaningless to imagine that they exist in those places.

original: yi ge dag las ming dang tshig yongs su rtog pa don med do //
analyzed: yi ge dag las ming dang tshig yongs su rtog pa don med do //
translated: It is meaningless to imagine that names and phrases exist in letters.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi rang bzhin ming gi tshogs la sogs pa ni rdzas su yod pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi rang bzhin ming gi tshogs la sogs pa ni rdzas su yod pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that the collections of names, phrases, and letters that are by nature nonassociated compositional factors definitely exist as real substances.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what source?

original: lung las te /
analyzed: lung las te /
translated: From scripture.

original: ji skad du dge slong dag brnyes pa mchog dang / snyan pa mchog brnyes pa'i de de bzhin gshegs pa ni ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs brnyes pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du dge slong dag brnyes pa mchog dang / snyan pa mchog brnyes pa'i de de bzhin gshegs pa ni ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs brnyes pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “Monks, the Tathāgata, who has attained the highest fame and the highest renown, has attained the collection of names, the collection of phrases, and the collection of letters.”

original: brnyes pa ni rnyed pa yin na dngos po med pa ni brnyes par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: brnyes pa ni rnyed pa yin na dngos po med pa ni brnyes par mi rung ngo //
translated: If attainment is the acquisition of something, then it is not tenable that a non-thing is attained.

original: gzhan yang chos thams cad rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos thams cad rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, since all things are not the domain of sophistry,

original: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma las 'grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma las 'grub pa yin gyi /
translated: they are established by means of the valid knowledge of trustworthy scripture.

original: chos kha cig de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul kho na yin pa yang @197a * //
analyzed: chos kha cig de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul kho na yin pa yang @197a * //
translated: Some things are the domain of the wisdom of the Tathāgata alone.

original: yod do // rnam pa'i bye brag bshad pa brjod par 'dod pas dri ba byed pa ni /
analyzed: yod do // rnam pa'i bye brag bshad pa brjod par 'dod pas dri ba byed pa ni /
translated: In order to explain the different types, he asks a question:

original: yang ci ming gi tshogs la sogs pa 'di dag gang dang ldan pa'am zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang ci ming gi tshogs la sogs pa 'di dag gang dang ldan pa'am zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: “Are these collections of names and so on possessed by someone?” and so on.

original: gang dang ldan zhes bya ba ni khams gang dang ldan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang dang ldan zhes bya ba ni khams gang dang ldan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Which realm” means which realm.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa kho na yin gyi ;
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa kho na yin gyi ;
translated: They exist in the desire realm and the form realm,

original: gzugs med par gtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med par gtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but not in the formless realm,

original: de na ngag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na ngag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because speech does not exist there.

original: gzhan dag na re gzugs med par gtogs pa yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gzugs med par gtogs pa yang yod mod kyi /
translated: Others say that they also exist in the formless realm,🔽but they are not expressible.

original: de dag ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba la gzhan gyis pa'i ngag gis sa gzhan gyi ming gi tshogs la sogs pa dag brjod pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba la gzhan gyis pa'i ngag gis sa gzhan gyi ming gi tshogs la sogs pa dag brjod pa ni ma yin la /
translated: Speech of one realm does not express the collection of names, etc. of another realm.

original: gzugs med pa dag na ngag med bas brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag na ngag med bas brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: And because there is no speech in the formless realm, they are not expressible.

original: de dag ni sems can du bgrang ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni sems can du bgrang ba yin te /
translated: They are counted as sentient beings,🔽because they do not possess any non-sentient states, with the exception of the two cessations.

original: 'gog pa gnyis ma gtogs pa'i sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa dang ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro gang zhig rjod par byed pa de dag dang ldan gyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gog pa gnyis ma gtogs pa'i sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa dang ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro gang zhig rjod par byed pa de dag dang ldan gyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who express them possess them.

original: gang rjod par bya ba de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i dogs ba 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: gang rjod par bya ba de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i dogs ba 'di gang las she na /

translated: Since there is no homogeneous cause that arises from the cause of karmic maturation, the homogeneous cause of dharmas that are wholesome, etc., other than those that arise from the cause of karmic maturation is the cause of karmic maturation.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams kyang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams kyi ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go //

analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyi ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go //
translated: For the remaining they are derived from natural outflow.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba dag ni med de /
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba dag ni med de /

analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la bsags pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas bsdus pa'i phyir rnam par smin ba ma yin no //

translated: Karmic maturation is only the two absorptions and formless states that are birth existence.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also not enhancement because they are not form.

original: mi ldan pa ni ma thob pa ste /
analyzed: mi ldan pa ni ma thob pa ste /

original: rnam par smin pa'i mi ldan pa ni rnam par smin pa yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i mi ldan pa ni rnam par smin pa yin par mi rung ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag gsum ka yang rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yin @198a * //

translated: What are the remaining topics?🔽Obtainment, meditative attainment, and the characteristics of sentient beings and non-sentient beings,🔽the three realms of sentient beings and non-sentient beings, nonpossession, virtue, nonvirtue, and neutral states, the three realms of nonpossession, neutral states, and meditative attainment,

original: gzugs su gtogs pa nyid dang / gzugs med par gtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs su gtogs pa nyid dang / gzugs med par gtogs pa nyid do //

analyzed: ldan pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir sems can du ston pa nyid bshad zin to //

analyzed: 'gog pa gnyis ma gtogs pa sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa dang ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ji ltar dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa nyid bshad ce na /

analyzed: dge ba la sogs zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ji ltar khams gsum pa nyid dang / mi ldan pa nyid bshad ce na /

analyzed: der gtogs rnams kyi rang khams pa //

analyzed: ma gtogs rnams kyi rnam pa bzhi // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: thams cad 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And, All are characterized by the three times.

analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams kyi sems can dang sems can ma yin par ston pa dang / khams gsum pa dang / mi ldan pa nyid bshad do //
translated: Therefore the characteristics of conditioned states are explained as being sentient beings and non sentient beings, belonging to the three realms and nonassociated compositional factors.🔽The Abhidharmakośa declares,

original: sems kyi rjes 'jug dus dang ni //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes 'jug dus dang ni //
translated: Those concomitant with mind, time,

original: 'bras sogs dge la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'bras sogs dge la sogs pas so //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa nyid do // 'du shes med snyoms 'jug / bsam gtan tha mar zhes bya ba dang / dge ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Virtue, nonvirtue and neutral states

analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang ldan pa dang / dge ba bshad do //
translated: The meditative attainment of nondiscernment is explained as belonging to the form realm and as virtuous because it is said:🔽It is the final stage of absorption and it is virtuous.

original: da nyid kyi phyir sems can du bstan pa yang yin te /
analyzed: da nyid kyi phyir sems can du bstan pa yang yin te /
translated: It is also called a sentient being because it is said:

original: skyes nas myong 'gyur nyid ces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes nas myong 'gyur nyid ces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is experienced after rebirth.🔽The meditative attainment of cessation is explained as belonging to the formless realm and as virtuous because it is said:

analyzed: dge ba 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mi ldan pa ni khams gsum pa kho na ste / 'dod sogs gtogs dang dri med kyi'ang //
translated: Nonpossession is only of the three realms.🔽It is said:

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //

original: ma thob pa ni sems can du ston pa yin te /
analyzed: ma thob pa ni sems can du ston pa yin te /

analyzed: rang rgyud du gtogs pa rnams kyi'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained that nonobtainment is unobscured and neutral.

original: 'du shes med pa pa ni gzugs su gtogs pa dang / sems can du ston pa dang ; lung du ma bstan pa dang / rnam par smin par bshad de /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa ni gzugs su gtogs pa dang / sems can du ston pa dang ; lung du ma bstan pa dang / rnam par smin par bshad de /
translated: The state of nondiscernment is explained as belonging to the form realm, being a sentient being, being neutral and being karmic maturation.

original: rnam smin de 'bras che zhes 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam smin de 'bras che zhes 'byung pa'i phyir ro //

original: srog ni khams gsum pa ste /
analyzed: srog ni khams gsum pa ste /

original: srog gi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po gang zhe na /

analyzed: khams gsum pa'i tshe yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / sems can du ston pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa yang yin te /

analyzed: srog gi rnam smin zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //

original: ldan pa ma yin pa rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The non-associated formative forces have been explained.

original: rgyu dang rkyen dang sbrel bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dang sbrel bar bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dag med par ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Without causes and conditions,🔽there is no arising of any conditioned thing whatsoever.

original: gang bshad pa /
analyzed: gang bshad pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: rgyu rnams ni gang /
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni gang /

original: rkyen rnams ni gang zhe na zhes bye brag tu 'dri ba /
analyzed: rkyen rnams ni gang zhe na zhes bye brag tu 'dri ba /

original: rgyu rnams las rkyen rnams la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rgyu rnams las rkyen rnams la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between causes and conditions?

original: kha cig na re ci yang med de /
analyzed: kha cig na re ci yang med de /
translated: Some say: There is no difference at all.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag pa'i lta ba bskyed pa la rgyu gnyis dang / rkyen gnyis te /
