analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra dang nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The voice of another and proper attention of the mind itself.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen dag dang / byed rgyu dang rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs dag go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen dag dang / byed rgyu dang rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs dag go zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, cause, condition, and reason are synonyms.

original: gal te khyad par med na ci'i phyir bye brag tu bstan ce na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par med na ci'i phyir bye brag tu bstan ce na /
translated: If there is no difference, why are they taught separately?

original: gdul ba la ltos nas te /
analyzed: gdul ba la ltos nas te /
translated: They are taught separately with regard to the disciples.

original: khams dang skye mched bzhin no //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched bzhin no //
translated: For example, the elements and sense bases are taught separately.

original: 'di ltar rkyen khyad par med par bstan la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rkyen khyad par med par bstan la /
translated: Thus, conditions are taught without distinction,

original: rgyu ni khyad par du bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu ni khyad par du bstan to //
translated: but causes are taught with distinction.

original: gzhan dag na re nye ba ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re nye ba ni rgyu yin la /
translated: Others say: A cause is proximate,

original: ring ba ni rkyen yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ring ba ni rkyen yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: but a condition is distant.🔽The active cause is co-arising.

original: byed rgyu lhan cig 'byung nyid dang // zhes bya ba @199a * //🔽rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: byed rgyu lhan cig 'byung nyid dang // zhes bya ba @199a * // rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The active cause is co-arising.

original: de nyid ces bya ba'i tshig phrad gnyis ni go rim sa bzhin du bsdu ba nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba'i tshig phrad gnyis ni go rim sa bzhin du bsdu ba nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: The two phrases “just that” are to be understood in the reverse order.

original: byed rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis kho na 'dus byas thams cad la khyab ba nyid du nges par 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: byed rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba gnyis kho na 'dus byas thams cad la khyab ba nyid du nges par 'dzin par byed do //
translated: They are to be understood as definitely including only the active cause and co-arising as the two that pervade all conditioned states.

original: gang dag bstan bcos 'dir tha snyad du byed pa drug po 'di rnams rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gang dag bstan bcos 'dir tha snyad du byed pa drug po 'di rnams rgyu yin no //
translated: The six causes that are mentioned in this treatise are causes in the sense of being the reason for the designation of a thing.

original: 'thob par byed pas na rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'thob par byed pas na rgyu ste /
translated: They are causes because they cause the obtaining of a thing.

original: dngos pos skye ba thob par byed du 'jug ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos pos skye ba thob par byed du 'jug ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they cause the obtaining of the arising of a thing.

original: byed pa nyid rgyu yin pa ni byed rgyu'o //🔽lhan cig 'byung ba yang de yin la /
analyzed: byed pa nyid rgyu yin pa ni byed rgyu'o // lhan cig 'byung ba yang de yin la /
translated: The cause that is the agent is the active cause.

original: rgyu yang yin pas sam /
analyzed: rgyu yang yin pas sam /
translated: It is co-originated and it is a cause, or

original: lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //🔽skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ni skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o // skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ni skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: the cause of co-originated factors is the co-originated cause.🔽The cause that is a homogeneous cause is the homogeneous cause.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi rgyu ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi rgyu ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause that is an associated cause is the associated cause.🔽It is a pervasive cause and it is a cause, or

original: kun du 'gro ba yang de yin la rgyu yang yin pas na kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba yang de yin la rgyu yang yin pas na kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: the cause of pervasive factors is the pervasive cause.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause that is a ripening cause is the ripening cause.

original: yang ci ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bstan pa'i rgyu rnams kyis bstan bcos su tha snyad byed ce na /
analyzed: yang ci ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bstan pa'i rgyu rnams kyis bstan bcos su tha snyad byed ce na /
translated: How are the causes that are not mentioned by the Blessed One in the sutras referred to in the treatise?

original: bye brag tu smra ba na re /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba na re /
translated: Vaibhāṣikas say:

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bstan pa ni 'ga' yang chos mngon par spros pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bstan pa ni 'ga' yang chos mngon par spros pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no proliferation of Abhidharma that is not taught by the Bhagavat.

original: gal te yang nub pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bos dmigs pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang nub pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bos dmigs pa med mod kyi /
translated: Even though it does not exist by way of its own nature because it has disappeared,

original: 'on kyang gdul ba'i dbang gis la la las rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas nye bar bstan pa'i sa bon tsam mthong bas yod pa nyid du dmigs nas chos mngon par gsal bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gdul ba'i dbang gis la la las rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas nye bar bstan pa'i sa bon tsam mthong bas yod pa nyid du dmigs nas chos mngon par gsal bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: nevertheless, due to the power of disciples, the mere seed of the Abhidharma is seen through the door of other aspects and exists as observed.

original: 'di ltar / mdo sde de dang der rgyu 'di rnams sbyar bar snang ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar / mdo sde de dang der rgyu 'di rnams sbyar bar snang ste /
translated: Thus, in this and that sūtra, these causes are applied.

original: dper na mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba ni byed rgyu ste /
analyzed: dper na mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba ni byed rgyu ste /
translated: For example, “Eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form” is the active cause.

original: 'di ni skyed par byed pa dang gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ni skyed par byed pa dang gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This is posited as the nature of that which generates and does not obstruct.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa ni lhan cig skye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa ni lhan cig skye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: This is the co-originating cause.

original: 'di ni phan tshun rjes su 'jug pas bya ba gcig pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ni phan tshun rjes su 'jug pas bya ba gcig pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This is established by the meaning of the same action, since they mutually follow each other.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan skye bar 'gyur ba dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du ma chad pa rdul dang mnyam pa zhig yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bas ni 'dir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu bstan par mngon no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan skye bar 'gyur ba dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du ma chad pa rdul dang mnyam pa zhig yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bas ni 'dir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu bstan par mngon no //
translated: The statement, “there is no wholesome root that is not severed, equal to the atoms of the body, from which another wholesome root would arise,” clearly demonstrates the homogeneous cause.🔽Faith that is rooted in seeing is concomitant with the knowledge that arises from learning.

original: mthong ba'i @199b rtsa ba can gyi dad ba ni rig nas shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan no zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i @199b rtsa ba can gyi dad ba ni rig nas shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan no zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: This is the concomitant cause.

original: 'di ni dmigs pa gcig pa'i don gyi rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ni dmigs pa gcig pa'i don gyi rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This is established by the meaning of the same object.

original: lta bar gyur pa gang cung zad cig 'byung ba de thams cad ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can no zhes bya ba 'di ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu 'o //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa gang cung zad cig 'byung ba de thams cad ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can no zhes bya ba 'di ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu 'o //
translated: This is the universal cause.

original: 'dir las dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa bsgoms pa las byung ba byas pa'i rnam par smin pa ni der skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyis so sor yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'dir las dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa bsgoms pa las byung ba byas pa'i rnam par smin pa ni der skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyis so sor yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Here, the cause of karmic maturation is the karmic maturation of any virtuous karma with outflows that is produced by meditation, which is experienced by sentient beings who are born there.

original: 'bras bu mi 'dra ba 'phen par byed pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi 'dra ba 'phen par byed pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is posited as the cause that projects a dissimilar result.

original: de ltar na rgyu de dag ston pa sangs rgyas kyis nye bar bstan mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu de dag ston pa sangs rgyas kyis nye bar bstan mod kyi /
translated: Thus the Teacher Buddha taught those causes.

original: mod sde pa rnams kyis ni rab tu sdang bas ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: mod sde pa rnams kyis ni rab tu sdang bas ma mthong ngo //
translated: But the Vaibhasikas do not see them because of their hostility.

original: rgyu rnams ni drug go zhes grangs drug tu yongs su chad pa'i mdo ni rtsa ba'i bsdus pa nyams pas gcig las 'phros pa'i lung du nyams mod kyi /
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni drug go zhes grangs drug tu yongs su chad pa'i mdo ni rtsa ba'i bsdus pa nyams pas gcig las 'phros pa'i lung du nyams mod kyi /
translated: The sutra that delineates six causes as six numbers is damaged in the transmission of the root collection and is damaged in the transmission of the sutra that is an extension of one sutra.

original: de gnas brtan k'a ty'a ya na'i bu la lhas nye bar gtang pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnas brtan k'a ty'a ya na'i bu la lhas nye bar gtang pa yin no //
translated: This is what the gods have given to the elder Katyayana.

original: de'i phyir mdo'i don kho na rnam par bshad pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo'i don kho na rnam par bshad pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, only the meaning of the sutra is explained,

original: mdo dang 'gal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo dang 'gal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: and it is not contradictory to the sutra.

original: rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu //
analyzed: rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu //
translated: The efficient cause is different from the effect.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what is said.

original: bdag nyid la byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir na rang las gzhan pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bdag nyid la byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir na rang las gzhan pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since it is impossible for something to act on itself, it is said to be different from itself.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams so //
translated: All phenomena means conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir la /
translated: Since nirvana is contradictory to engagement,

original: lam ni nyon mongs pa skye ba dang 'gal pa'i phyir ji ltar chos thams cad byed rgyu nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: lam ni nyon mongs pa skye ba dang 'gal pa'i phyir ji ltar chos thams cad byed rgyu nyid yin zhe na /
translated: and the path is contradictory to the arising of afflictions, how can all phenomena be the efficient cause?

original: skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it abides as the nature of not obstructing arising.

original: 'bras bu mi skye ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi skye ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The non-arising of an effect is of two kinds:

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / gegs byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir dang / gegs byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cause, and because there is an obstruction.

original: bzlog ste rgyu yod phyir dang / gegs byed pa med pa'i phyir ni skye ba yin pas gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa las rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu yin par grub po //
analyzed: bzlog ste rgyu yod phyir dang / gegs byed pa med pa'i phyir ni skye ba yin pas gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa las rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu yin par grub po //
translated: The opposite is the case: because the cause exists and because there is no obstruction, there is arising. Thus, the cause of the effect that is not itself is established as the active cause that is present as the nonobstruction of arising.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs na skad cig mas bar chod pa med pas 'byung ba'i chos la ni skye bzhin pa zhes brjod do //🔽zag pa gang dag mi shes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs na skad cig mas bar chod pa med pas 'byung ba'i chos la ni skye bzhin pa zhes brjod do // zag pa gang dag mi shes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: When causes and conditions assemble, there is no interruption by another moment, and the arising of a phenomenon is called “arising.”

original: mi shes pa ni zag pa la skye ba la gtso bo'i rgyu yin te /🔽de'i phyir zag pa gang dag mi shes pa de la de @200a * //
analyzed: mi shes pa ni zag pa la skye ba la gtso bo'i rgyu yin te / de'i phyir zag pa gang dag mi shes pa de la de @200a * //
translated: The ignorance that is the cause of the arising of the defilements is the primary cause of arising.

original: dag ni shes pa de la mi skye ste /
analyzed: dag ni shes pa de la mi skye ste /
translated: Therefore, the defilements do not arise in the knowledge of them.

original: shes pas de dag gi rgyu mi shes pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pas de dag gi rgyu mi shes pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the knowledge eliminates the ignorance that is the cause of the defilements.

original: nyi ma'i 'od kyis kyang skra ma zil gyis gnon pa de'i phyir mig gi yul du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od kyis kyang skra ma zil gyis gnon pa de'i phyir mig gi yul du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The light of the sun does not overwhelm the hair of the head because it is not the object of the eye.

original: de'i phyir 'di las mthong ba mi 'byung ba yin na ji ltar rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di las mthong ba mi 'byung ba yin na ji ltar rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, if seeing does not arise from it, how could it be the active cause of something different from itself?

original: bshad pa / skye bzhin pa ma yin pa la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir byed rgyu zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / skye bzhin pa ma yin pa la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir byed rgyu zhes mi bya ste /
translated: Reply: It is not called an active cause because it endures in the nature of not obstructing that which is not in the process of arising.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: skye bzhin pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: It is called the active cause of that which is in the process of arising.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs na bar med par 'byung ba'i chos ni skye bzhin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs na bar med par 'byung ba'i chos ni skye bzhin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: A phenomenon that occurs without interruption when causes and conditions are assembled is called that which is in the process of arising.

original: skye bzhin pa gegs byed pa thams cad dang bral ba de skyed pa la chos thams cad gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa gegs byed pa thams cad dang bral ba de skyed pa la chos thams cad gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa yin no //
translated: That which is in the process of arising is free from all obstruction. All phenomena endure in the nature of not obstructing its generation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ma 'ongs pa nyid du mtshungs pa bzhin du da ltar ba'i ngo bor bya ba la gegs byed pa med pa'i phyir gnas skabs de la skye bzhin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ma 'ongs pa nyid du mtshungs pa bzhin du da ltar ba'i ngo bor bya ba la gegs byed pa med pa'i phyir gnas skabs de la skye bzhin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, just as it is similar to the future, it is called that which is in the process of arising in that state because it is not obstructed from performing the action of the present.

original: re zhig skye ba la gegs byed nus pa rnams ni zhes bya ba ni dper na zag pa skye ba la shes pa dang / skar ma rnams mthong ba la nyi ma'i 'od lta bu'o //
analyzed: re zhig skye ba la gegs byed nus pa rnams ni zhes bya ba ni dper na zag pa skye ba la shes pa dang / skar ma rnams mthong ba la nyi ma'i 'od lta bu'o //
translated: Those that are able to obstruct the arising of something are like the knowledge of the arising of contaminants and the light of the sun for seeing stars.

original: dper brjod pa smras pa ni /🔽dper na spyod par byed pa mi 'tshe ba'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper brjod pa smras pa ni / dper na spyod par byed pa mi 'tshe ba'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: An example is stated:

original: grong dpon mi 'tshe ba la bsams nas grong mi rnams bdag cag ni rje bos bde bar byas so zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: grong dpon mi 'tshe ba la bsams nas grong mi rnams bdag cag ni rje bos bde bar byas so zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the statement, “The people of the town are happy because the governor does not harm them.”

original: ci'i phyir de dag de skad zer bar 'gyur zhe na /🔽gang gi phyir de 'tshe bar byed par nus la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag de skad zer bar 'gyur zhe na / gang gi phyir de 'tshe bar byed par nus la /
translated: Why do they say that?🔽Because he is able to harm them,

original: 'tshe ba yang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang zhig gegs byed par mi nus pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'tshe ba yang mi byed pa'i phyir ro // gang zhig gegs byed par mi nus pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: but does not harm them.🔽Those that are not able to obstruct are like nirvana and so on for the arising of all phenomena.

original: dper na chos thams cad skye ba la mya ngan las 'das pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na chos thams cad skye ba la mya ngan las 'das pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: For example, it is like the statement, “All phenomena arise because nirvana does not obstruct them.”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang mi skye ba'i chos can rnams la ni 'du byed skye ba'i gegs byed par nus pa med na ji ltar thams cad skye ba la rgyu yin /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang mi skye ba'i chos can rnams la ni 'du byed skye ba'i gegs byed par nus pa med na ji ltar thams cad skye ba la rgyu yin /
translated: But if nirvana and non-arisen phenomena do not have the ability to obstruct the arising of compositional activity, how could they be causes of all?

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa dag ces bya ba la /
translated: With respect to “hell beings and so on,”

original: dmyal ba dang / yi dgas dang / dud 'gro dag gzugs med pa'i phung po skye ba la ji ltar rgyu'i dngos po yin /
analyzed: dmyal ba dang / yi dgas dang / dud 'gro dag gzugs med pa'i phung po skye ba la ji ltar rgyu'i dngos po yin /
translated: how could the formless aggregates of hell beings, hungry ghosts, and animals be the cause of the arising of the form aggregate?

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa smos pa ni mi la sogs pa rnams ni res 'ga' nye bar bstan pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa smos pa ni mi la sogs pa rnams ni res 'ga' nye bar bstan pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The mention of “hell beings and so on” is for the sake of including humans and so on, who sometimes become causes through teaching and so on.

original: mya ngan @200b las 'das pa la sogs pa de dag med kyang yod pa ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du gegs byed mi nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan @200b las 'das pa la sogs pa de dag med kyang yod pa ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du gegs byed mi nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though nirvana and so on do not exist, they are not able to obstruct the arising of the form aggregate, just as they do not exist.

original: yod dam med kyang rung ste /
analyzed: yod dam med kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether they exist or do not exist,

original: gegs byed par nus pa gegs mi byed pa dang / byed par mi nus pa mi byed pa'i ngo bor khyad par 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: gegs byed par nus pa gegs mi byed pa dang / byed par mi nus pa mi byed pa'i ngo bor khyad par 'ga' yang med de /
translated: there is no difference in the nature of that which is able to obstruct but does not obstruct and that which is not able to obstruct but does not obstruct.

original: gnyis ka yang de la byed pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang de la byed pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are similar in their activity.

original: spyod par byed pa mi nus bzhin du yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: spyod par byed pa mi nus bzhin du yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Even though the one who acts is not able to harm,🔽the people of the village say, “The lord has made us happy.”

original: spyod par byed pa 'tshe bar mi nus pa la yang grong gi mi rnams rje bos bdag cag bde bar byas so zhes de skad du 'dzer ba yod pas 'di'i dpe ni sngar gyi gang yin pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: spyod par byed pa 'tshe bar mi nus pa la yang grong gi mi rnams rje bos bdag cag bde bar byas so zhes de skad du 'dzer ba yod pas 'di'i dpe ni sngar gyi gang yin pa de nyid yin no //
translated: The example is just as it was previously.

original: de'i phyir dpe 'di nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa gegs byed par mi nus pa rnams kyang gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa las byed rgyur grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe 'di nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa gegs byed par mi nus pa rnams kyang gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa las byed rgyur grub po //
translated: Therefore, by this very example, it is established that even those who are not able to obstruct nirvana, etc., are active causes in that they remain in a state of non-obstruction.

original: 'dir ni spyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'dir ni spyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Here, in general,

original: gang zhig byed rgyu'i gtso bo dang / gang zhig byed rgyu'i gtso bo ma yin pa thams cad kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gang zhig byed rgyu'i gtso bo dang / gang zhig byed rgyu'i gtso bo ma yin pa thams cad kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: with regard to all those who are primary active causes and those who are not primary active causes,

original: rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu zhes bya ba bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu zhes bya ba bshad pa'o //
translated: it is explained that “the active cause is a cause that is other than itself.”

original: byed rgyu'i gtso bo gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byed rgyu'i gtso bo gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: The principal active cause is called the active cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byed rgyu'i rgyu zhes bya'o //🔽byed rgyu nyid la ltos nas rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byed rgyu'i rgyu zhes bya'o // byed rgyu nyid la ltos nas rgyu yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is called the active cause.🔽It is a cause in dependence on being an active cause.

original: skyed par byed pa'i ngo bos byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i ngo bos byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: It is active by the nature of being a producer,

original: gegs mi byed ba'i ngo bo tsam du gnas pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gegs mi byed ba'i ngo bo tsam du gnas pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by the nature of merely not obstructing.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa la mig dang gzugs dag dang zhes bya ba la de la mig ni rten gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa la mig dang gzugs dag dang zhes bya ba la de la mig ni rten gyi rgyu'o //
translated: For example, in regard to the eye consciousness, the eye and form are the active cause.

original: gzugs ni gnas kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni gnas kyi rgyu'o //
translated: The eye is the cause of the support.

original: yang na mig ni rgyu'i rkyen no //
analyzed: yang na mig ni rgyu'i rkyen no //
translated: Or, the eye is the causal condition.

original: gzugs ni dmigs pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs pa'i rkyen no //
translated: Form is the objective condition.

original: rna ba la sogs pa rnams la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa rnams la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the ear and so on.🔽In regard to the body, food is the active cause.

original: lus la zas dang zhes bya ba la ci zhe na /
analyzed: lus la zas dang zhes bya ba la ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: bskyed par bya bar nus pa yod de zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: bskyed par bya bar nus pa yod de zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: It is connected to the statement, “It is able to generate.”

original: zas kun 'byung ba las lus kun du 'byung ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽myu gu la sogs ba bzhin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sa bon dang myu gu dang lo ma dang tshigs 'chas pa sogs pa dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: zas kun 'byung ba las lus kun du 'byung ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro // myu gu la sogs ba bzhin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sa bon dang myu gu dang lo ma dang tshigs 'chas pa sogs pa dag bsdu'o //
translated: The body arises from the universal cause of food.🔽Like a sprout, etc.🔽The word “etc.” includes the seed, sprout, leaf, stem, etc.

original: yang na sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zhing la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: yang na sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zhing la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: Or the word “etc.” includes the field, water, fertilizer, etc.

original: gang zhig 'di skad du zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di skad du zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la //
translated: Someone might argue as follows:

original: rgyu yod na 'bras bur 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas rgol ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu yod na 'bras bur 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas rgol ba'o //
translated: If a cause exists, an effect will arise.

original: ci'i phyir thams cad cig car skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir thams cad cig car skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Why don’t all things arise simultaneously?

original: ji ltar srog gcod pa la byed pa po srog gcod pa la brten par 'gyur ba de bzhin du thams cad kyang ci'i @201a * //🔽phyir de brten par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar srog gcod pa la byed pa po srog gcod pa la brten par 'gyur ba de bzhin du thams cad kyang ci'i @201a * //🔽phyir de brten par mi 'gyur /
translated: Just as the agent of killing is based on killing, why isn’t the agent of all other actions based on all other actions?

original: byed pa po'i ngo bos ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i ngo bos ni ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa po'i ngo bos ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i ngo bos ni ma yin pa ste /
translated: because it is not by the nature of the agent.

original: de'i phyir 'di klan ka ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di klan ka ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not a criticism.

original: gzhan dag na re gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Others say: It is not only that it exists as the nature of non-obstruction.

original: thams cad skye ba la byed rgyu thams cad nus pa yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thams cad skye ba la byed rgyu thams cad nus pa yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: All causes of arising have the ability to produce all results.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba skye ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba skye ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The statement “virtuous and nonvirtuous mental consciousnesses arise” means:

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dag par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dge ba dang / log par lta ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa mi dge ba mya ngan las 'das pa la dmigs pa skye ba yin la ;
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dag par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dge ba dang / log par lta ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa mi dge ba mya ngan las 'das pa la dmigs pa skye ba yin la ;
translated: The virtuous mental consciousness that is concomitant with right view and the nonvirtuous mental consciousness that is concomitant with wrong view and so on arise and focus on nirvana.

original: de nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir brgyud pa'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das las pa de yang rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir nus pa yod do //
analyzed: de nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir brgyud pa'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das las pa de yang rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir nus pa yod do //
translated: Then, because eye consciousness arises, nirvana is a condition for that eye consciousness and therefore has the ability to produce it.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la'o //
translated: Because the eye consciousness is the basis of the eye faculty.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rtogs par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rtogs par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same should be understood for the other faculties.

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa dag gis kyang gzugs med pa'i phung po skyed par nus so //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa dag gis kyang gzugs med pa'i phung po skyed par nus so //
translated: The formless aggregates can be generated by the hell beings, etc.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: kye ma dmyal ba dang yi dags la sogs pa 'di dag ni mchog tu sdug bsngal ba zhig go snyam du dmyal ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye la /
analyzed: kye ma dmyal ba dang yi dags la sogs pa 'di dag ni mchog tu sdug bsngal ba zhig go snyam du dmyal ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye la /
translated: The mental consciousness, which has as its object the hell beings, etc., arises with the thought, “Alas! These hell beings, hungry ghosts, etc. are greatly suffering.”

original: de rim gyis tshul khrims la gnas pa rab tu bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor ba las gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rim gyis tshul khrims la gnas pa rab tu bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor ba las gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, in order, the formless meditative attainment and birth arise through the practice of cultivating the stages of moral discipline.

original: de bzhin du thal ba'i sman dang / tsher ma la sogs pa dang phrad pa yang tshor ba bde ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du thal ba'i sman dang / tsher ma la sogs pa dang phrad pa yang tshor ba bde ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: In the same way, contact with ashes, medicine, thorns, etc. is the cause of pleasant feeling.

original: de ni bde ba'i dngos kyi la /
analyzed: de ni bde ba'i dngos kyi la /
translated: That is the direct cause of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni brgyud pa'i sgo nas yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni brgyud pa'i sgo nas yin no //
translated: Pain is the indirect cause.

original: byed pa'i rgyu bshad zin to /
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu bshad zin to /
translated: The active cause has been explained.

original: // / lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras rgyu zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: // / lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras rgyu zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Coexistent cause is that which is the effect of each other.

original: 'di la kha cig ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni chos phan tshun 'bras bur gyur pa dag kho na yin no zhes nges par 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: 'di la kha cig ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni chos phan tshun 'bras bur gyur pa dag kho na yin no zhes nges par 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Here, some hold the opinion that the coexistent cause is only those phenomena that are the effect of each other.

original: de ltar na phan tshun 'bras bur ma yin pa rnams lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pas gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na phan tshun 'bras bur ma yin pa rnams lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pas gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, it would be clear that those that are not the effect of each other are not a coexistent cause.

analyzed: de'i phyir chos mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the characteristics of the same substance would not be coexistent.

original: de'i phyir phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa dang / ring ba ma yin par 'gyur na lhan cig 'byung ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa dang / ring ba ma yin par 'gyur na lhan cig 'byung ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it should be ascertained that coexistent cause is that which is the effect of each other and is not distant.

original: gzhan ni ma yin na zhes nges par @201b gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin na zhes nges par @201b gzung bar bya'o //
translated: It is not the other.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyur thal ba yang yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyur thal ba yang yin te /
translated: It follows that it is also the concomitant cause,

original: de ni nye ba rnams kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: de ni nye ba rnams kho na'i yin no //
translated: but that is only for those that are proximate.

original: de lta yin dang lhan cig 'byung ba thams cad lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du nye bar gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang lhan cig 'byung ba thams cad lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du nye bar gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then all co-existent things would be co-existent causes.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos gang dag phan tshun gyi 'bras bu yin pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos gang dag phan tshun gyi 'bras bu yin pa zhes bshad de /
translated: Therefore, it is said that those things which are the effects of each other

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa phan tshun dang / mtshan nyid rnams phan tshun no //

original: re zhig dus las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: re zhig dus las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: In terms of time means in terms of the time of the four results and so on.🔽In terms of result and so on, in terms of virtue and so on.🔽In terms of time means in terms of the time of the four results and so on.🔽In terms of result and so on, in terms of virtue and so on.

original: sems dang lhan cig skye ba dang / gnas pa gcig pa dang / 'gag pa gcig pa dang / dus gcig tu gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang lhan cig skye ba dang / gnas pa gcig pa dang / 'gag pa gcig pa dang / dus gcig tu gtogs pa'o //
translated: In terms of time means in terms of the time of the four results and so on.🔽In terms of result and so on, in terms of virtue and so on.

original: de'i dngos po ni dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid de /
translated: In terms of time means in terms of the time of the four results and so on.🔽In terms of result and so on, in terms of virtue and so on.

original: bzhi pa dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid des so //
analyzed: bzhi pa dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid des so //
translated: In terms of time means in terms of the time of the four results and so on.

original: gal te skye ba gcig pa la sogs pa smos pa nyid kyis dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid kyang khong du chud pa nyid ma yin nam dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid kyis so zhes yang ci'i phyir smos she na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba gcig pa la sogs pa smos pa nyid kyis dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid kyang khong du chud pa nyid ma yin nam dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid kyis so zhes yang ci'i phyir smos she na /
translated: If the phrase “having the same basis” already indicates that they exist at the same time, why is it said that they exist at the same time by the phrase “having the same time”?

original: mi skye ba'i chos can shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos can shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to indicate that they are not subject to future arising.

original: de lta na 'o na dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid yin la rag mod ce na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid yin la rag mod ce na /
translated: If that is so, then they exist at the same time, but why is it said that they exist at the same time?

original: de lta na yang dus gcig pa kho na rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang dus gcig pa kho na rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though that is so, they are understood to exist at the same time.

original: 'bras bu smos pas ni skyes bu byed pa dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu bsdu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu smos pas ni skyes bu byed pa dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu bsdu'o //
translated: The result of conscious effort is mentioned in order to include the result of separation.

original: gal te rgyu mthun pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gnyis kyang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rgyu mthun pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gnyis kyang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Aren’t the results of natural outflow and karmic maturation also results by nature?

original: de dag logs su ci'i phyir smos she na /
analyzed: de dag logs su ci'i phyir smos she na /
translated: Why are they mentioned separately?

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The result of conscious effort is of four types:

original: lhan cig dang / mjug thogs dang / dus gzhan du skye ba dang / mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig dang / mjug thogs dang / dus gzhan du skye ba dang / mi skye ba'o //
translated: arising simultaneously, arising immediately after, arising at another time, and not arising.

original: lhan cig skye ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gnyis kyi ste /
analyzed: lhan cig skye ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gnyis kyi ste /
translated: Coemergent means the two causes of coemergent and concomitant.

original: 'di gnyis kyi 'bras bu ni lhan cig skye'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi 'bras bu ni lhan cig skye'o //
translated: Their effect is coemergent.

original: mjug thogs su skye ba ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: mjug thogs su skye ba ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams kyi ste /
translated: Subsequent means the effect of the supreme mundane state.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Its effect is the perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: dus gzhan du skye ba ni dper na rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu lta bu ste /
analyzed: dus gzhan du skye ba ni dper na rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu lta bu ste /
translated: The effect of different time is, for example, the effect of karmic maturation.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi byang chub gsum la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyi byang chub gsum la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three enlightenments and so on are the effect of the factors conducive to liberation.

original: mi skye ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The effect of separation is the effect of the uninterrupted path.

original: de'i phyir 'dir rgyu mthun pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin pa dag logs shig tu smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rgyu mthun pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin pa dag logs shig tu smos so //
translated: Therefore the causes of natural outflow and karmic maturation and the cause of coemergence are mentioned separately here.

original: rnam par smin @202b pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dag ni rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin @202b pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dag ni rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The effect of karmic maturation and the effect of natural outflow do not coemerge with their cause.

original: gang gi phyir de dag ni dus gzhan du skye ba dang / mjug thogs su skye ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag ni dus gzhan du skye ba dang / mjug thogs su skye ba yin no //
translated: because they arise at another time and immediately after.

original: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin pa de dag dang lhan cig bstan na skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu lhan cig skye ba kho na 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin pa de dag dang lhan cig bstan na skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu lhan cig skye ba kho na 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: If the results of conscious effort and the dominant result were not mentioned, one would think that the results of natural outflow and karmic maturation arise simultaneously with their causes.

original: rang gi ngo bo rang gi ngo bo'i 'bras bu ma yin pas phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rang gi ngo bo'i 'bras bu ma yin pas phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But this is not the case, because the results of conscious effort arise simultaneously with their causes, and the results of natural outflow and karmic maturation do not arise simultaneously with their causes.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu smos pas ni skyes bu byed pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dag 'dzin to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu smos pas ni skyes bu byed pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dag 'dzin to //
translated: Therefore, the results of conscious effort and the dominant result are mentioned in order to include the results of conscious effort and the dominant result that do not arise simultaneously.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ci'i phyir ma bsdus she na /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ci'i phyir ma bsdus she na /
translated: Why are dominant results not included?

original: de ni chos thams cad kyi 'bras bu yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad kyi 'bras bu yin gyi /
translated: Because they are the results of all phenomena.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa rnams kho na'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa rnams kho na'i ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not the results of only those phenomena that are concomitant with the mind.

original: gcig ces bya ba'i sgra snga ma ni lhan cig pa'i don du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba'i sgra snga ma ni lhan cig pa'i don du blta bar bya ste /
translated: The former term “one” should be regarded as having the meaning of “simultaneously.”

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa nyid dang zhes bya ba de'i sgra gang yin pa de ni snga ma'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa nyid dang zhes bya ba de'i sgra gang yin pa de ni snga ma'o //
translated: The first “one” in the phrase “one that is produced, endures, and ceases” is a demonstrative pronoun.

original: gcig ces bya ba'i sgra phyi ma ni thun mong gi don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba'i sgra phyi ma ni thun mong gi don du rig par bya'o //
translated: The second “one” in the phrase “one that is produced, endures, and ceases” is a common noun.

original: de ltar na rgyu bcus zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu bcus zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, the phrase “due to ten causes” means

original: dus las bzhi dang / 'bras bu las gsum dang / dge ba la sogs pa gsum nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dus las bzhi dang / 'bras bu las gsum dang / dge ba la sogs pa gsum nyid kyis so //
translated: due to four times, three results, and three types such as virtue.

original: 'dir ni mnyam pa'i rnam pa ci rigs par yongs su bgrang gi / thams cad la thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni mnyam pa'i rnam pa ci rigs par yongs su bgrang gi / thams cad la thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the ten causes are enumerated in terms of their similarity, but not in terms of all of them being present in every instance.

original: de la dge ba la sogs pa rnams ni phan tshun du bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dge ba la sogs pa rnams ni phan tshun du bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, those that are virtuous and so on do not have their own intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa zag pa med pa rnams la ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu med la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa zag pa med pa rnams la ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu med la /
translated: Similarly, those that are uncontaminated and subsumed by the uninterrupted path do not have a maturational result.

original: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yang med do //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yang med do //
translated: They also do not have nonvirtue or neutral states.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam la sogs pa zag pa med pa gzhan rnams la ni rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dag med la /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam la sogs pa zag pa med pa gzhan rnams la ni rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dag med la /
translated: Other uncontaminated states, such as the liberated path, do not have the fruitions of karmic maturation and separation.

original: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa gnyis kyang med do //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa gnyis kyang med do //
translated: Also, neither virtue nor nonvirtue exist.

original: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa rnams la ni 'bras bu thams cad yod do //
analyzed: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa rnams la ni 'bras bu thams cad yod do //
translated: All fruitions exist for virtuous contaminated states subsumed by the uninterrupted path.

original: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa gnyis ni med do //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa gnyis ni med do //
translated: Neither nonvirtue nor neutral states exist.

original: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa gzhan rnams dang / mi dge ba rnams la ni bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs pa yod de /
analyzed: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa gzhan rnams dang / mi dge ba rnams la ni bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs pa yod de /
translated: Other virtuous contaminated states and nonvirtuous states have all fruitions except for the fruition of separation.

original: gang gi phyir bral ba'i 'bras bu ni bar chad med pa'i lam kho na'i yin pi'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bral ba'i 'bras bu ni bar chad med pa'i lam kho na'i yin pi'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the fruition of separation is the result of the uninterrupted path alone.

original: lung du ma bstan pa rnams la ni rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba ma gtogs pa yod do //🔽de @203a * //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnams la ni rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba ma gtogs pa yod do //🔽de @203a * //
translated: Neutral states have all fruitions except for the fruitions of karmic maturation and separation and virtuous and nonvirtuous states.

original: ltar na kha cig ni rgyu drug gis sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: ltar na kha cig ni rgyu drug gis sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin la /
translated: Some are associated with six causes,

original: kha cig ni bdun gyis yin zhing kha cig ni brgyad kyis yin no //🔽de la sems nang na nyung ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: kha cig ni bdun gyis yin zhing kha cig ni brgyad kyis yin no // de la sems nang na nyung ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: some with seven, and some with eight.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag dang / gzugs med pa dag gi ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni 'khor nyung ba'i phyir nyung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag dang / gzugs med pa dag gi ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni 'khor nyung ba'i phyir nyung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Among the mental factors, those with the fewest are the obscured neutral ones in the second absorption and so on and the obscured neutral ones in the formless realm because their retinue is small.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni sa mang po pa bcu'i mtshan nyid do //🔽de dag gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni sa mang po pa bcu'i mtshan nyid do // de dag gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: Their characteristics are the ten universal mental states.

original: ring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not the secondary characteristics of those because they are distant.

original: nye ba'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyi ni yin te /
analyzed: nye ba'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyi ni yin te /
translated: They are the secondary characteristics of their own characteristics because they are close.

original: de'i phyir / rang gi mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid brgyad kyi yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rang gi mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid brgyad kyi yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it says: They are associated with eight: their own characteristics and secondary characteristics.

original: rang gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ma gtogs pa rnams so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ma gtogs pa rnams so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Except for its own characteristics that are similar and immediately antecedent conditions.

original: de dag ci'i phyir sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ci'i phyir sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not coemergent causes of mind?

original: de dag sems kyi mtshan nyid rnams kho na la byed pa dang ldan pas chos gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir dang / ring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag sems kyi mtshan nyid rnams kho na la byed pa dang ldan pas chos gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir dang / ring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they function only in relation to the characteristics of mind and they are distant.

original: gzhan dag na re bcu bzhi yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bcu bzhi yin te /
translated: Others say there are fourteen.

original: mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin du sa mang po pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyang sems la byed pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin du sa mang po pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyang sems la byed pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Like the characteristics of similar status, the universal mental factors are not coemergent causes because they do not function in relation to mind.

original: de ltar na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that case, the treatise topic divisions declares:

original: gal te sa mang po pa dag gi mtshan nyid rnams sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin na'o //
analyzed: gal te sa mang po pa dag gi mtshan nyid rnams sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin na'o //
translated: If the universal mental factors are not coemergent causes of mind,🔽then how can they be called universal?

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The Sūtra Elaborating the Meanings states:

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la /🔽'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
translated: With regard to the truth of suffering,🔽there is that which is caused by the afflicted view of the self

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod /🔽'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: but is not a cause of the afflicted view of the self.🔽There is that which is a cause of the afflicted view of the self🔽but is not caused by the afflicted view of the self.🔽There is that which is caused by the afflicted view of the self

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin pa yang yod /🔽'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin pa yang yod / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang ma yin la /
translated: and is also a cause of the afflicted view of the self.🔽There is that which is neither caused by the afflicted view of the self

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa yang yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa yang yod dam zhe na /
translated: nor is a cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: de la bden pa bzhi mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas rnams dang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa thams cad la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la bden pa bzhi mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas rnams dang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa thams cad la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ste /
translated: With regard to the four truths, all negative tendencies that are objects to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation and all concomitant states such as feeling are called the truth of suffering.

original: de dag la 'di bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la 'di bsam par bya'o //
translated: They should be contemplated in this way.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
translated: With regard to that, there is that which is caused by the afflicted view of the self but is not a cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal mthong @203b bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal mthong @203b bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang /
translated: That which is not the cause of the afflicted view of the self is past and present negative tendencies abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering,🔽the truth of suffering concomitant with them and

original: kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba 'das pa dang / de ltar byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba 'das pa dang / de ltar byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang /
translated: past and present pervasive negative tendencies abandoned by seeing the truth of origin and the truth of suffering that is concomitant with them.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa dag ma gtogs pa de dag las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa dag ma gtogs pa de dag las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o //
translated: The afflicted truth of suffering that is other than that associated with the truth of suffering, except for the afflicted view of the self and the origin of those associated with it, and except for its aging, enduring and impermanence.

original: de ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa rnams dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa dus gsum pa rnams dang /
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa rnams dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa dus gsum pa rnams dang /
translated: It is the future negative tendencies that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, those concomitant with them such as feeling and so on, and the pervasive and nonpervasive negative tendencies that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin that exist in the three times.

original: kun du 'gro ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa rnams dang / 'gog pa dang lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dus gsum pa rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rnams te /🔽de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa rnams dang / 'gog pa dang lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dus gsum pa rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa rnams te / de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
translated: those that are future and omnipresent, those that are concomitant with them such as feeling, those that are abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path and those that are abandoned by the path of meditation, and those that are concomitant with them such as feeling.🔽They are causes of the afflicted view of the self,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'o //
translated: but they are not causes of the afflicted view of the self.

original: de ltar sngar skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni 'di dag gi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar sngar skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni 'di dag gi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus rgyu yin gyi /
translated: The afflicted view of the self that arises earlier is the cause of these latter states as their omnipresent cause.

original: de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: But these latter states are not the cause of the afflicted view of the self,

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not yet arisen and because they are not omnipresent.

original: mu gnyis pa ni med do //🔽'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin la /
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni med do // 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin la /
translated: The second possibility does not exist.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a cause of the afflicted view of the self and also possesses the afflicted view of the self as a cause?

original: de'i phyir / ma gtogs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ma gtogs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “except for those that are excluded.”

original: ma gtogs pa yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: ma gtogs pa yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: Those that are excluded are the arising, etc., of those phenomena that are concomitant with the afflicted view of the self.

original: de dag ni sngar skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta bas kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni sngar skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta bas kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed pa yin la /
translated: They are generated by the pervasive cause of the afflicted view of the self that arose previously.

original: de ltar byung bas na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus bskyed pa yin no //🔽de dag gis @204a * //
analyzed: de ltar byung bas na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus bskyed pa yin no // de dag gis @204a * //
translated: Since they arise in this way, they are generated by the co-existent cause.

original: kyang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus 'jig tshogs la lta ba da ltar byung ba bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: kyang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus 'jig tshogs la lta ba da ltar byung ba bskyed pa yin no //
translated: And they, in turn, generate the co-existent cause of the afflicted view of the self that exists in the present.

original: de'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba la sogs pa rnams sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba la sogs pa rnams sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the arising, etc., of feeling, etc., are the co-existent cause of the mind.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos las lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni chos lnga bcu rtsa bzhi ste zhes bya ba gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos las lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni chos lnga bcu rtsa bzhi ste zhes bya ba gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the treatise states, “The co-existent cause is forty-four phenomena.”

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can ma yin la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can ma yin la /
translated: The truth of suffering that is not afflicted is not the cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste /🔽de ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu 'am /🔽skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'am /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste / de ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu 'am / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'am /
translated: It is not the cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: It is not the cause of the afflicted view of the self because it is the homogeneous cause or coemergent cause of the omnipresent cause.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba yang de'i ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba yang de'i ma yin no //
translated: The afflicted view of the self is not its cause.🔽The other that is excluded is that which is the cause of the afflicted view of the self and is also the cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: ma gtogs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba 'dir kho bo cag gis ni skye ba la sogs pa kho na bshad de /
analyzed: ma gtogs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba 'dir kho bo cag gis ni skye ba la sogs pa kho na bshad de /
translated: Here we explain only birth, etc.,

original: de dag gi don du 'dir nye bar bkod pa'i phyir ro //🔽ma gtogs pa gzhan gang yin pa de yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la /
analyzed: de dag gi don du 'dir nye bar bkod pa'i phyir ro // ma gtogs pa gzhan gang yin pa de yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la /
translated: because they are the purpose of this.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The other that is excluded is that which is the cause of the afflicted view of the self and is also the cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: gang dag de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes mi 'don pa de dag gi ltar na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung ji ltar 'gal bar 'gyur zhes khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes mi 'don pa de dag gi ltar na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung ji ltar 'gal bar 'gyur zhes khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: Those who do not recite the phrase “the phenomena that are concomitant with it” should be asked this: how does the treatise commit an error?

original: 'o na ji ltar 'don zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'don zhe na /
translated: How do they recite it?

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa dag ma gtogs pa zhes de skad du 'don te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa dag ma gtogs pa zhes de skad du 'don te /
translated: They recite it as “except for the arising, aging, enduring, and impermanence of the afflicted view of the self.”

original: 'di ltar / 'di dag gi skye ba la sogs pa'i stobs kyis ni sems mi skyed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'di dag gi skye ba la sogs pa'i stobs kyis ni sems mi skyed de /
translated: Because the power of the arising and so on of the afflicted view of the self does not generate the mind.

original: rang gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhin no //
translated: It is like the power of its secondary characteristics.

original: de'i phyir de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes de skad du mi 'don te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes de skad du mi 'don te /
translated: Therefore they do not recite the phrase “the phenomena that are concomitant with it.”

original: kha che ba rnams na re zhes bya ba smos pa ni /
analyzed: kha che ba rnams na re zhes bya ba smos pa ni /
translated: The Kashmiris say:

original: de dag gis kyang de skad du 'don par bya ba 'am zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang de skad du 'don par bya ba 'am zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression “or else” is used to indicate that there is no reason for the Sautrāntikas to maintain that the mind and mental factors are simultaneous.

original: re zhig gang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu yin pa de ni lhan cig 'byung ba yang yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig gang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu yin pa de ni lhan cig 'byung ba yang yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: The mind and mental factors are coexistent causes and also coexistent.

original: sems las byung ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems las byung ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The mind and mental factors are coexistent causes of each other.

original: gang zhig lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa de lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di ni srid pa @204b yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa de lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di ni srid pa @204b yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is impossible for something to be a coexistent cause of a factor and not be coexistent with it.

original: gang zhig gang dang lhan cig 'byung ba de ni gdon mi za bar lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ma yin te /🔽dper na mthun pa'i mtshan nyid skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams chos kyi lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang lhan cig 'byung ba de ni gdon mi za bar lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ma yin te / dper na mthun pa'i mtshan nyid skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams chos kyi lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Whatever is coexistent with a given factor is necessarily a coexistent cause of that factor.🔽For example, the characteristics of the primary elements are coexistent with the primary elements, but they are not coexistent causes of the primary elements.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin pa lta bu ste /
translated: The characteristics of the primary elements are not coexistent causes of the primary elements, because the primary elements are not coexistent causes of the characteristics of the primary elements.

original: ring ba'i phyir de dag chos la bya ba byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ring ba'i phyir de dag chos la bya ba byed pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not active with respect to the phenomenon because they are distant.

original: de dag phan tshun te /
analyzed: de dag phan tshun te /
translated: They are mutually distant.

original: mthun pa'i mtshan nyid skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa de dag kyang lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mthun pa'i mtshan nyid skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa de dag kyang lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: The characteristics of the characteristics of arising, etc., of the characteristics of the primary characteristics of the conditioned, such as arising, are also coexistent.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not coexistent causes because they are distant from each other.

original: chos gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are distant because they operate in one phenomenon.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni sems las byung ba rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sngom pa dag ste /🔽de dag gi mtshan nyid skye ba nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang dag yin pa de dag ni bya ba ring ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa ni sems las byung ba rnams dang / bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sngom pa dag ste / de dag gi mtshan nyid skye ba nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang dag yin pa de dag ni bya ba ring ba'i phyir /
translated: The following are concomitant with mind: mental factors, the meditative discipline of the absorptions, and the uncontaminated discipline.

original: sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: The characteristics of their characteristics, such as the arising of arising, are not coexistent causes of mind because they are distant from it.

original: phan tshun du yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun du yang ma yin te /
translated: They are also not mutual coexistent causes.

original: chos gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are distant from each other because they operate in one phenomenon.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas phan tshun dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas phan tshun dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The following are coexistent causes of each other: the four primary elements, the four primary elements and the form derived from them, the form derived from the four primary elements and the form derived from the four primary elements.

original: rdul phra rab rdzas brgyad la sogs pa dag gi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang / ro la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rdzas brgyad la sogs pa dag gi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang / ro la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi //
translated: Form derived from the four great elements, such as the eight substances of a minute particle, taste, etc., are coexistent causes.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not coexistent causes of each other.

original: thogs pa med pa cung zad dang // zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i sngom pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa cung zad dang // zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i sngom pa ste /
translated: The second half of the verse states, “The unobscured, the small, etc.”

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thogs pa med pa bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sngom pas bsdus pa rnam pa bdun ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu yin te /🔽sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thogs pa med pa bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sngom pas bsdus pa rnam pa bdun ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu yin te / sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The seven types of unobscured form included in the absorptions and uncontaminated vows are coexistent causes of each other because they are concomitant with the mind.

original: thams cad 'byung ba dag dang lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /🔽thogs pa dang bcas pa'am /🔽thogs pa med kyang rung ste /
analyzed: thams cad 'byung ba dag dang lta bu'o zhes bya ba la / thogs pa dang bcas pa'am / thogs pa med kyang rung ste /
translated: All arise with the primary elements.🔽The primary elements are coexistent causes of each other.🔽The primary elements are coexistent causes of each other because they are always concomitant.🔽The primary elements are coexistent causes of form derived from the elements.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni bdag nyid ji lta bu'i 'byung ba dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni bdag nyid ji lta bu'i 'byung ba dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: The primary elements are coexistent causes of form derived from the elements because they are its substantial cause.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not coemergent causes.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin la 'byung ba rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pas 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin la 'byung ba rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pas 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Primary matter is virtuous or nonvirtuous, but the primary elements are neutral, so they are different results.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not coemergent causes.

original: thob pa dang ldan pa'i thob pa lhan cig skyes pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thob pa dang ldan pa'i thob pa lhan cig skyes pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: Obtainment and the obtainment of obtainment arise simultaneously.🔽Why is this?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because they have many results:🔽resultant maturation and natural outflow.🔽This shows that they are not coemergent causes or concomitant causes.

original: 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa du ma @205a * //🔽yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa du ma @205a * // yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyi ni bral ba'i 'bras bu yang yin no //

analyzed: sems kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni res 'ga' ba dge ba la sogs pa sems yin no //

analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang rung mod kyi zhes bya ba ni re zhig lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu yin pa de ni lhan cig 'byung ba yang yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par gang smras pa'o //
translated: All of these are correct, but the following is said: “That which is a cause by way of being an arising cause is also an arising.”
