translated: However, in the case of seeds and so on that are renowned as the entities of cause and effect,

original: sa bon dang ; myu gu dang / lo ma dang / spu bas 'chas pa dang / sdong bu la sogs pa rnams sam /
analyzed: sa bon dang ; myu gu dang / lo ma dang / spu bas 'chas pa dang / sdong bu la sogs pa rnams sam /
translated: the seed, sprout, leaf, bud, trunk, and so on,

original: yang na sa bon dang / 'o ma dang / brdabs pa la sogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: yang na sa bon dang / 'o ma dang / brdabs pa la sogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: or the seed, milk, churning, and so on,

original: de la sa bon ni snga la /
analyzed: de la sa bon ni snga la /
translated: the seed is earlier,

original: myu gu ni 'phyi zhing /
analyzed: myu gu ni 'phyi zhing /
translated: the sprout is later,

original: 'o ma ni snga la zho ni 'phyi'o //
analyzed: 'o ma ni snga la zho ni 'phyi'o //
translated: milk is earlier, and yogurt is later,

original: brdabs pa ni snga la sgra ni 'phyi'o //
analyzed: brdabs pa ni snga la sgra ni 'phyi'o //
translated: churning is earlier, and sound is later.

original: tshul 'di ni mi snang bas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag lhan cig 'byung ba dang / phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: tshul 'di ni mi snang bas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag lhan cig 'byung ba dang / phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
translated: This method is not evident in the case of cause and effect arising simultaneously and being the entities of mutual cause and effect.

original: ji ltar lhan cig 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar lhan cig 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The phrase “how could co-existent things be in a relationship of cause and effect?” is an objection.

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs dag lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rigs te /
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs dag lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical that co-existent things, in the states of having arisen and not having arisen, are in a relationship of cause and effect,

original: bdag nyid der grub pa'i phyir dang / yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid der grub pa'i phyir dang / yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are already established as themselves and because they do not exist.

original: de'i phyir de brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the author of the treatise says, “That should be explained.”

original: lhan cig 'byung ba la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mthong bas yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mthong bas yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that a relationship of cause and effect is seen in co-existent things, he says,

original: dper na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: “For example, a lamp illuminates itself and others.”

original: 'od mar me'i rgyu can yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji @205b ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'od mar me'i rgyu can yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji @205b ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How do you know that a lamp is the cause of light?

original: 'di ni mar me'i 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gro ba dang / gnas pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'di ni mar me'i 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gro ba dang / gnas pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because light increases and decreases in accordance with the increase and decrease of the lamp,🔽and because light is not seen when there is no lamp.

original: 'od don du gnyer ba rnams mar me nye bar len pa'i phyir dang / de la sdang ba rnams mar me gsod par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od don du gnyer ba rnams mar me nye bar len pa'i phyir dang / de la sdang ba rnams mar me gsod par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who seek light take up a lamp, and because those who hate it extinguish the lamp.🔽If the light is the cause of the lamp, then why does the light not arise when the lamp is not burning?🔽If the lamp is the cause of the light, then why does the light not cease when the lamp is extinguished?

original: re zhig ci mar me'i 'od kyi rgyu yin nam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /🔽'di skad du /
analyzed: re zhig ci mar me'i 'od kyi rgyu yin nam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / 'di skad du /

original: gnyis ka las grub pa ni shes bar byed pa yin na 'dis ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang / rgyu dang ldan pa'i dngos por shes bar nus pa ma yin te /🔽dpyad pa'i phyir ro zhes ston par byed do //🔽tshogs pa sngar byung ba ni 'bru mar dang / sdong bu dang / me la sogs pa phrad pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka las grub pa ni shes bar byed pa yin na 'dis ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang / rgyu dang ldan pa'i dngos por shes bar nus pa ma yin te / dpyad pa'i phyir ro zhes ston par byed do // tshogs pa sngar byung ba ni 'bru mar dang / sdong bu dang / me la sogs pa phrad pa'o //
translated: If the light is the cause of the lamp, then why does the lamp not cease when the light is extinguished?🔽If the light is the cause of the lamp, then why does the light not arise at the beginning when the lamp is not burning?🔽If the light is the cause of the lamp, then why does the lamp not cease when the light is extinguished?🔽If the light is the cause of the lamp, then why does the light not arise when the lamp is not burning?🔽If the light is the cause of the lamp, then why does the lamp not cease when the light is extinguished?🔽If the light is the cause of the lamp, then why does the light not arise at the beginning when the lamp is not burning?🔽If the light is the cause of the lamp, then why does the lamp not cease when the light is extinguished?🔽If the light is the cause of the lamp, then why does the light not arise when the lamp is not burning?

original: de la ji ltar 'od dang bcas ba'i skad cig ma dang po'i rgyu 'bru mar dang / sdong bu dang / me yin pa de bzhin du 'od dang bcas pa'i mar me skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu yang 'bru mar dang /
analyzed: de la ji ltar 'od dang bcas ba'i skad cig ma dang po'i rgyu 'bru mar dang / sdong bu dang / me yin pa de bzhin du 'od dang bcas pa'i mar me skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu yang 'bru mar dang /
translated: If the light is the cause of the lamp, then why does the lamp not cease when the light is extinguished?

original: sdong bu dang / me dang phra pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: sdong bu dang / me dang phra pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: The sprout is produced from the seed, the stem from the sprout, the leaf from the stem, and so on.

original: 'od kyi mar me ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'od kyi mar me ni ma yin no //
translated: The light of the lamp is produced from the wick, the fire, and the friction, but not from the flame.

original: de bzhin du tshogs pa sngar byung ba kho na grib ma dang bcas pa'i myu gu'i rgyu yin gyi /🔽grib ma'i myu gu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshogs pa sngar byung ba kho na grib ma dang bcas pa'i myu gu'i rgyu yin gyi / grib ma'i myu gu ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the sprout with its shadow is produced from the collection of causes that existed previously, but not from the shadow.🔽The first sprout with its shadow has as its cause the field, the seed, and so on.

original: de la grib ma dang bcas pa'i myu gu dang po'i rgyu zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa yin pa de bzhin du gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams kyi yang yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la grib ma dang bcas pa'i myu gu dang po'i rgyu zhing dang sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa yin pa de bzhin du gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams kyi yang yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the second and subsequent sprouts with their shadows have as their cause the first sprout with its shadow.🔽If coexistent factors are not a cause and an effect,

original: gal te de ltar lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang / rgyu dang ldan pa'i dngos po ma yin no //🔽'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te de ltar lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang / rgyu dang ldan pa'i dngos po ma yin no // 'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: then the factors that are not a cause and an effect are not coexistent factors.

original: de dag dang ldan pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: The factors that are not a cause and an effect are not coexistent factors.

original: yod pa dang med pa de dag 'bras bu gang yod pa de ni de dag dang ldan pa yin no / de dag dang ldan pa'i dngos po ni de dag dang ldan pa nyid do //🔽nges par zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa de dag 'bras bu gang yod pa de ni de dag dang ldan pa yin no / de dag dang ldan pa'i dngos po ni de dag dang ldan pa nyid do // nges par zhes bya ba la /
translated: That which exists as a cause exists in dependence on that which exists as an effect.

original: chos gang zhig yod na ste rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos gang zhig yod na ste rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which exists as an effect exists in dependence on that which exists as a cause.🔽That which exists as a cause exists in dependence on that which exists as an effect.🔽That which exists as an effect exists in dependence on that which exists as a cause.

original: 'bras bu gang zhig nges par yod pa yin gyi /🔽'dod rgyal du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhig nges par yod pa yin gyi / 'dod rgyal du ni ma yin no //
translated: That which exists as a cause exists in dependence on that which exists as an effect.🔽That which exists as an effect exists in dependence on that which exists as a cause.🔽That which exists as a cause exists in dependence on that which exists as an effect.

original: de ni rgyu'i yin zhing cig shos ni rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rgyu'i yin zhing cig shos ni rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: That which exists as an effect exists in dependence on that which exists as a cause.

original: 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which exists as a cause exists in dependence on that which exists as an effect.🔽That which exists as an effect exists in dependence on that which exists as a cause.🔽That which exists as a cause exists in dependence on that which exists as an effect.🔽That which exists as an effect exists in dependence on that which exists as a cause.🔽That which exists as a cause exists in dependence on that which exists as an effect.

analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos 'di lta ste 'byung ba dang / sems dang sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / mtshan nyid rnams kyang gcig yod na thams cad yod la /
translated: That which exists as an effect exists in dependence on that which exists as a cause.🔽That which exists as a cause exists in dependence on that which exists as an effect.🔽That which exists as an effect exists in dependence on that which exists as a cause.🔽That which exists as a cause exists in dependence on that which exists as an effect.🔽That which exists as an effect exists in dependence on that which exists as a cause.🔽That which exists as a cause exists in dependence on that which exists as an effect.🔽That which exists as an effect exists in dependence on that which exists as a cause.🔽That which exists as a cause exists in dependence on that which exists as an effect.🔽That which exists as an effect exists in dependence on that which exists as a cause.🔽That which exists as a cause exists in dependence on that which exists as an effect.

original: gcig med na thams cad med pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rigs pa ma yin no //🔽re zhig mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par @206a * //
analyzed: gcig med na thams cad med pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rigs pa ma yin no //🔽re zhig mig dang / gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par @206a * //
translated: That which exists as an effect exists in dependence on that which exists as a cause.🔽That which exists as a cause exists in dependence

original: shes pa dang / mar me dang / myu gu dang grib ma bzhin lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rung ni phan tshun du ni go ci ltar rung ste /🔽yod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang / mar me dang / myu gu dang grib ma bzhin lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rung ni phan tshun du ni go ci ltar rung ste / yod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: How could they be mutually related?

original: de'i phyir sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa rnams ni sems kyi lhan cig 'byung pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa rnams ni sems kyi lhan cig 'byung pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Therefore it is not tenable that secondary mind is a coemergent cause of mind,

original: mtshan nyid rnams kyang mtshan gzhi'i yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams kyang mtshan gzhi'i yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: or that characteristics are of a basis of characteristics.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of that alone.

original: phan tshun dag yod pa dang med na yod pa dang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phan tshun dag yod pa dang med na yod pa dang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because they do not exist and do not not exist mutually.

original: de ltar na 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If that is so, then, etc.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang / dri dang ro dang reg bya ni phan tshun med par mi 'byung bas med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang / dri dang ro dang reg bya ni phan tshun med par mi 'byung bas med na mi 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Derived form, smell, taste, and tactility do not occur without each other, so they are not independent.

original: de ni phan tshun dag yod pa'am med na de dang ldan pa'i phyir phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni phan tshun dag yod pa'am med na de dang ldan pa'i phyir phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they exist or do not exist in mutual dependence, then it follows that they are mutually causal things.

original: 'byung ba rnams dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams dang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyang phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It follows that the primary elements and form derived from the primary elements are mutually causal things.

original: phan tshun dag yod pa'am med na yod pa dang med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun dag yod pa'am med na yod pa dang med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because if they exist or do not exist in mutual dependence, they exist or do not exist.

original: sems kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: sems kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The characteristics of the mind’s concomitants, etc.,

original: phan tshun thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: phan tshun thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: It follows that they are mutually causal things.

original: sems kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa rnams med par ni sems la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: sems kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa rnams med par ni sems la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba med do //
translated: The mind, etc., do not occur without the characteristics of the mind’s concomitants, etc.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams dang / thob pa lhan cig skye ba rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams dang / thob pa lhan cig skye ba rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The term “etc.” includes the characteristics of the mind’s concomitants that occur in relation to the mind and the co-arising of attainment.

original: sems la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgras rjes su 'jug pa rnams dang thob pa dang ldan pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sems la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgras rjes su 'jug pa rnams dang thob pa dang ldan pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “mind and so on” should be understood to include the mental factors, the dissociated forces, and the attainment of cessation.

original: 'dir de'i mtshan nyid la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus snga phyir 'byung ba dag kho na la rigs kyi /
analyzed: 'dir de'i mtshan nyid la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus snga phyir 'byung ba dag kho na la rigs kyi /
translated: Since there is no error in the characteristics of cause and effect, it is reasonable that cause and effect occur sequentially, but not simultaneously, because there would be error.

original: 'khrul ba'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba dag la ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba dag la ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase “in the world” indicates that this is the opinion of ordinary people.

original: 'o na ni dbyu gu gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ni dbyu gu gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If this is so, then how do you interpret the following passage from the sutra:🔽Just as the three sticks rest in dependence on each other, so the aggregates, elements, and sense bases rest in dependence on karma and the afflictions, and karma and the afflictions rest in dependence on the six sense bases.🔽The six sense bases rest in dependence on name and form, and name and form rest in dependence on ignorance.🔽The three sticks rest in dependence on each other, and so on.

original: ji ltar dbyu gu gsum phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa de bzhin du lha gcig 'byung ba gang dag phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa de dag phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dbyu gu gsum phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa de bzhin du lha gcig 'byung ba gang dag phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa de dag phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The three sticks rest in dependence on each other through the power of their mutual support. In the same way, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases rest in dependence on karma and the afflictions, and karma and the afflictions rest in dependence on the six sense bases.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni phan tshun stobs dang 'byung ba'i @206b stobs kyis gnas pa ma yin te /🔽'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni phan tshun stobs dang 'byung ba'i @206b stobs kyis gnas pa ma yin te /🔽'o na ci zhe na /
translated: The six sense bases rest in dependence on name and form, and name and form rest in dependence on ignorance.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi stobs kyis yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi stobs kyis yin no //
translated: It is by the power of its own characteristic.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the others.

original: re zhig ci 'di dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: re zhig ci 'di dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: First, the passage beginning with “Are these” is as follows.

original: dbyu gu gsum ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbyu gu gsum ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: The three sticks are not enduring because they are momentary.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: ji srid de ltar skyes pa dang 'gal ba'i rkyen med kyi bar du de ltar gnas pa'i skad cig ma snga ma snga ma'i rgyu can skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma mngon par chogs te gnas ba skye ba yin no //
analyzed: ji srid de ltar skyes pa dang 'gal ba'i rkyen med kyi bar du de ltar gnas pa'i skad cig ma snga ma snga ma'i rgyu can skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma mngon par chogs te gnas ba skye ba yin no //
translated: As long as there is no condition that arises and contradicts them, the prior moments that endure in that way are the causes of the subsequent moments that are generated and endure.

original: phan tshun gyi stobs kho nas de na gnas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun gyi stobs kho nas de na gnas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not endure by the power of each other.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de la gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The passage continues, “In dependence on another . . .”

original: de ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: bshad pa / srad bu ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / srad bu ste /
translated: It is explained:🔽It is the string.

original: dbyu gu gsum la bcings pa'am /
analyzed: dbyu gu gsum la bcings pa'am /
translated: The three sticks are bound by the string,

original: gzer bu'am / 'og tu rten par byed pa sa'o //
analyzed: gzer bu'am / 'og tu rten par byed pa sa'o //
translated: or the string is the nail or the support below.

original: de lta na dpe don dang mi mtshungs so //
analyzed: de lta na dpe don dang mi mtshungs so //
translated: In that case, the example and meaning are not similar.

original: de dag la yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni mtshungs par ston par byed do /
analyzed: de dag la yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni mtshungs par ston par byed do /
translated: The word “also” indicates that they are similar.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba de dag la yang skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa gzhan dag yod do //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba de dag la yang skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa gzhan dag yod do //
translated: Those that arise simultaneously also have other causes, such as homogeneous causes.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni kun du 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa dang / byed rgyu'i rgyu la sogs pa dag gzung gi / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni kun du 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa dang / byed rgyu'i rgyu la sogs pa dag gzung gi / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes omnipresent causes, fruitional causes, and active causes, but not conjoined causes.

original: de dag ni srad bu la sogs pa dang 'dra ba yin pas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu grub pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni srad bu la sogs pa dang 'dra ba yin pas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu grub pa'o //
translated: Since they are like a string and so on, they are established as coemergent causes.

original: skal mnyam rgyu ni 'dra ba'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni 'dra ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: skal mnyam rgyu ni 'dra ba'o // zhes bya ba la / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni 'dra ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: Homogeneous causes are similar.🔽Homogeneous causes are similar.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na 'dra ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na 'dra ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Homogeneous causes are similar, but not all homogeneous causes are similar.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang 'dra pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang 'dra pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Omnipresent causes are also similar.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i 'bras bu nye ba dang ring ba bskyed pa dang gsos 'debs par byed pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i 'bras bu nye ba dang ring ba bskyed pa dang gsos 'debs par byed pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Homogeneous cause is so called because it generates and nourishes homogeneous results that are similar to itself, whether they arise immediately or after a gap.

original: 'dra ba'i chos de dag kyang phan tshun chos 'dra ba rnams kyi yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i chos de dag kyang phan tshun chos 'dra ba rnams kyi yin te /
translated: Those similar phenomena are homogeneous causes of each other.

original: dge ba'i gzugs ni lnga po dag kho na'i yin pa nas dge ba'i rnam par shes pa ni lnga po dag gi bar du yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i gzugs ni lnga po dag kho na'i yin pa nas dge ba'i rnam par shes pa ni lnga po dag gi bar du yin no //
translated: For example, virtuous form is a homogeneous cause of the five types of virtuous form and so on up to virtuous consciousness is a homogeneous cause of the five types of virtuous consciousness.

original: nyon mongs pa can ni phan tshun du nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni phan tshun du nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi yin la /
translated: Also afflicted states are homogeneous causes of each other.

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni phan tshun du lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi yin na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni phan tshun du lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi yin na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Also neutral states are homogeneous causes of each other.🔽Others say:

original: gzhan dag na re lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Form is not a homogeneous cause of formless realm states because it is not clear.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa rnams ni gsal ba @207a * //🔽yin gyi gzugs ni ma yin la /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa rnams ni gsal ba @207a * //🔽yin gyi gzugs ni ma yin la /
translated: Feeling and so on are clear because they possess focal objects.

original: mi gsal ba ni gsal ba'i 'bras bur mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni gsal ba'i 'bras bur mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for a clear state to be the effect of an unclear state.

original: dman pa'i rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa can gyi 'bras bu yin pa bkag gi / gsal ba mi gsal ba yin pa ni ma bkag ste /
analyzed: dman pa'i rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa can gyi 'bras bu yin pa bkag gi / gsal ba mi gsal ba yin pa ni ma bkag ste /
translated: The cause of a clear state is not a cause that is accompanied by manifest effort, but it is not the case that a clear state is not the effect of an unclear state.

original: de lta ma yin na rnam par shes pa'i yang gsum po yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnam par shes pa'i yang gsum po yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, then consciousness would not have three types of effects.

original: dngos po tsam la lta ba nyid kyis nyung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tsam la lta ba nyid kyis nyung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It would have only one type of effect, because it would only be a cause that is accompanied by manifest effort.

original: nur nur po ni nur nur po la sogs pa gnas skabs bcu po dag gi yin no zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba la /🔽nur nur po dang / mer mer po dang / gor gor po dang / mkhrang 'gyur dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa'i gnas skabs rnams ni mngal gyi gnas skabs lnga'o //
analyzed: nur nur po ni nur nur po la sogs pa gnas skabs bcu po dag gi yin no zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba la / nur nur po dang / mer mer po dang / gor gor po dang / mkhrang 'gyur dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa'i gnas skabs rnams ni mngal gyi gnas skabs lnga'o //
translated: The state of kalala is the effect of ten states, beginning with kalala.🔽The five states of the womb are the state of kalala, the state of arbuda, the state of peśin, the state of ghana, and the state of praśākhā.

original: byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / long tsho dang / bar ma dang / rgan po'i gnas rnams ni btsas pa'i gnas skabs lnga'o //
analyzed: byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / long tsho dang / bar ma dang / rgan po'i gnas rnams ni btsas pa'i gnas skabs lnga'o //
translated: The five states after birth are the states of the infant, the youth, the middle-aged person, the older person, and the elderly person.

original: de la nur nur po'i gnas skabs 'phel ba yin ba'i phyir sngar skyes pa phyis skye ba'i gnas skabs kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pas gnas skabs bcu char dag gi yang rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de la nur nur po'i gnas skabs 'phel ba yin ba'i phyir sngar skyes pa phyis skye ba'i gnas skabs kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pas gnas skabs bcu char dag gi yang rgyu yin no //
translated: Because the state of kalala increases, it is the homogeneous cause of the state that arises later. Thus it is the cause of all ten states.

original: de bzhin du mer mer po la sogs pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mer mer po la sogs pa rnams kyang /
translated: Similarly, arbuda, etc.,🔽are the homogeneous cause of arbuda, etc.

original: mer mer po la sogs pa dag gi yin no zhes thams cad la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mer mer po la sogs pa dag gi yin no zhes thams cad la brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be stated for all.

original: re re phri nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: re re phri nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Subtracting one by one

original: 'dir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ni snga ma 'am lhan cig pa yin par rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin pas ro re phri nas zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ni snga ma 'am lhan cig pa yin par rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin pas ro re phri nas zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: means that since the result of the homogeneous cause is not posited as prior or simultaneous, it is explained as subtracting one by one.

original: de ltar na dang po'i nur nur po'i gzugs rgyu med pa dang / tha ma'i rgan po 'bras bu med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na dang po'i nur nur po'i gzugs rgyu med pa dang / tha ma'i rgan po 'bras bu med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Thus it follows that the form of the initial kalala would be without a cause and the final old age would be without a result.

original: de'i phyir ris mthun gcig la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ris mthun gcig la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, in one life

original: skye ba gcig la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skye ba gcig la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: in one birth.

original: rnam pa mthun pa gzhan du ni //
analyzed: rnam pa mthun pa gzhan du ni //
translated: The other is similar to that.🔽

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other homogeneous states are homogeneous causes.

original: dper na sngar skyes pa'i mi'i ris mthun pas bsdus pa'i gnas skabs bcu po dag ni phyis skyes pa'i mi'i ris mthun pas bsdus pa'i gnas skabs bcu char gyi yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: dper na sngar skyes pa'i mi'i ris mthun pas bsdus pa'i gnas skabs bcu po dag ni phyis skyes pa'i mi'i ris mthun pas bsdus pa'i gnas skabs bcu char gyi yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: For example, the ten states of the human type that arose previously are homogeneous causes of the ten states of the human type that arose later.

original: 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sngar skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sngar skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are homogeneous and they arose previously.

original: phyi'i dag la yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyi'i dag la yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The external states are also like this.

original: nas dang s'a lu la sogs pa dag la yang tshul 'di nyid kyis ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nas dang s'a lu la sogs pa dag la yang tshul 'di nyid kyis ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should explain the external states of barley, rice, etc., in the same way, as appropriate.

original: mdo sde pa kha cig na re gzugs la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu med kyi /
analyzed: mdo sde pa kha cig na re gzugs la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu med kyi /
translated: Some Sautrantikas say that form does not have homogeneous causes.

original: de ni rkyen la rag las te /🔽skye ba @207b yin te /
analyzed: de ni rkyen la rag las te / skye ba @207b yin te /
translated: It arises in dependence on conditions.

original: khron pa'i gting nas drangs pa'i sa las myu gu skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khron pa'i gting nas drangs pa'i sa las myu gu skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, sprouts arise from the earth that is brought up from the bottom of a well.

original: 'di ltar de la de'i sa bon yod pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ba de dag gi dbang du byas nas gang dag gzugs kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la de'i sa bon yod pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ba de dag gi dbang du byas nas gang dag gzugs kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: But they do not exist in the way that seeds exist in the future.

original: rgyu dang bdag po zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen no zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //🔽de la 'dod pa'i khams 'byung ba chen po rnams ni skyes zin pa'i phyir dang / ma bsgrubs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir dang / gzugs yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: rgyu dang bdag po zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen no zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o // de la 'dod pa'i khams 'byung ba chen po rnams ni skyes zin pa'i phyir dang / ma bsgrubs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir dang / gzugs yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba dang /
translated: The phrase “the cause and the dominant condition” refers to the causal condition and the dominant condition.🔽The great elements of the desire realm are not the co-existent cause, the homogeneous cause, the pervasive cause, or the cause of karmic maturation of the future great elements, because they are already arisen, because they are not established, and because they are not declared.

original: rnam par smin pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ma yin te /🔽'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ma yin te / 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: They are not the dominant condition of the future great elements, because they are not form.

original: 'dra ba'i phyir dang / sngar skyes pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin zhing rkyen rnams las bdag po'i rkyen yin par shes so //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i phyir dang / sngar skyes pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin zhing rkyen rnams las bdag po'i rkyen yin par shes so //
translated: But they are the homogeneous cause of the future great elements, because they are similar to them, and they are the dominant condition of the future great elements, because they arise earlier.

original: 'dir rgyu med par skye ba ni rigs pa dang 'gal bar snang ste /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu med par skye ba ni rigs pa dang 'gal bar snang ste /
translated: Here, arising without a cause appears to contradict reasoning.

original: khron pa'i gting nas bton pa'i sa las yang myu gu skyes pa'i snga rol nas sa bon dag yod mod kyi rkyen dang bral ba'i phyir myu gu dang / lo ma dang / tshigs 'chas pa la sogs pa dag mi skye'o //
analyzed: khron pa'i gting nas bton pa'i sa las yang myu gu skyes pa'i snga rol nas sa bon dag yod mod kyi rkyen dang bral ba'i phyir myu gu dang / lo ma dang / tshigs 'chas pa la sogs pa dag mi skye'o //
translated: For, although seeds exist in the earth that is dug up from the bottom of a well, sprouts, leaves, nodes, and so on do not arise from them because they are devoid of conditions.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If that were not so,

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu med na ni thams cad de las skye ba'am /
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu med na ni thams cad de las skye ba'am /
translated: then everything would arise from everything,

original: yang na cung zad kyang mi skye ste /
analyzed: yang na cung zad kyang mi skye ste /
translated: or else nothing would arise from anything,

original: nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dis ni rva las 'dam bu skye'o zhes bya bar yang gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro // 'dis ni rva las 'dam bu skye'o zhes bya bar yang gsal ba yin te /
translated: because there would be no definite cause.🔽This also clarifies the statement, “A reed arises from a reed.”

original: 'di ltar rva la yang 'dam bu'i sa bon yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rva la yang 'dam bu'i sa bon yod pa yin no //
translated: For, a reed also contains the seed of a reed.

original: 'dra ba nyid nges par ma dpyad pa'i thams cad thams cad kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin na de lta na sa dgu pa rnams dang ; ris lnga pa rnams phan tshun skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur thal bar 'gyur na rigs pa yang ma yin pas 'dra ba nyid nges par dpyad par bya pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid nges par ma dpyad pa'i thams cad thams cad kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin na de lta na sa dgu pa rnams dang ; ris lnga pa rnams phan tshun skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur thal bar 'gyur na rigs pa yang ma yin pas 'dra ba nyid nges par dpyad par bya pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: But that is illogical. Therefore, similarity must be analyzed.🔽The question is asked:

original: ci 'dra ba thams cad ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ci 'dra ba thams cad ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Are all similar states homogeneous causes?

original: de lta na yang phyis skyes pa yang sngar skyes pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin zhing /
analyzed: de lta na yang phyis skyes pa yang sngar skyes pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin zhing /
translated: Even though that is so, later states are homogeneous causes of earlier states.

original: lhan cig skyes pa yang lhan cig skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa yang lhan cig skyes pa yin la /
translated: And coemergent states are homogeneous causes of coemergent states.

original: ma skyes pa yang skyes pa yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang skyes pa yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And nonarisen states are homogeneous causes of arisen states.

original: de'i phyir / de dag kyang thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de dag kyang thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “They are not all.”

original: 'o na ci zhe na /🔽sngar skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / sngar skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: What are they?🔽The root text states, “Those that arise earlier.”

original: snga rol du skyes pa ni sngar skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: snga rol du skyes pa ni sngar skyes pa rnams so //
translated: Those that arise earlier are earlier states.

original: sngar skyes @208a * //🔽pa nyid kyis ni 'das pa dang / da ltar ba gzung zhing ma 'ongs pa bkag ste /🔽chos 'das pa rnams ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: sngar skyes @208a * // pa nyid kyis ni 'das pa dang / da ltar ba gzung zhing ma 'ongs pa bkag ste / chos 'das pa rnams ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Because they have already arisen, they are homogeneous causes of past and present states, but not future states.🔽Past phenomena are homogeneous causes of past, future, and present phenomena.

original: da ltar byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi yin gyi /
translated: Present phenomena are homogeneous causes of future phenomena.

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //🔽'di gang las zhes bya ba ni ci lung ngam /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro // 'di gang las zhes bya ba ni ci lung ngam /
translated: But future phenomena are never homogeneous causes.🔽From what source is this known?

original: 'on te rigs ba las yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te rigs ba las yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Is it from scripture or reasoning?

original: bstan bcos las te zhes bya bas ni lung ston par byed do //
analyzed: bstan bcos las te zhes bya bas ni lung ston par byed do //
translated: It is from the treatise, which states:

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is a homogeneous cause?

original: dge pa'i rtsa ba sngar byung ba rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: dge pa'i rtsa ba sngar byung ba rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Previously arisen virtuous roots are homogeneous causes of later arisen virtuous roots.

original: 'das pa rnams ni 'das ba dang / da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: 'das pa rnams ni 'das ba dang / da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Past states are homogeneous causes of past, present, and future states.

original: da ltar byung ba rnams ni ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams ni ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi yin gyi /
translated: Present states are homogeneous causes of future states.

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi ma yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi ma yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: But future states are not homogeneous causes of future states.

original: de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa med do zhes bya bar rtogs so zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa med do zhes bya bar rtogs so zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: Therefore it is understood that future states are not homogeneous causes.

original: gal te bstan bcos tshad mar byed na gang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dus gsum pa nyid du ston pa 'di yang bstan bcos yin no //
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos tshad mar byed na gang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dus gsum pa nyid du ston pa 'di yang bstan bcos yin no //
translated: If you accept the treatise, then this treatise teaches that homogeneous causes exist in the three times.

original: smras pa nam yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smras pa nam yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The response is never.

original: skabs su bab pa'i phyir rgyu ma yin ba ma yin no zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i phyir rgyu ma yin ba ma yin no zhes sbyar te /
translated: But it is not that they are never causes.

original: dus gsum kar yang rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus gsum kar yang rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they are causes in all three times.

original: 'dis ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This teaches that future states are homogeneous causes.

original: des ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni nam yang ma yin no zhes bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa bzhin du yang bkag pas bstan bcos 'gal pa'i nyes pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: des ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni nam yang ma yin no zhes bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa bzhin du yang bkag pas bstan bcos 'gal pa'i nyes pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, since future states are also refuted like homogeneous causes, the treatise is not contradictory.

original: phal che ba'i tshul las rten nas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phal che ba'i tshul las rten nas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The treatise mentions “generally speaking” because it intends to speak of coemergent causes and so on.

original: 'di ltar de dag gi snga phyi'i rim pa med pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mi 'dra ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pa yang yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi snga phyi'i rim pa med pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mi 'dra ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pa yang yin par 'dod do //
translated: Because there is no sequence of earlier and later states and because causes and effects are not similar, future states are also asserted to be homogeneous causes.

original: gang zhig chos ma 'ongs pa de yang zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gang zhig chos ma 'ongs pa de yang zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
translated: That future state is also a homogeneous cause of future states.

original: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa ni gegs thams cad log pa yin pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du nges te /
analyzed: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa ni gegs thams cad log pa yin pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du nges te /
translated: That which is about to arise is definitely a homogeneous cause because all obstructions to its arising have ceased.

original: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs tha ma la dgongs nas @208b nam yang rgyu ma yin ba ma yin nyes gsungs pas ma 'ongs pa yang skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs tha ma la dgongs nas @208b nam yang rgyu ma yin ba ma yin nyes gsungs pas ma 'ongs pa yang skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, with the final period of the future in mind, it is said that it is never not a cause. Thus, because the future is a homogeneous cause, there is no contradiction with the treatise.

original: de'i de ni lan du mi rung ste //🔽zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de'i de ni lan du mi rung ste // zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: But that is not a proper response.

original: tha ma'i gnas skabs la dgongs pa yin na ni med pa'i phyir skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs na ma byung ba las byung ba yin pa de'i phyir nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di 'gal te /
analyzed: tha ma'i gnas skabs la dgongs pa yin na ni med pa'i phyir skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs na ma byung ba las byung ba yin pa de'i phyir nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di 'gal te /
translated: If the final period is intended, then because it does not exist, it is contradictory to say, “It is arising from what did not previously exist in the state of arising, and therefore it is never not a cause.”

original: gnas skabs thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos po gsal bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos po gsal bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the state of being a cause of all states is made clear.

original: chos gang zhig chos gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽mtshungs pa de ma thag pa zhes bya ba ni//
analyzed: chos gang zhig chos gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa zhes bya ba ni//
translated: With regard to any phenomenon that is the cause of any phenomenon,🔽the phrase “an equivalent immediately preceding condition” means

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: an equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: rtogs pa 'dis zhes bya ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la byas pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa 'dis zhes bya ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la byas pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: That which is called “realization” is the homogeneous cause.🔽That nonarisen phenomenon, when it is in the state of arising, is ascertained as the equivalent immediately preceding condition because it eliminates all obstructions.

original: chos ma skyes pa de ni skye ba'i tshe'i gnas skabs na gegs thams cad bsal ba yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rgyu'i dngos por nges pas nam yang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin bzhin du
analyzed: chos ma skyes pa de ni skye ba'i tshe'i gnas skabs na gegs thams cad bsal ba yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rgyu'i dngos por nges pas nam yang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin bzhin du
translated: Therefore it is never not the equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: / ci'i phyir 'di skad du gal te zhes bya ba rgya cher smras so //
analyzed: / ci'i phyir 'di skad du gal te zhes bya ba rgya cher smras so //
translated: But why does he say, “If it is the future state of an existent phenomenon”?

original: gal te zhes bya ba la gal te chos de ma 'ongs pa yin na ni chos de lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la gal te chos de ma 'ongs pa yin na ni chos de lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is the future state of an existent phenomenon, then that phenomenon is not a coemergent condition.

original: tha ma'i gnas skabs smra bas /🔽der ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: tha ma'i gnas skabs smra bas / der ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: The final state is stated.🔽He says, “Just as it is there, so it is here.”

original: der ji lta ba bzhin du 'dir yang brjod par bya la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: der ji lta ba bzhin du 'dir yang brjod par bya la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Just as it is there, so it is here.

original: ji ltar de nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang nam yang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa ma yin pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar de nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang nam yang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa ma yin pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: Just as it is said that it is never not a cause, so too here it should be said that it is never not an equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: ji ltar 'dir gal te chos de ma skyes pa yin na'o zhes bya ba yin pa de bzhin du der yang gal te chos de ma skyes par 'gyur na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir gal te chos de ma skyes pa yin na'o zhes bya ba yin pa de bzhin du der yang gal te chos de ma skyes par 'gyur na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: And just as here it is said, “If that phenomenon has not arisen,” so too there it should be said, “If that phenomenon has not arisen.”

original: de ltar na 'dir bstan bcos byed pa mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir bstan bcos byed pa mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, here the author of the treatise is not skilled in grammar.

original: gang gi phyir nam yang ma yin no zhes smras pas go skabs ma phye ba yin yang gal te chos de ma skyes par 'gyur na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa ma yin no zhes bya bas go skabs phye ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nam yang ma yin no zhes smras pas go skabs ma phye ba yin yang gal te chos de ma skyes par 'gyur na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa ma yin no zhes bya bas go skabs phye ba yin no //
translated: Because he says “never,” he does not open the opportunity, but if he says “If that phenomenon has not arisen,” he opens the opportunity.

original: de lta bas na lan snga ma kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de lta bas na lan snga ma kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, the former response is better.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las @209a * //🔽dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las @209a * // dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: concomitant cause, and cause of ripening.🔽The Vaibhāṣika: The Fortunate One, in fact, had in mind the future factors when he said this.

original: 'o na gang 'di skad du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //🔽ma gtogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba yang yin la /🔽'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'o na gang 'di skad du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo // ma gtogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba yang yin la / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: But if the future factors exist, why did the Fortunate One say:🔽“The non-arisen factors, O bhikṣus, are of great utility.”🔽The Vaibhāṣika: The Fortunate One, in fact, had in mind the future factors when he said this.🔽The Fortunate One, in fact, had in mind the future factors when he said this.🔽The Fortunate One, in fact, had in mind the future factors when he said this.

original: 'di ni 'dir ma 'ongs pa skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yod do zhes bya ba'i khungs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir ma 'ongs pa skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yod do zhes bya ba'i khungs yin no //

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The Fortunate One, in fact, had in mind the future factors when he said this.

original: gang las 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'am /
analyzed: gang las 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'am /
translated: The Fortunate One,

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu nyid du rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ba /🔽tshogs pa de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu nyid du rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ba / tshogs pa de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: They would be posited as coemergent causes,

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang ma yin la /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro // lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang ma yin la /
translated: but another afflicted view of the self does not exist in that collection because they are not coemergent causes.🔽They are not karmic maturation causes because they are neutral.

original: thun mong ba nyid du bgrang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir byed rgyu'i rgyu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: thun mong ba nyid du bgrang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir byed rgyu'i rgyu yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not active cause because they are not counted as shared states.🔽Therefore they are only homogeneous causes.

original: lhag mar gyur pas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na mngon par bzhed pas 'dir lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu la dgongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lhag mar gyur pas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na mngon par bzhed pas 'dir lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu la dgongs pa ma yin no //
translated: Here the intention is not to include coemergent, concomitant, and karmic maturation causes.

original: des na lan snga ma kho na legs pa yin no zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: des na lan snga ma kho na legs pa yin no zhes brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore it is not to be said that the former response is better.🔽This is stated in the Abhidharmakosa:

original: 'di skad du 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Future afflicted view of the self is concomitant with🔽the five aggregates.

original: de skad du 'don ba'i khyad par gyis ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu spangs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de skad du 'don ba'i khyad par gyis ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu spangs par 'gyur la /
translated: The difference in the recitation indicates that the homogeneous cause is abandoned,

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the co-existent cause and the associated cause are obtained.

original: don gyis na de ltar go bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don gyis na de ltar go bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning is to be understood in this way.

original: gal te rab tu grags pa'i phyir 'don pa gzhan du bya ba ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gal te rab tu grags pa'i phyir 'don pa gzhan du bya ba ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that the recitation should not be changed because it is well known,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na snga phyi'i rim pa med pa'i phyir ma skyes pa la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid dang ; kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid mi srid do zhes don gyis na de ltar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na snga phyi'i rim pa med pa'i phyir ma skyes pa la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid dang ; kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid mi srid do zhes don gyis na de ltar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: then the meaning is to be understood in this way: because there is no sequence of earlier and later in the future, it is impossible for future states to be a homogeneous cause or a pervasive cause of future states that have not yet arisen.

original: bzhi tshan du nges pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzhi tshan du nges pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fourfold division is definite.

original: chos gang zhig chos gang gi rgyu yin pa ni nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos gang zhig chos gang gi rgyu yin pa ni nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: A phenomenon that is the cause of a certain phenomenon is never not a cause,

original: dus gsum dag tu yang rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus gsum dag tu yang rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that it is a cause in all three times.

original: 'bras bu dang / rten dang / @209b dmigs pa yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / rten dang / @209b dmigs pa yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The result, support, and object should be stated in the same way.

original: de'i phyir rgyu rnams ni 'bras bu la sogs pa ltar gnas skabs thams cad nges pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu rnams ni 'bras bu la sogs pa ltar gnas skabs thams cad nges pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, causes are definitely in all states, like results and so on.

original: 'dir rgyu ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Here, a cause is a homogeneous cause, etc.

original: 'dir thams cad ces bya ba'i sgras ni chos 'dus byas rnams sam ;
analyzed: 'dir thams cad ces bya ba'i sgras ni chos 'dus byas rnams sam ;
translated: Here, the term all refers to conditioned phenomena or

original: sems dang sems las byung ba yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: mind and mental factors.

original: thams cad la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Not all have a ripened result,

original: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: therefore they are not a cause of karmic maturation.

original: bye brag med par 'jug pa'i phyir byed rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bye brag med par 'jug pa'i phyir byed rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor are they a productive cause, because they function without distinction.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na snga phyi'i rim pa med pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na snga phyi'i rim pa med pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor are they homogeneous or omnipresent causes, because there is no sequence of earlier and later in the future.

original: chos thams cad la yod pa'i phyir skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dag kho na yongs su gzung gi / gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la yod pa'i phyir skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dag kho na yongs su gzung gi / gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
translated: Because they exist for all phenomena, only the active and dominant results are posited, but not others.

original: chos thams cad la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not exist for all phenomena.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa yin par khas mi len pa la yang nyes pa de yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa yin par khas mi len pa la yang nyes pa de yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This error also applies to the assertion that future states are homogeneous causes.🔽To demonstrate this, he says,

original: de lta na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //🔽skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu da ltar ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so // skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu da ltar ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: in that case,

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin na de lta na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa las yin par gyur to zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin na de lta na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa las yin par gyur to zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if present states are homogeneous causes, but future states are not, then it would follow that future states would become homogeneous causes from not being homogeneous causes.

original: de'i phyir dus thams cad kyi tshe yod pa nyid du dam bcas pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus thams cad kyi tshe yod pa nyid du dam bcas pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, this contradicts the assertion that they exist at all times.

original: gnas skabs la ni 'dod pa kho na yin gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gnas skabs la ni 'dod pa kho na yin gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The Abhidharmakośa mentions, “They assert that they exist only in terms of state.”

original: 'dis ni rdzas thams cad kyi tshe yod pa nyid du dam 'cha'i /
analyzed: 'dis ni rdzas thams cad kyi tshe yod pa nyid du dam 'cha'i /
translated: This means that they assert that all substances exist at all times.

original: gnas skabs rnams ni ma yin pas 'gal ba med par ston to //
analyzed: gnas skabs rnams ni ma yin pas 'gal ba med par ston to //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction.

original: chos ni tshogs pa'i dbang gis gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: chos ni tshogs pa'i dbang gis gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur gyi /
translated: A phenomenon changes to another state through the power of a collection of causes and conditions.

original: med pa ni chos gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: med pa ni chos gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that a nonexistent phenomenon changes to another state.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa ni gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu can kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa ni gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu can kho na yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, a collection has only a state as its effect,

original: rdzas kyi 'bras bu can ma yin pas nyes pa 'di med do //
analyzed: rdzas kyi 'bras bu can ma yin pas nyes pa 'di med do //
translated: but not a substantial entity as its effect. Thus, there is no fault.

original: gal te rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gzhan du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gzhan du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: If the cause of karmic maturation were future, then the treatise would mention it.

original: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
translated: What would happen?

original: skyon ci 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: skyon ci 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What fault would there be?

original: gal te rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bzhin du ma 'ongs pa yin par 'gyur na ni bstan bcos las de yang smos par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bzhin du ma 'ongs pa yin par 'gyur na ni bstan bcos las de yang smos par 'gyur na /
translated: If the cause of karmic maturation were future, then the treatise would mention it.

original: smos pa ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: smos pa ni yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it does not mention it.🔽The treatise mentions:

original: de las ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma 'ongs pa rnams ni dge pa'i rtsa ba ma 'ongs pa @210a * //
analyzed: de las ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma 'ongs pa rnams ni dge pa'i rtsa ba ma 'ongs pa @210a * //
translated: Future roots of virtue are either future roots of virtue or present roots of virtue.

original: rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes ma gsungs te /
analyzed: rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes ma gsungs te /
translated: But it does not say that they are homogeneous causes of those.

original: de'i phyir / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs par rtogs na bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //🔽'bras bu 'byin pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs par rtogs na bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro // 'bras bu 'byin pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, if future states are understood to be homogeneous causes, then this would contradict the treatise.

original: 'dis ni bstan bcos dang 'gal ba spong ngo //
analyzed: 'dis ni bstan bcos dang 'gal ba spong ngo //
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

original: 'bras bu 'byin par nus pa ni 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin par nus pa ni 'das pa yin la /
translated: The past is able to yield a result.

original: 'bras bu 'dzin par nus pa ni da ltar ba yin zhing /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dzin par nus pa ni da ltar ba yin zhing /
translated: The present is able to hold a result.🔽The future is not able to yield a result or hold a result.

original: 'ga' zhig 'byin pa yang yin na ma 'ongs pa de ltar 'bras bu 'byin pa dang / 'dzin par byed nus pa ma yin pas bstan bcos las ma smos kyi /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'byin pa yang yin na ma 'ongs pa de ltar 'bras bu 'byin pa dang / 'dzin par byed nus pa ma yin pas bstan bcos las ma smos kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not mentioned in the treatise.

original: med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not because it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction with the treatise.

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is not so.

original: ma 'ongs pa 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin par mi nus pa'i phyir ma smos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin par mi nus pa'i phyir ma smos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that future states are not mentioned because they are not able to yield or hold a result.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what is the meaning of the statement in the treatise?

original: med pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not exist.

original: 'di ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that?

original: de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te ;
translated: Therefore it says, “homogeneous cause is a cause that produces results similar to itself.”

original: rgyu mthun pa ni rgyu dang 'dra ba yin la /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa ni rgyu dang 'dra ba yin la /
translated: Homogeneous means similar to a cause.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang /
translated: A homogeneous cause is also said to be:

original: rgyu mthun skal mnyam kun 'gro ba'i //
analyzed: rgyu mthun skal mnyam kun 'gro ba'i //
translated: A homogeneous cause is a cause that produces results similar to itself.

original: zhes 'byung ba des 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin na de ni ma 'ongs ba la rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba des 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin na de ni ma 'ongs ba la rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If it has a result, it is illogical for it to be future,

original: snga phyi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga phyi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no earlier or later.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs su 'di ni snga ma'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs su 'di ni snga ma'o //
translated: In the future state, this is earlier and this is later.
